Choice Scarf (Steel).description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Stallbreaker (Fire).description:
Heavy Slam OHKOs Flutter Mane.

This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

vgc2024.overview:
• Heatran is a niche bulky offensive threat thanks to its solid stats and great typing, bolstered by Flash Fire. This makes Heatran have an incredible matchup against most of the metagame, such as Flutter Mane and Gholdengo.

  • Rillaboom is a great partner for Heatran, as it resists Heatran's prominent weaknesses, while also hitting Pokemon like Ogerpon-W and Urshifu-R for huge damage. Heatran also pairs well with Ogerpon-W, which supports Heatran with Follow Me, as well as threatening Urshifu-R and Landorus.

  • Although Heatran resists a lot of attacks with its typing, it's weak to both of the Urshifu formes, Ogerpon-W, Landorus, and Iron Hands. Heatran also faces tough Fire- and Steel- competition, especially with Incineroar.

Bulky Attacker.description:
• The combination of Heatran's STAB moves, Heat Wave and Flash Cannon, can hit a lot of Pokemon in the metagame super-effectively, while Earth Power is a good coverage move that can hit Pokemon that resist Heatran's STAB combination, like Incineroar. Magma Storm is also another option as a Fire-type attack, as it traps the opponent, which works well with Leftovers.

  • Leftovers is a good item choice for Heatran, as it can live two Shadow Balls from Flutter Mane with a Special Attack-Booster Energy, and with Rillaboom's Grassy Surge, Heatran can constantly restore HP. Life Orb can increase Heatran's damage output, making it more of a threat.

  • 228 HP, 84 Defense EVs, and 20 Special Defense EVs allow Heatran to take an Ivy Cudgel from Ogerpon-W, almost always survives a Sludge Bomb from Landorus after Heatran Terastallizes and Life Orb recoil, and finally, with 20 Speed EVs, Heatran outspeeds both Urshifu formes after a Speed drop.

  • Tera Grass is an excellent Tera type for Heatran, allowing it to resist Water- and Ground-type moves from the likes of Pokemon like Urshifu-R and Landorus. Tera Fairy can allow Heatran to resist Urshifu-S's STAB moves and be a neutral type against the metagame.

Defensive.description: Heatran's typing, ability, and solid bulk allow it to function as a switch-in to many common offensive threats including Tapu Lele, Volcarona, and Victini. Magma Storm allows Heatran to trap and KO passive foes such as Toxapex, Blissey, Ting-Lu, and Clodsire, although it must Terastallize to take care of the latter two. Taunt allows it to effectively shut down trapped foes, denying recovery and preventing Toxic after Terastallizing, thus making its trapping capabilities more pronounced. Earth Power allows Heatran to hit Garganacl, Toxapex, and opposing Heatran, and it is a generally safe and accurate option against most trapped foes. Stealth Rock allows Heatran to lay entry hazards, especially in front of a trapped foe or after forcing out a foe, while Toxic is useful for wearing down switch-ins to Heatran such as Mega Gyarados. Tera Grass allows Heatran to shed its weaknesses and gain a unique defensive profile, walling most Pokemon that rely on Ground-type moves to hit it including Mega Charizard Y, Gliscor, and Clodsire. However, Heatran must still be wary when using its Tera, as it becomes more vulnerable to foes like Zapdos and Mega Scizor. Even without Special Attack investment, Heatran still poses a threat to opposing Fire-resistant foes such as Rotom-W and Garchomp, as they cannot switch in too many times without getting worn down. Allies like Volcarona appreciate Heatran pressuring foes like Toxapex and opposing Heatran for them. Heatran's ability to check Tapu Lele is also very useful for allies like Urshifu-R and Iron Valiant, as Tapu Lele is a commonly seen Choice item user, and Heatran's scouting allows teammates to safely double switch in once Heatran forces out Tapu Lele. Defensively, Heatran appreciates allies that can take Ground-type moves for it, reducing its need to Terastallize and thus saving it for a more deserving ally. Partners like Rotom-W, Mega Latias, and Gliscor are all immune to Ground-type moves from the likes of Garchomp and Landorus-T, and the former two can also switch into Water-type moves from foes like Urshifu-R while the latter two switch into Fighting-type moves from foes like Mega Lopunny. In exchange, Heatran covers Grass- and Ice-type moves for them. Heatran also has little means to heal off chip damage due to its lack of instant recovery. Thus, entry hazard removers such as Great Tusk and Landorus-T make for good allies. Finally, Alomomola's Wish support is particularly valuable, as it can instantly heal Heatran while remaining healthy itself, and they also cover each other's weaknesses decently well, with Heatran taking Grass-type moves from Mega Charizard Y while Alomomola takes Water-type moves from Hisuian Samurott.

Offensive.description: Heatran occupies a niche as an offensive wallbreaker, especially if opponents assume it is running a defensive set and disregard it as a threat. Heatran's natural bulk also means it can still reliably switch into resisted hits with ease despite not having defensive investment. Magma Storm + Taunt in conjunction with Earth Power allows Heatran to trap and remove foes effectively due to its spike in damage output from its Special Attack investment. Toxic is useful, as it allows Heatran to spread poison on switch-ins like Landorus-T and Alomomola that have pivoting moves to escape Magma Storm, hindering their effectiveness and putting a timer on their HP. Hidden Power Ice is an option to lure Gliscor and Garchomp and remove them for allies, as well as improving Heatran’s matchup against opposing Tera Grass Heatran. Solar Beam in conjunction with Grassium Z allows Heatran to lure and nuke Alomomola, Mega Tyranitar, and Garganacl, OHKOing the former and heavily denting the latter two. Leftovers is useful for recovery, as Heatran has no means of instant recovery; Air Balloon allows it to check opposing Heatran along with foes like Gliscor and Garchomp, threatening massive chip damage or Toxic on them. Tera Grass is useful to check Ground-type move users and also to function as a pest to rain teams in general. Offensive Heatran appreciates pivots like Rotom-W and Landorus-T that can safely bring it in while baiting in Steel-types like Ferrothorn and Corviknight. It also appreciates allies that can switch into Ground- and Fighting-type moves for it, like Tornadus-T, Gliscor, and Zapdos, as they also share checks with Heatran, namely opposing Heatran, Ting-Lu, and Clodsire, and appreciate Heatran chipping or outright removing these checks for them while being useful defensively as well.

Desolate Land.description: Heatran's useful typing and high natural Special Attack make it an effective Stealth Rock setter capable of dissuading common entry hazard removers like Corviknight and Great Tusk from switching in. Desolate Land allows Heatran to soft check opposing Water-types such as offensive Manaphy and users of Primordial Sea like Zapdos, Walking Wake, and Ogerpon-W while also amplifying the power of Magma Storm. Solar Beam allows Heatran to 2HKO opposing RegenVest Swampert, which would otherwise easily switch into it. Will-O-Wisp allows Heatran to incapacitate opposing physical attackers like Roaring Moon, Dragonite, and Iron Boulder that may otherwise be willing to switch into it. Alternatively, Earth Power can hit opposing Heatran, Iron Moth, and Well-Baked Body Gholdengo, while Power Gem can hit opposing Primordial Sea Zapdos and Well-Baked Body Mandibuzz. 60 Speed EVs allow Heatran to outspeed uninvested Gholdengo, with the remaining EVs maximizing its special bulk to better check Pokemon like Azelf and Deoxys-S. Heatran struggles to offensively break through opposing specially defensive Pokemon such as RegenVest Manaphy and Swampert, so physically offensive wallbreakers like Roaring Moon and Chien-Pao are good teammates; in return, Heatran can keep up Stealth Rock in front of entry hazard removers like Corviknight. Heatran's 4x Ground weakness mandates teammates like Corviknight and Zapdos that can answer opposing Ground-types like Great Tusk. Pokemon using Primordial Sea such as Zapdos and Ogerpon-W can switch into and threaten Heatran, so teammates that can check these Pokemon such as Swampert and Dragonite are useful.

Assault Vest.description: Assault Vest Heatran uses its unique typing and defensive stats to match up well against common special attackers such as Flutter Mane and Gholdengo and threaten them back with its great offensive stats and wide coverage. While Heatran boasts an innately good defensive typing, Tera Grass allows it to turn its common weaknesses to Ground and Water into resistances, letting it match up better against the likes of Landorus-T and Palafin-H. Heat Wave is a spread STAB attack that chips away at foes, notably 2HKOing Amoonguss. Flash Cannon is Heatran's best way of hitting Fairy-types, as it OHKOes Diancie and 2HKOes Flutter Mane. Heavy Slam OHKOes Flutter Mane but is generally less reliable because it can be weakened by Intimidate and does less damage to Diancie and opposing Tera Grass Heatran mirror. Tera Blast hits Water- and Ground-types super effectively once Heatran has Terastallized, notably OHKOing Great Tusk and 2HKOing Bulk Up Palafin-H. Earth Power hits the Fire-types such as Volcanion, Chi-Yu, and opposing Heatran that otherwise resists all of Heatran's attacks. Heatran's base resistances let it take common Fairy-, Ice-, and Steel-type attacks such as Flutter Mane's Moonblast, Chien-Pao's Ice Spinner, and Gholdengo's Make It Rain much better. After Terastallization, Heatran matches up better against Palafin-H, Volcanion, and Iron Hands at the cost of receiving more damage from the aforementioned attacks. Heatran has a lot of defensive responsibilities on most teams, so Terastallization should not be used too frivolously. Heatran commonly finds itself in Fire / Water / Grass cores with Rillaboom and Palafin, as they complement each other offensively and defensively, with Rillaboom eradicating Water-types and Palafin punching through Fire-types. Iron Hands is a common Heatran partner that can pressure Palafin and Volcanion with Wild Charge and Chi-Yu and Tera Dark Kingambit with Drain Punch. Heatran has no form of recovery, so it appreciates teammates that can extend its longevity, such as Cresselia with Lunar Blessing and Amoonguss with Pollen Puff.

Specially Defensive (Steel).description: Heatran is a mainstay on Steel teams due to its ability, Flash Fire, letting it switch into threats like Blacephalon, Victini, and Iron Moth. Lava Plume makes Heatran annoying to switch into thanks to its burn chance, while Magma Storm softens walls like Toxapex and Rotom-W by trapping them. Earth Power threatens Poison- and Fire-types and makes Heatran an important asset against opposing Steel teams by hitting opposing Heatran. Roar lets Heatran phaze the likes of Nasty Plot Hydreigon and Z-Celebrate Victini and synergizes well with Stealth Rock to deal extra damage. Alternatively, Toxic cripples walls like Mantine and Rotom-W, as well as Pokemon that fancy switching into Heatran such as Volcarona and Mega Charizard Y. Substitute pairs well with Toxic and allows Heatran to be massively annoying against types like Steel, Electric, and Psychic by capitalizing on the many switches it forces in these matchups. Thanks to their typing and bulk, Corviknight and Celesteela are excellent teammates to check Ground- and Fighting-types like Mamoswine and Great Tusk for Heatran. Setup sweepers like Mega Scizor and Z-Happy Hour Jirachi appreciate Heatran wearing down teams with burn and Toxic. Iron Treads removes entry hazards with Rapid Spin and deals with Mega Charizard Y, Zeraora, and Cinderace with its Choice Scarf set. Ferrothorn checks Water-types like Mega Swampert and Urshifu-R and aids Heatran with Spikes and Leech Seed.

Offensive Utility (Fire).description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Prankster.description: Prankster + Haze Giratina's huge bulk and recovery and disruption options allow it to function as a reliable answer to setup users. Giratina has a wide array of options it can use to disrupt foes attempting to set up: Glare paralyzes fast attackers such as Palkia-O, Encore keeps them locked into moves such as Nasty Plot, Parting Shot lets Giratina pivot and Destiny Bond trades a KO, and Entrainment helps force out ability-dependent attackers. Heavy-Duty Boots helps Giratina switch in more easily without fear of entry hazard chip, while Covert Cloak helps prevent status from moves like Mortal Spin and Nuzzle. Tera Fairy improves Giratina's matchup into opposing Dragon-types such as Koraidon while maintaining a Fighting-type resistance, whereas Tera Dark grants immunity to status moves from opposing Prankster users and a Ghost- and Dark-type resistance for Flutter Mane and Arceus-Dark. Great partners for Prankster Giratina include RegenVest Ting-Lu, Fur Coat Dondozo, and Imposter users thanks to their strong defensive synergy, which allows Giratina to get in more comfortably against Arceus-Ghost and Koraidon.

Magic Bounce.description: Giratina is a great defensive Pokemon that provides utility and disruption with its immunity to Fighting and resistance to powerful attacks like V-create and Rising Voltage. Court Change makes Giratina effective at removing entry hazards against Mold Breaker entry hazard setters and Stone Axe Pokemon. Strength Sap helps with keeping strong physical attackers such as Groudon in check. Whirlwind bypasses Substitute to force out foes, whereas Encore can be used as another form of disruption. Scald is useful for spreading burns, especially against physical attackers such as Groudon and Zamazenta-C. Tera Fairy is great for the immunity to Dragon-type attacks from Koraidon, Eternatus, and Palkia-O, while Tera Dark is great for being resistant to Ghost- and Dark-type attacks from Arceus-Ghost and Hoopa-Unbound. Covert Cloak helps Giratina beat Imposter users and blocks troublesome status from Scald and Mortal Spin. Dondozo and RegenVest Ting-Lu are great partners for Giratina thanks to their physical bulk and complementary typings, which help Giratina against threats such as Eternatus and Arceus-Ghost.

Physical Utility.description:
• Giratina-O is a very potent offensive presence in Ubers thanks to its powerful attacks, superb bulk, and passable Speed stat that lets it outspeed common defensive pieces like Ting-Lu, Clodsire, and most Landorus-T and Gliscor variants. Levitate grants it an invaluable immunity to the ever-present Spikes, allowing it to work as a wallbreaker that demands other kind of counterplay, like the less common Stealth Rock.
  • However, Giratina-O gets outsped by the entirety of the offensive metagame. While strong, Giratina-O doesn't achieve any notable OHKOs, thus many common Pokemon like Landorus-T, Zacian-C, Extreme Killer Arceus, and Koraidon can pivot around it with relative ease. Giratina-O might also be forced to Terastallize to perform its role as a utility Pokemon due to the relevance of Toxic Pokemon like Clodsire and Gliscor, as well as the existence of faster threats like Zacian-C, Koraidon, Miraidon, and Flutter Mane. Terastallizing is a huge commitment, and Giratina-O more often than not is doing it to be able to perform consistently. Lastly, Giratina-O has a big longevity issue, which can make it struggle in checking the Pokemon it's supposed to, making it fit only on certain styles of teams that can make up for its non-existent recovery with teammates like Wish Alomomola.
  • Thunder Wave can help Giratina-O spread paralysis for itself and its teammates, giving it a form of speed control. With the given EV spread, Giratina-O can take a hit from Zacian-C and potentially paralyze it, which is game-changing. However, it's not a common occurrence, as Giratina-O must be at full HP to accomplish this. Thunder Wave is also unable to paralyze common switch-ins to Giratina-O like Ting-Lu and Landorus-T. As a result, another option to run is Will-O-Wisp, which completely ruins Ting-Lu, Landorus-T, and Clodsire, while also annoying other switch-ins, namely Arceus formes like Fairy.
  • Shadow Sneak gives Giratina-O a tool to revenge kill Flutter Mane, Tera Ghost Pokemon like Koraidon, and low HP targets like Zacian-C. If this is not needed, however, Giratina-O can effectively run Defog thanks to its positive matchup against common entry hazard setters.
  • The given EV spread permits Giratina-O to live one Play Rough from +1 Zacian-C from full HP. It also gives Giratina-O very favorable chances to avoid the 2HKO from Ice Beam from non-Choice Specs Kyogre. The Speed allows Giratina-O to outspeed uninvested Gliscor, and the remaining EVs are slotted into Attack so that Giratina-O always 2HKOes Zacian-C with Poltergeist.
  • Tera Steel allows Giratina-O to check Pokemon like Koraidon, Miraidon, Zacian-C, and Flutter Mane. It also lets Giratina-O annoy Arceus-Fairy one-on-one and beat Calm Mind Arceus-Ground while making it immune to Toxic from the likes of Gliscor and Clodsire. Tera Poison can be used instead, as it still gives Giratina-O a Fairy-type resistance and poison immunity, but it also gives a new resistance to Fighting that can let it take on Koraidon. This, however, leaves Giratina-O unable to check Zacian-C and resist Dragon-type attacks.
  • Giratina-O fits best on bulky offense teams that need a way to deal with Ground-type Pokemon like Arceus-Ground and Groudon and can't afford to run passive checks to them like Corviknight. Once on the field, Giratina-O can make use of its powerful STAB moves to hit everything in the tier at least for neutral damage; however, be aware that Poltergeist has only 8 PP, meaning that while it's Giratina-O's main way of dealing damage, it should not be used recklessly, as it can get PP stalled with smart pivoting, especially by teams that have Pokemon like Ting-Lu and Extreme Killer Arceus.
  • Giratina-O is forced out by common Pokemon like Zacian-C, Koraidon, and Miraidon. It can also be overwhelmed by very strong Ice-type attacks from the likes of Calyrex-I and Choice Specs Kyogre. Pokemon like Kyogre can help Giratina-O against Calyrex-I and Koraidon, while the likes of Clodsire can help against Miraidon. Other Pokemon like Skeledirge and Arceus-Fairy can help Giratina-O against Zacian-C and Koraidon, respectively. Lastly, Pokemon that can help against Ting-Lu, like Arceus-Fairy and Gliscor, are also good teammates, as Ting-Lu's Ruination threatens to put a severe dent in Giratina-O's HP, and Ting-Lu can freely use Spikes against Giratina-O.

Special Utility.description:
• Giratina-O is Ubers' only offensive Defogger. Its combination of superb bulk, typing, and stellar offensive traits allows it to punish every entry hazard setter in the format, including, but not limited to, Ting-Lu, Clodsire, Landorus-T, some Arceus formes like Arceus-Water, and Gliscor. Giratina-O's Ground immunity gives it excellent opportunities to switch in on the ever-present Spikes, which allows it to act as somewhat of a wallbreaker that also happens to give Defog support, as most defensive teams will only have said Spikes as way of dealing with wallbreakers, which Giratina-O is immune to.
  • However, Giratina-O's strongest attack is Draco Meteor; this makes Giratina-O prone to be taken advantage by setup sweepers like Tera Fairy Miraidon, Zacian-C, Kyogre, and Flutter Mane. Hex is also a very weak move if the foe is not statused, meaning that Giratina-O will not be attacking for the majority of the early- to mid-game and instead, it'll be spreading status conditions and using Defog. Lastly, Giratina-O's poor Speed leaves it outsped by the likes of Koraidon and Arceus formes.
  • Will-O-Wisp spreads status to empower Hex and annoy Pokemon like Clodsire, Ting-Lu, and most Arceus formes that will regularly be switching into Giratina-O.
  • The given EV spread allows Giratina-O to avoid being 2HKOed by any of Kyogre's attacks without Stealth Rock while outspeeding 0 Speed Gliscor. The remaining EVs maximize Special Attack for Giratina-O to hit as hard as possible.
  • Tera Steel allows Giratina-O to check Pokemon like Flutter Mane. It also lets Giratina-O annoy Calm Mind Arceus formes while making it immune to Toxic from the likes of Gliscor and Clodsire. Tera Fairy can be used instead for Giratina-O to become immune to the Dragon-type attacks that will be aimed at it from Koraidon, Miraidon, and opposing Giratina-O.
  • Giratina-O fits best on bulky offense teams that need a way to battle Ground-type Pokemon like Dragon Dance Arceus-Ground and Groudon, and also need a hazard removal Pokemon. If using Defog is not needed, Giratina-O can instead spread status with Will-O-Wisp and launch Draco Meteors to dent Pokemon like Ting-Lu.
  • Giratina-O wants to be paired with physical attackers like Koraidon, Zacian-C, Arceus-Ground, and Calyrex-I that can deal with the walls that annoy it. In return, Giratina-O can deal with the physically bulky Pokemon, like Toxapex, Skeledirge, and Landorus-T, that annoy them. Clodsire and Ting-Lu are good teammates as well, as they take on Pokemon that Giratina-O can't, like Miraidon and Choice Specs Kyogre in Clodsire's case.

Defensive.description: Thanks to its bulk, typing, and Levitate ability, defensive Giratina-O checks Pokemon like Arceus, Arceus-Ground, and Choice Scarf Kyogre, and it is the only metagame-relevant Defog user. Will-O-Wisp and Thunder Wave both debilitate physical attackers, but Will-O-Wisp chips away at walls and affects Dragon Dance Arceus-Ground, while Thunder Wave additionally impairs special attackers such as Calm Mind Arceus-Fairy. Poltergeist breaks Arceus-Ground's Substitute, which would otherwise block Will-O-Wisp and Dragon Tail, in one hit; alternatively, running Hex lets Giratina-O hit statused walls harder and makes burn affect it much less. Dragon Tail quickly racks up entry hazard damage on the opposing team and prevents foes from continuously setting up against Giratina-O, which is especially useful against Taunt users. The given EV spread lets Giratina take unboosted Calyrex-S's Astral Barrage and outspeed Taunt Landorus-T. Tera Steel makes Giratina-O immune to poison from foes such as Toxapex and gives it a resistance to moves like Arceus-Fairy's Judgment, Zacian-C's Play Rough and Behemoth Blade, Koraidon's Scale Shot, and Arceus-Ground's Dragon Claw and Ice Beam. Tera Poison similarly removes Giratina-O's Dragon weakness and provides it with an immunity to Toxic and a resistance to Fairy, but it doesn't make Giratina-O weak to Koraidon's Low Kick. Defensive Giratina-O fits best on balance teams that otherwise have trouble dealing with Ground-types such as Dragon Dance Arceus-Ground or need the increased longevity Defog provides. Toxapex and Skeledirge handle Pokemon like Zacian-C and Koraidon for Giratina-O; in return, it handles Ground-types and helps check Arceus. Giratina-O appreciates Ting-Lu and Arceus checking Calyrex-S for it; Ting-Lu also checks Miraidon and helps check Calm Mind Arceus-Ground. Calyrex-S likes Giratina-O being able to deal with its two main switch-ins, Arceus and Ting-Lu, by checking the former and removing the latter's Spikes. Because it lacks recovery, Giratina-O can get overwhelmed by the Pokemon it checks when facing hyper offense teams, so it appreciates revenge killers such as Extreme Killer Arceus and Choice Scarf Koraidon.

Calm Mind.description:
Calm Mind Cresselia is a potent late-game wincon thanks to its gargantuan bulk, reliable recovery, and access to Calm Mind + Stored Power as well as solid coverage to deal with the Dark-types. After several Calm Mind boosts, Stored Power allows Cresselia to muscle past both Unaware walls like Skeledirge and Dondozo and bulky Psychic-resistant foes like Corviknight, Gholdengo, and Heatran while making it nigh impossible to KO with special attackers. Moonblast rounds out Cresselia's coverage, allowing it to hit Dark-types like Ting-Lu, Hisuian Samurott, and Greninja super effectively while being able to at least damage Kingambit; Tera Blast Fighting greatly improves Cresselia's matchup against Kingambit and hits these Dark-types harder than Moonblast, but makes Cresselia more reliant on Terastallization. Leftovers grants Cresselia crucial passive healing, allowing it to conserve its limited Moonlight PP long-term; Covert Cloak, on the other hand, blocks secondary effects from an array of moves, including Heatran's Magma Storm, Garganacl's Salt Cure, Zapdos's Discharge, and Sneasler's Dire Claw, allowing Cresselia to set up against these threats more safely. Grassy Seed is an option if Cresselia is used on Grassy Terrain hyper offense teams, which gives it more opprotunities to set up in the face of physical attackers while also boosting its Stored Power. Tera Poison has wonderful synergy with Levitate, giving Cresselia a single weakness to Psychic-type attacks, granting it resistances to Poison- and Fairy-type attacks, and an immunity to Toxapex's Toxic while still maintaining its Fighting resistance. Defensively, Tera Fighting lets Cresselia flip its Dark weakness against prominent Pokemon like Meowscarada, Greninja, Hisuian Samurott, and the aforementioned Kingambit as well. 52 Speed EVs allow Cresselia to outspeed Kingambit.

Cresselia fits well on an array of hyper offense, offense, and balance teams capable of supporting such a potent wincon. Heatran, Hisuian Samurott, and Landorus-T can provide entry hazard support to wear down foes over time. Heatran can also use Will-O-Wisp to cripple Kingambit or trap and wear down threats like Haze Toxapex and Chilly Reception Galarian Slowking with Magma Storm and Taunt; in return, Cresselia can handle threats like Great Tusk and Zamazenta that Heatran struggles against. Kingambit is ubiquitous and is a major thorn in Cresselia's side; as such, Great Tusk, Iron Valiant, and Low Kick Kingambit are crucial partners that can help stop opposing Kingambit's attempt to countersweep. Assault Vest Toxapex is a great teammate for Cresselia; it can take on Encore Iron Valiant, which is a frustrating matchup for Cresselia, and it can trap and deal with opposing defensive Toxapex, which can shut down Cresselia's boosts with Haze and force Cresselia to Tera Poison in order to avoid being crippled by Toxic. Thanks to Grassy Surge, Rillaboom is a necessary partner for Grassy Seed variants; it can support Cresselia with utility options like Knock Off and U-turn too.
This is a sample set as we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

vgc2024.overview:
• Cresselia shines in VGC as an incredibly bulky Trick Room setter with access to Lunar Blessing. Cresselia is a great check to Amoonguss and Urshifu-R, nullifying Spore with Lunar Blessing and pressuring the latter with a 2HKO.

  • Cresselia's strongest partner is Ursaluna, as it's a strong Trick Room sweeper that appreciates Lunar Blessing negating the burn chip damage. Cresselia's Levitate also allows Ursaluna to freely click Earthquake. Cresselia also appreciates Pokemon like Amoonguss and Iron Hands, which help get up Trick Room and act as threats under Trick Room themselves.

  • Cresselia struggles against Incineroar, as Fake Out can allow Incineroar's partner to get off another hit, which can be the difference between setting up Trick Room and not. Cresselia also faces issues against Farigiraf, which can reverse or Imprison Trick Room. Tornadus can also prove to be difficult, as Taunt prevents Trick Room from going up and takes advantage of Cresselia's passivity.

Trick Room Support.description:
• Cresselia uses Moonblast to hit more of the metagame for super effective damage, including Urshifu-S, while Ice Beam can be used to threaten the Landorus formes and Dragonite. Cresselia may opt for Psychic for the extra power before Terastallization.

  • Helping Hand allows Cresselia to more actively support its partners, especially Ursaluna and its Earthquake. Cresselia can use Ally Switch to provide game-deciding mind games and a way to protect its partners in a pinch.

  • Cressellia uses Safety Goggles to protect itself from Amoonguss's Spore and be able to consistently protect its teammates with Lunar Blessing.

  • The EV spread allows Cresselia to almost always survive two Mystic Water Surging Strikes from Urshifu-R, and always avoid the 2HKO from Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Moonblast.

  • Tera Fairy is the most consistent for Cresselia, as it provides a resistance to the common Dark-type moves such as Urshifu-S's Wicked Blow or Kingambit's Kowtow Cleave, as well as gaining STAB on Moonblast. Tera Poison is a generally good defensive typing further bolstered by Levitate, and it provides key resistances to Flutter Mane's Moonblast and Rillaboom's STAB moves.

battlestadiumsingles.overview:
This Pokemon is a new addition to the Regulation D format! If you have any questions or feel it needs more updates, feel free to post here.

For more information on Battle Stadium Singles, visit the format page!

Serene Queen (Calm Mind).description:
• With its great bulk and the advent of Terastallization, Cresselia is a formidable defensive presence with the ability to take over late in the game.

  • Calm Mind: Calm Mind allows Cresselia to bolster its defensive profile while also increasing its damage output.

  • Moonblast: While lacking STAB, Moonblast has no immunities, which makes it Cresselia’s most reliable offensive move.

  • Stored Power: While blanked by Dark-types, Stored Power allows Cresselia to threaten walls like Unaware Dondozo and more reliably win Calm Mind wars against foes like Flutter Mane. It also allows Cresselia to potentially beat Heatran with sheer power should it accrue enough boosts.

  • Thunderbolt - Thunderbolt allows Cresselia to immediately threaten Urshifu-R and is a great general attacking move if used with an Electric Tera.

  • Ice Beam: Ice Beam allows Cresselia to immediately threaten the many Ice weak Pokémon in the metagame, such as Dragonite, Landorus-T, and Ting-Lu

Other Options

  • Substitute: While difficult to fit, Substitute can protect Cresselia from debilitating status from the likes of Dondozo and Clodsire, giving it a wider reach against slower paced teams without relying on Covert Cloak as much.

  • Lunar Dance: While seemingly odd on a defensive set, Lunar Dance allows Cresselia to bring back a battered teammate in the event it itself cannot finish the game, giving formidable partners such as Chien-Pao and Ursaluna a second chance to break down the opponent.

Items

  • Covert Cloak: Covert Cloak guards Cresselia from adverse effects such as flinches and Defense drops that would otherwise impede its ability to take over the endgame. It also negates the passive damage from Garganacl’s Salt Cure, allowing Cresselia to heavily punish it.

  • Leftovers: Leftovers’s passive recovery allows Cresselia to better conserve its limited Moonlight PP, more safely set up against powerful attackers like Flutter Mane, and be a more active presence on the field by not mandating it use a turn to heal off every hit it takes manually.

Tera Types

  • Electric-type: Thanks to Levitate, Tera Electric grants Cresselia a complete lack of weaknesses, giving it an extremely diverse defensive profile courtesy of its immense bulk. It also guards against paralysis, minimizing the chance of an ill-timed lost turn ruining a sweep.

  • Poison-type: Tera Poison protects Cresselia against Toxic, allowing it to more safely set up against Pokémon like Clodsire. It also grants security against even Tera Fairy Choice Specs Flutter Mane by allowing Cresselia to resist Fairy.

  • Fairy-type: Tera Fairy grants Cresselia a crucial resistance to Dark, allowing it to better take on foes like Chien-Pao and Chi-Yu.

Trick Room Support.description:
• WIth the combination of Trick Room and Lunar Dance, Cresselia can give bulky attackers like Ursaluna-B another chance for dangerous comeback sweeps!

  • Moonblast: Due to the support nature of this set, Moonblast is preferred over a STAB move; otherwise, Cresselia is walled by common Dark-type threats like Chien-Pao and Urshifu-S.

  • Moonlight: Moonlight makes Cresselia less of a one-and-done support Pokemon, increasing its longevity and potentially letting it stall out weaker attackers.

  • Ice Beam: Ice Beam is more effective at pressuring Dragonite than Moonblast, which can be useful if wanting to force an early Terastallization.

  • Bold versus Relaxed : Thanks to a decent base Speed stat, a Bold nature with regular Speed is an option if wanting to make Cresselia more flexible outside of Trick Room.

Other Options

  • Skill Swap: Skill Swap can be used to take away Multiscale from Dragonite, which otherwise can use Roost on the turn that Cresselia uses Lunar Dance. Since Dragonite can still switch out to reset its ability, this option works best with Stealth Rock support.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: This set's support focus and bulk usually do not require Terastallization, making Cresselia an excellent partner for the sweepers it supports.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy lets it resist Dark-type attacks from the likes of Chi-Yu while also nullifying Scale Shot setups from attackers like Dragonite and Roaring Moon.

  • Electric: Tera Electric remains a solid option thanks to Levitate, giving Cresselia essentially no weaknesses and providing an important paralysis immunity.

  • Steel: Tera Steel makes it much harder for Latios to muscle through Cresselia while still maintaining a very favorable matchup against Dragonite thanks to the synergy with Levitate.

Items

  • Mental Herb: Cresselia is frequently targeted by Taunt users like Flutter Mane, making Mental Herb a great option to guarantee Trick Room is set.

  • Sitrus Berry: Sitrus Berry is a strong general option for further augmenting Cresselia's longevity.

  • Rocky Helmet: Rocky Helmet is useful for breaking Focus Sash from targets like both formes of Urshifu, making it more difficult for them to stall out an incoming Trick Room sweep.

Stored Power.description: Cresselia serves as a potentially terrifying setup sweeper, using its naturally titanic mixed bulk alongside Terastallization to accumulate multiple Calm Mind boosts, bolstering its Stored Power to incredibly dangerous levels to easily snowball if given the opportunity. Even without Terastallization, it can use its natural typing to withstand attacks from dangerous Pokemon such as Zamazenta, Great Tusk, and Mega Medicham. Hidden Power Fighting is the preferred coverage move to hit Mega Tyranitar and Heatran much harder, while Moonblast provides a stronger hit against the likes of Dragapult and Urshifu-R if Cresselia cannot afford to accumulate multiple Calm Mind boosts. Tera Poison is essential for removing Cresselia's weaknesses to Dark- and Ghost-type attacks from Dragapult, Gholdengo, and Hisuian Samurott while providing less exploitable weaknesses compared to Tera Steel, which makes Cresselia prone to being revenge killed by Fighting- and Fire-types such as Mega Lopunny, Sneasler, Heatran, and Mega Charizard Y. Covert Cloak allows Cresselia to negate secondary effects from Garganacl's Salt Cure and status from the likes of Toxapex, Sneasler, and Zapdos, while Leftovers provides passive recovery that makes Cresselia less exploitable and forced to heal. Maximum Speed EVs allow Cresselia to consistently outspeed Heatran and Gholdengo, which could otherwise irritate it, although more Defense investment could be used instead to better withstand attacks from the likes of Urshifu-R and Zamazenta. Cresselia fits best on either bulky balance or hyper offense teams, both able to provide support in different ways; the former give Cresselia a defensive core to fall back on should its sweep fail, while the latter pressure opposing defensive teams and can provide dual screens support via Tapu Koko and Dragapult to bolster its bulk even further. Both playstyles can reliably keep up Spikes using Skarmory, Clodsire, Mega Diancie, or Garchomp, which Cresselia mandates in order to wear down its checks such as Toxapex, Ferrothorn, and Heatran. Similarly, Knock Off support from the likes of Toxapex and Iron Valiant helps Cresselia pressure the aforementioned checks more effectively. Cresselia has difficulty withstanding rain teams due to them cutting Moonlight's healing, so defensive partners that match up positively against them such as Toxapex and Tera Water or Dragon Garganacl are appreciated. Cresselia struggles with bulkier playstyles that can neutralize it with the likes of Haze Toxapex and Unaware Tera Dark Clodsire, so Pokemon that can break defensive teams such as Swords Dance Gliscor and Gholdengo make for good partners.

Unaware.description: Cresselia's titanic bulk and access to Calm Mind allow it to pose a major threat to the opponent's team, turning other setup sweepers into fodder. It can also leverage its Psychic typing to check huge threats such as Azelf and Deoxys-S. Late game, Cresselia can function as a terrifying and offbeat set-up sweeper, boosting and using Moonblast to hit Dark-types such as Chien-Pao and Roaring Moon. Cresselia's ideal opportunity to set up is in front of passive walls like Manaphy, Swampert, and non-Unaware Blissey. Cresselia's best teammates are Pokemon that can take on Dark-Type moves like Corviknight and Great Tusk. Prankster Corviknight and Deoxys-S can set dual screens to make Cresselia's setup easier. Cresselia also appreciates teammates such as Mandibuzz, Blissey, and RegenVest Hisuian Goodra that can switch into Ghost-types.

Trick Room.description: This EV spread survives a Dark Pulse from Timid Choice Specs Chi-Yu.

Rain Wallbreaker.description: Manaphy functions as an articulate wallbreaker on rain teams, with its Tail Glow boosted attacks capable of destroying Water-resistant Pokemon such as Ferrothorn, Toxapex, and Alomomola that give other rain wallbreakers a hard time. Rest + Hydration gives Manaphy immediate recovery and lets it exploit passive Pokemon like Gastrodon and the aforementioned Toxapex that attempt to status it. Energy Ball hits Pokemon like Tera Water Garganacl and Gastrodon, while Psychic prevents Toxapex from pivoting around Manaphy. Pelipper is an obvious teammate that provides rain for Manaphy, letting it perform more effectively. Manaphy has issues with offensive Pokemon like Iron Valiant, Kartana, and Baxcalibur, so rain Pokemon that can either outpace or naturally check them like Mega Swampert, Zapdos, Tornadus-T, and Ferrothorn make for good teammates. Mega Swampert appreciates Manaphy breaking through Pokemon like Ferrothorn and Alomomola, while it deals with offensive threats like Iron Valiant and Tapu Koko in return. Utility options like Ferrothorn help Manaphy as well, since it deals with Pokemon such as the aforementioned Tapu Koko while also providing entry hazards to support Manaphy’s wallbreaking capabilities.

Tail Glow + 3 Attacks.description: Manaphy serves as a good wallbreaker with Tail Glow, letting it boost its power to substantial levels, in tandem with its solid coverage. Scald is an alternative to Surf that lets Manaphy fish for burns on Pokemon like Rillaboom and Dragonite without missing any important damage benchmarks with Scald’s power decrease. Ice Beam can hit both Pokemon along with Mega Latios for super effective damage. Energy Ball or Psychic lets it beat its checks like Gastrodon, Tera Water Garganacl, and Toxapex. Substitute can let Manaphy exploit common defensive Pokemon such as Toxapex and Alomomola, allowing it to accumulate boosts and fire off strong attacks at little to no cost. Waterium Z + Rain Dance lets Manaphy get a Speed boost, making it easier to clean up mid- to late-game. with Tera Grass lets Manaphy turn the tables on Pokemon like Ferrothorn and Kartana, while Tera Steel does the same and gives Manaphy a Toxic immunity. Screens setters like Tapu Koko and Alolan-Ninetales help Manaphy have an easier time setting up. Teammates like Baxcalibur, Sneasler, and Gholdengo all break through Pokemon like Toxapex and Ferrothorn for Manaphy, while it breaks through opposing Gholdengo, Ting-Lu, and Mega Scizor in return.

Take Heart.description: With Take Heart, Manaphy can become a great wincon with its solid natural bulk, good defensive typing, and Scald to threaten the Pokemon that would try to break through it. Take Heart + Acid Armor lets Manaphy alleviate status conditions and accumulate boosts to help it stay in the game and fire off strong boosted attacks. Stored Power takes advantage of that and allows Manaphy to break through Pokemon like Toxapex with ease. Substitute can be used over Acid Armor, but leaves Manaphy vulnerable to physical revenge killers. Tera Poison and Steel give Manaphy a Toxic immunity and Grass- and Fairy-type resistance, letting it set up easier in front of Choice-locked Iron Valiant and Kartana. Pokemon that support Manaphy with screens like Tapu Koko ease Manaphy in setting up. Teammates like Dragonite and Volcarona that can deal with Pokemon like Rillaboom and Tapu Koko, which threaten Manaphy even when it's boosted, are appriciated.

Tail Glow.description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

RegenVest.description: RegenVest Manaphy's good natural bulk and bevy of utility moves let it serve as a great blanket special switch-in and bring in teammates with a slow U-turn. Scald's burn chance looms over physical attackers looking to take advantage of Manaphy's lower physical bulk. Knock Off is used to remove key items like Heavy-Duty Boots and Assault Vest from potential switch-ins like Swampert, Corviknight, and Desolate Land Iron Moth. Ice Beam dissuades Roaring Moon and Dragonite from setting up on Manaphy. Energy Ball is optionally usable to hit Swampert and opposing Manaphy. Manaphy is excellent at switching into attacks from Heatran, Gholdengo, and Walking Wake, utilizing a slow U-turn to bring in strong but frail wallbreakers like Chien-Pao and Iron Boulder. Great Tusk is a good partner, being immune to the Electric-type attacks Manaphy is weak to, doubling as a top tier entry hazard remover, switching into Knock Off attempts from the likes of Roaring Moon and Mandibuzz. Manaphy should be aware of Knock Off, as it is heavily reliant on Assault Vest to provide defensive value. Manaphy can be overwhelmed by teams with multiple special wallbreakers like Deoxys-S, Hisuian Electrode, Azelf, and Walking Wake, so it should be run either with a secondary special wall or on more offensive teams that limit opposing wallbreakers. Investing in Defense is also an option, allowing Manaphy to switch into threats like Chien-Pao, Barraskewda, and Cinderace and pivot out while using Assault Vest to function as a mixed wall.

Tail Glow.description: Manaphy is a potent late-game sweeper and wallbreaker with the combination of Tail Glow's immediate power boost, its good bulk, and its decent speed to overwhelm foes. It can use either Protosynthesis to restrict foes' ability to revenge kill it or Primordial Sea to help with wallbreaking and give it more switch-in opportunities. Scald is used as its main STAB move but can be substituted for Weather Ball on Primordial Sea sets as a stronger STAB move and a way to hit incoming Desolate Land Pokemon like Ceruledge and Heatran. Ice Beam helps deal with Dragon-types like Latios, Roaring Moon, and Dragonite. Energy Ball helps with taking on Water-types likes Swampert, Primarina, and opposing Manaphy. Finally, Tail Glow-boosted Psychic OHKOes Iron Moth and Toxapex and 2HKOes Desolate Land Ceruledge. Manaphy appreciates pivots such as Corviknight, Mandibuzz, and Deoxys-D that have the ability to safely get it onto the field to let it clean up games much easier and help it get through its sweep by providing entry hazard control. Manaphy is also able to help these pivots by providing offensive pressure and being able to end games for them. Manaphy struggles to deal with specially bulky walls such as Blissey, Hisuian Goodra, and Unaware Deoxys-D, so it partners up well with Pokemon like Galarian Zapdos, Roaring Moon, and Latios to help deal with them and pressure them into more unfavorable positions. Manaphy also works well on hyper offense teams if using Protosynthesis due to Booster Energy being single-use; on these teams, it likes to be supported by other special wallbreakers such as Latios, Gholdengo, and Azelf that can help to wear down specially bulky checks for Manaphy like Blissey, Iron Moth, and Ceruledge.

Choiced Attacker.description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Nasty Plot.description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Choice Specs.description: Choice Specs Darkrai is an incredibly strong wallbreaker with a wide range of coverage moves, allowing it to hit a lot of the best Pokemon in the tier for super effective damage. Focus Blast hits Ferrothorn, Garganacl, Heatran, Mega Lopunny and Mega Tyranitar for massive damage, while Sludge Bomb hits Fairy-types such as Iron Valiant, Tapu Lele, and Tapu Koko. Ice Beam OHKOes Landorus-T and Gliscor. Trick lets Darkrai debilitate defensive Pokemon like Garganacl and Ting-Lu at the cost of weakening itself. Darkrai can use Tera Dark to net a crucial 2HKO on foes like Ferrothorn, Heatran, and Garganacl, as well as OHKOing Ogerpon-W, Tapu Lele, and Galarian Slowking after slight chip with Dark Pulse. Other special wallbreakers like Tapu Lele, Raging Bolt, and Iron Valiant appreciate Darkrai's ability to weaken or KO special walls such as Heatran or Gliscor. Darkrai is liable to being outsped and revenge killed by Pokemon like Booster Energy Iron Valiant, Choice Scarf Tapu Lele, Booster Energy Iron Boulder, Mega Lopunny, Tapu Koko, Zamazenta, and Choice Scarf Urshifu-R, so a strong defensive backbone with Pokemon like Ferrothorn, Landorus-T, and Heatran is heavily recommended.

Extreme Killer (Swords Dance).description:
• The combination of Swords Dance and STAB Extreme Speed turns Arceus into a deadly setup sweeper.
  • Shadow Claw hits Giratina-O and Skeledirge hard, especially if Arceus has Terastallized into the Ghost-type.
  • Taunt denies opposing recovery and blocks status moves such as Will-O-Wisp from Giratina-O and Skeledirge, but Recover can let Arceus acquire multiple boosts, making it nigh unstoppable.
  • Earthquake hits Toxapex and Zacian-C hard while doing respectable damage to Skeledirge.
  • A Silk Scarf lets Arceus secure important benchmarks such as OHKOing offensive Kyogre at +2 with Extreme Speed. Alternatively, Leftovers offers more longevity, while Lum Berry offers extra insurance against status effects.
  • The given EV spread and nature maximize Arceus's damage output and let it outspeed Adamant Rayquaza, with the rest of the EVs going into HP to facilitate setup.
  • Tera Normal boosts Extreme Speed to absurd levels, letting Arceus OHKO offensive Koraidon at +2 if holding a Silk Scarf.
  • Alternatively, Tera Ghost is useful for preventing Koraidon and Zacian-C from revenge killing it. It also boosts Shadow Claw against targets such as Giratina-O and Skeledirge.
  • Tera Fire makes Arceus immune to burn, which is helpful against Skeledirge and Giratina-O.
  • Swords Dance Arceus is a good fit on hyper offense and bulky offense, working best as a late-game sweeper when checks such as Corviknight, Zacian-C, and Skeledirge are weakened or removed. With Extreme Speed, Arceus also serves as an emergency check to opposing sweepers.
  • Good teammates for Arceus include Zacian-C, Groudon, and Koraidon, which share similar checks such as Corviknight and Skeledirge and can wear them down for Arceus to sweep.

Dragon Dance.description:
• Dragon Dance allows Arceus to outspeed opposing Arceus formes as well as turn the tables on faster Normal-resistant or immune Pokemon such as Zacian-C, Flutter Mane, Arceus-Ghost, and Tera Ghost Pokemon.
  • Extreme Speed is a powerful priority move that lets Arceus revenge kill opposing sweepers as well as clean weakened teams late-game.
  • Shadow Claw OHKOes Flutter Mane and hits Giratina-O, Skeledirge, and foes that have Terrastalized into the Ghost-type hard, especially if Arceus has Terastallized into the Ghost-type itself.
  • Flare Blitz is a powerful coverage move that OHKOes Zacian-C at +1 and deals heavy damage to Corviknight and Tera Steel Giratina-O. Earthquake has no recoil and also has a good chance to OHKO Zacian-C at +1 after Stealth Rock, but it cannot hit Corviknight. Recover keeps Arceus healthy throughout a match and potentially lets it set up more than once.
  • Silk Scarf is recommended to boost the power of Extreme Speed to secure benchmarks such as OHKOing offensive Kyogre at +1 with Tera Normal. Leftovers is another good option, especially alongside Recover, to let Arceus accrue multiple boosts. Lum Berry is useful for giving Arceus additional insurance against status moves such as Will-O-Wisp from Giratina-O or Skeledirge.
  • The given EV spread maximizes Arceus's damage output while giving it enough Speed to outrun max Speed base 90 Pokemon, as well as uninvested Koraidon and Miraidon.
  • Tera Normal with a Silk Scarf gives Extreme Speed the extra power needed to OHKO Miraidon and offensive Kyogre at +1 after Stealth Rock. However, Tera Ghost is also an option to boost the power of Shadow Claw and avoid being revenge killed by Koraidon and Zacian-C. Finally, Tera Fire makes Arceus immune to Will-O-Wisp.
  • Arceus fits best on hyper offense and bulky offense, where it keeps opposing sweepers in check with its powerful priority while threatening to sweep itself.

Offensive Setup.description: Arceus is a potent revenge killer, wallbreaker, and setup sweeper thanks to its excellent movepool and powerful Extreme Speed. Swords Dance can be used to break past Pokemon like Landorus-T, Giratina-O, Toxapex, and defensive Arceus formes and limit revenge killers like Koraidon, while Dragon Dance is a more niche option that lets Arceus outspeed Calyrex-S, Zacian-C, and opposing Arceus formes. Shadow Claw hits Ghost-types like Giratina-O, Skeledirge, and Calyrex-S and provides good neutral coverage. Recover can provide Arceus with more opportunities to set up and makes it harder to revenge kill; alternatively, Earthquake hits Skeledirge harder, as well as hitting Toxapex and Zacian-C, and Taunt can deny opposing recovery, status-inducing moves, and Haze from Pokemon like Arceus formes, Skeledirge, and Toxapex, respectively. Silk Scarf has no drawbacks, but unlike Life Orb, it means +2 Extreme Speed needs a layer of Spikes to 2HKO defensive Arceus formes, OHKO Miriadon, and 2HKO Zacian-C. Additionally, Life Orb lets +2 Extreme Speed OHKO Koraidon after a layer of Spikes, +1 Earthquake OHKO Zacian-C, and unboosted Earthquake 2HKO Skeledirge and Toxapex. Tera Normal OHKOes Koraidon with +2 Extreme Speed and enables Silk Scarf Arceus to achieve the damage thresholds Life Orb sets can. Tera Ghost makes Arceus harder to revenge kill by opposing Arceus and Koraidon and lets Life Orb-boosted Shadow Claw OHKO defensive Giratina-O after Stealth Rock at +2, OHKO Zacian-C after some chip damage at +2, and 2HKO Skeledirge. Tera Fire makes Arceus immune to Will-O-Wisp, helping against Skeledirge and opposing Arceus formes, and lets it resist Zacian-C's STAB moves, Arceus-Fairy's Judgment, and Calyrex-S's Grass Knot. Arceus fits well on offense and bulky offense teams, being able to revenge kill dangerous threats and clean up late-game. Thanks to Arceus's Normal typing, it's immune to Calyrex-S's Astral Barrage, which can help against Choice Specs sets, Koraidon and Zacian-C pair well with Arceus, as they help overwhelm shared checks with Arceus like Landorus-T, Toxapex, and defensive Arceus formes. Pokemon such as Calyrex-S, Miraidon, and Kyogre also threaten its checks and make good teammates. On bulky offense teams, Landorus-T and Ting-Lu make good partners, as Landorus-T can switch into Pokemon that can revenge kill Arceus like Zacian-C and Koraidon, chipping them with Rocky Helmet in the process, and Ting-Lu crucially sets Spikes and helps check Calyrex-S, which offensive Arceus does poorly. On hyper offense teams, Pokemon like Grimmsnarl, Glimmora, and Ribombee support Arceus, and Pokemon like Arceus-Fairy and Arceus-Ground can take advantage of Koraidon and Zacian-C for it.

Bulky Extreme Killer.description: Extreme Killer Arceus is a stellar revenge killer, wallbreaker, and cleaner that also crucially checks Calyrex-S thanks to its great defensive profile; this phenomenal combination of traits makes Arceus one of the best Pokemon in the AG metagame, and it should be seriously considered on every team. Swords Dance is the preferred setup move to break through checks like Giratina-O and Landorus-T and limit revenge killers like Koraidon and Zacian-C, while Bulk Up is an alternative on hyper offense with dual screens support from Pokemon like Grimmsnarl, making Arceus a brutal sweeper that stifles common forms of counterplay like Koraidon, Zacian-C, and opposing Extreme Killer Arceus. Shadow Claw OHKOes Calyrex-S, hits Giratina-O, and provides good neutral coverage. The longevity Heavy-Duty Boots provides lets Arceus more reliably check Calyrex-S and more safely set up. Leftovers is an alternative to Heavy-Duty Boots, making Arceus harder to stop once set up. Tera Ghost turns the tables on Koraidon, lets Arceus consistently beat opposing Extreme Killer Arceus, and greatly improves Shadow Claw's damage against Giratina-O and Skeledirge, while Tera Normal boosts Arceus's power to ridiculous levels; at +2, Extreme Speed OHKOes Koraidon after Stealth Rock and 2HKOes Zacian-C. Tera Fire and Steel are more defensive options, blocking status and improving the matchup against threats like Arceus-Fairy, Zacian-C, and Calyrex-S as well as opposing Extreme Killer Arceus in the case of Steel. 236 HP EVs always survive a hit from Choice Specs Miraidon. Alternatively, a spread with 124 HP / 252 Atk / 8 Def / 124 Spe and an Adamant nature outspeeds Timid Kyogre and always avoids a 2HKO from Life Orb Calyrex-S's Psyshock. Arceus can struggle to break through Giratina-O, Skeledirge, Toxapex, and defensive Arceus formes, so teammates that can take advantage of them, like Calyrex-S and Calm Mind Arceus-Ground, or weaken them, like Koraidon and Zacian-C, make for good partners. Choice Scarf Koraidon can also revenge kill Pokemon Arceus cannot like Zacian-C and Calyrex-S. Encore Calyrex-S can switch into any of Arceus's moves besides Shadow Claw and use Encore, so Ting-Lu is a great partner to help check it. Koraidon and Zacian-C highly threaten Arceus, so strong counterplay to them, like Landorus-T on offense or Toxapex or Skeledirge on balance, is crucial.

Calm Mind.description: Calm Mind Arceus-Dark is an incredibly potent sweeper and stallbreaker in Ubers UU. Its amazing bulk allows it to set up on the many special attackers in the tier, such as Kyurem-W, Chi-Yu, and Mewtwo, and Taunt stops Blissey and other Arceus formes from setting up alongside it with their own Calm Mind, blocks Encore from Magearna, and prevents phazing from Giratina, Skarmory, and Dialga. Recover allows it to increase its longevity and set up on some physical attackers, such as Solgaleo and Kingambit. Tera Fairy grants Arceus-Dark a resistance to Fighting-type moves from the likes of Urshifu-S, Deoxys, and Mewtwo, along with an immunity to Dragon Tail, the only phazing move that cannot be prevented by Taunt. Tera Poison turns its Fairy, Fighting, and Bug weaknesses into resistances, which is incredible for setting up on Zacian, Magearna, and Zamazenta-C. Arceus-Dark greatly benefits from the help of Pokemon that can deal with physical attackers, as Zacian and Zamazenta-C both offensively check it, so Dondozo, Lugia, Skarmory, physically defensive Solgaleo, and Magearna form good defensive cores with it. Other Pokemon that pair well with Arceus-Dark are Zamazenta-C and Annihilape, as both are Defense-boosting offensive sweepers that can wall and eliminate physical attackers for Arceus-Dark to freely take care of special attackers. Arceus-Dark is very entry hazard weak, so Pokemon like Giratina and Great Tusk that can remove hazards for Arceus-Dark are greatly appreciated. Giratina appreciates Arceus-Dark's ability to check Dark- and Ghost-types like Gholdengo and Spectrier, and Great Tusk appreciates Arceus-Dark beating common checks to it like Giratina, Skarmory, and Deoxys.

Defensive.description: Arceus-Dark has extensive options as a defensive Pokemon in Ubers UU checking metagame threats like Palafin-H and Deoxys. Foul Play hits physical attackers like Arceus-Fire and Palafin-H hard while still scoring solid damage versus Psychic-types such as Mewtwo and Lugia. Arceus-Dark can run Will-O-Wisp to cripple physical attackers, like Zacian and Zamazenta-C switching in, or it can run Stealth Rock to give its team entry hazard support if a partner doesn't have the move. Roar phazes many setup sweepers, such as Arceus and Mewtwo, whereas Taunt blocks them from setting up altogether. Taunt also shuts down many lead Pokemon like Smeargle and Galvantula and can force your opponent on the back foot provided it wins a Speed tie against opposing Arceus-Dark. Tera Poison turns Dark's Fairy, Fighting, and Bug weaknesses into resistances, which is especially helpful versus Zacian and Volcarona. Tera Fairy gives similar resistances to Poison, but the neutrality to Psychic and Ground helps against Great Tusk and Deoxys, and the valuable Dragon immunity lets Arceus-Dark beat Kyurem-W. Arceus-Dark benefits from specially defensive partners like Blissey, Calm Mind Clefable, and Giratina due to being weak to special attackers such as Magearna and Palkia-O. Arceus-Dark also pairs well with Corviknight and Regieleki, as both can remove hazards to keep it healthy and pivot it onto the field.

Support.description: Arceus-Dark's wide support movepool and good defensive typing make it an excellent support Pokemon for bulkier teams. Roar or Dragon Tail is used to stop setup sweepers such as Nasty Plot Mewtwo and Calm Mind Arceus variants. Roar can be prevented by Taunt; however, unlike Dragon Tail it can phaze Fairy-types and Pokemon behind Substitute. Taunt is an alternative option to prevent opposing Pokemon from boosting and allow Arceus-Dark to chip down passive wall Pokemon like Giratina and Solgaleo by preventing them from healing. The last moveslot is fairly flexible; Arceus-Dark can serve as an effective entry hazard setter with Stealth Rock, while Will-O-Wisp and Thunder Wave let it cripple offensive Pokemon like Palafin and Ogerpon-H. Tera Poison lets Arceus-Dark beat setup sweepers that can otherwise force it out like Zacian and Arceus-Fighting. Tera Fairy provides similar resistances as Poison while also providing an extremely useful immunity to Dragon, letting it better check threats like Palkia-O, while not causing a pesky weakness to the Psychic-type moves fired off from Pokemon such as Mewtwo and Deoxys. Arceus-Dark checks Pokemon like Chi-Yu and Kyurem-W, so it pairs well with Pokemon like Zamazenta-C, Mewtwo, Palkia-O and Solgaleo, which struggle against those threats. Physically defensive Pokemon like Great Tusk and Calm Mind Lugia complement Arceus-Dark well; the former can beat many Dark-resistant Pokemon that pressure it like both Urshifu formes while appreciating its ability to check Psychic-types, and the latter checks Fighting-types well and appreciates other setup sweepers being deterred from setting up. Giratina is another good teammate thanks to its typing letting it check sweepers that Arceus-Dark cannot, such as Arceus-Fire and Sneasler; in exchange, Arceus-Dark checks opposing Ghost- and Dark-types such as Spectrier and Chi-Yu and spreads status so Giratina can fire off powerful Hexes.

Defensive.description: Arceus-Dark is a decent defensive Pokemon that checks Arceus and soft checks Calyrex-S, Dragon Dance Arceus-Ground, and offensive Giratina-O while being immune to Trick. Will-O-Wisp prevents Pokemon like Koraidon and Zacian-C from safely switching in on Arceus-Dark. Foul Play is the main way of hitting physical attackers. Alternatively, Judgment can be ran to ignore Will-O-Wisp's burn to effectively hit the likes of Skeledirge and Giratina-O, allowing Arceus-Dark to switch into Will-O-Wisp from them. Judgment also does decent damage to Terastallized Calyrex-S and Toxapex. Taunt shuts down Pokemon like Ting-Lu and Toxapex from setting up entry hazards, namely that of Spikes and Toxic Spikes, prevents setup sweepers from setting up, and blocks recovery, which Judgment variants appreciate. Tera Poison gives Arceus-Dark a much-needed resistance to Koraidon's Low Kick, Zacian-C's Play Rough, and Calyrex-S's Grass Knot while also letting it absorb tedious Toxic Spikes. Arceus-Dark fits best on balance and bulky offense teams, which appreciate its ability to check Extreme Killer Arceus and soft check Calyrex-S. Arceus-Dark struggles with physical attackers such as Koraidon and Zacian-C, so checks to them such as Landorus-T, Skeledirge, and Toxapex are appreciated. Since Arceus-Dark can't run Heavy-Duty Boots, it fails to effectively check Calyrex-S in the long run, so Ting-Lu and Arceus help check Calyrex-S more effectively throughout the game, which is appreciated. Arceus-Fairy can use Arceus-Dark as setup fodder with Calm Mind, which makes Zacian-C a good teammate to pair with Arceus-Dark.

Calm Mind.description: While it faces stiff competition from other Arceus formes like Arceus-Dark and Arceus-Fire, Arceus-Electric's offensive typing and near-unresisted coverage with Ice Beam makes it a dangerous setup sweeper. Electric-type Judgment deals to Pokemon like Palkia-O, Palafin, and Toxapex. Ice Beam allows Arceus-Electric to hit Pokemon that otherwise wall it like Great Tusk, Arceus-Grass, and Dialga. Tera Flying is generally preferred as it gives Arceus-Electric a valuable immunity to Ground-type attacks from Great Tusk and Landorus, though Tera Ice can be used to boost the power of Ice Beam. Arceus-Electric generally fits best on balance teams looking for a solid setup sweeper. Arceus-Electric's most immediate issue isGround-types like Great Tusk and Landorus that can threaten it. As such, Pokemon like Palkia-O, Kyurem-W, and Palafin that can threaten them out are naturally good partners. Arceus-Electric can also struggle to break through specially defensive walls like Giratina and Solgaleo, so partners like Kingambit, Chi-Yu, and Spectrier who can remove them form potent cores with it.

ubers.overview: Arceus-Fairy is a defensive behemoth that cements itself a place in Ubers as one of the best checks to Koraidon. An immunity to Dragon and a resistance to Low Kick give Arceus-Fairy ample opportunities to switch in while also forcing Koraidon to use Flare Blitz more often and decrease its longevity as a result. Furthermore, Arceus-Fairy's bulk and resistances make it a useful soft check to Pokemon such as Arceus, Giratina-O, Kyurem-B, Zekrom, Chien-Pao, Rayquaza, and even Miraidon and Flutter Mane. Good neutral coverage with Fairy-type Judgment allows Arceus-Fairy to take full advantage of its ample support movepool featuring Thunder Wave, Will-O-Wisp, Stealth Rock, and Taunt. Outside of being a bit passive against Necrozma-DM, Ho-Oh, and Zacian-C and having to play around opposing Terastallization carefully, Arceus-Fairy has little to no flaws and should be strongly considered for any balance team.
ubers.comments:
Other Options

Earth Power and Power Gem are coverage options for a fully dedicated Calm Mind set. The problem is that Arceus-Fairy always loses to either Necrozma-DM or Ho-Oh, so while these coverage options are viable, they require dedicated team support. Of the two, Earth Power is more plausible, as Ho-Oh may be crippled by Knock Off support. Losing access to status or Stealth Rock also leaves Arceus-Fairy more passive in general.

Checks and Counters

Fairy-Resistant Tanks: Necrozma-DM, Ho-Oh, and Zacian-C take little damage from Judgment and can use Arceus-Fairy as an opportunity to set up, although none of them like taking Thunder Wave.

Tera Fire Users: Arceus-Fairy cannot burn common physical attackers like Koraidon and Necrozma-DM after they have used Tera Fire, which also greatly weakens the power of Judgment. Koraidon can notably guarantee the OHKO on Arceus-Fairy at +2 with Tera Fire Flare Blitz, necessitating Arceus-Fairy to use Tera Water itself. These Pokemon are still vulnerable to Thunder Wave, but they may still be able to sweep with enough boosts.

Chip Damage: Arceus-Fairy is vulnerable to all forms of status and entry hazard damage, which force it to use Recover more often and lose momentum.

Calm Mind: Calm Mind users like Arceus-Ground, Kyogre, and Arceus-Grass take little from Judgment and can use Calm Mind relatively freely as a result.

Defensive Wall.description:
This set gives Arceus-Fairy its best chance at taking on Koraidon. Thunder Wave is extremely useful for crippling all of Arceus-Fairy's most common switch-ins in Necrozma-DM, Ho-Oh, and Zacian-C. It is also a safe move to use against Koraidon should you expect it to use Tera Fire and is especially useful because Arceus-Fairy discourages all Ground- and Electric-types bar Clodsire from switching in. Will-O-Wisp more directly cripples physical attackers like Koraidon and Necrozma-DM, although it cannot hit Ho-Oh and Tera Fire users. The third moveslot is fairly flexible; Stealth Rock is a good option, as it frees up moveslots for Arceus-Fairy's teammates. Taunt prevents Clodsire and specially defensive Gliscor from being able to use Spikes and Toxic. Dragon Tail can be a good way to rack up entry hazard damage and can phaze setup sweepers that may not mind being hit with status, and it is highly recommended when running Will-O-Wisp. Calm Mind turns Arceus-Fairy into a dangerous setup sweeper, albeit one that requires significant team support to handle Necrozma-DM and especially Ho-Oh. It is a good option on teams that already have plentiful ways to spread status. Tera Water is mandatory in case Arceus-Fairy needs to take a boosted Flare Blitz from Koraidon, and it can be useful in a pinch against Necrozma-DM and Zacian-C. Tera Water in combination with Calm Mind can more easily clean up weakened teams, as Necrozma-DM won't have a coverage option to hit Arceus-Fairy. The EVs allow Arceus-Fairy to outspeed maximum Speed neutral-natured base 90 Pokemon such as Kyogre, with the rest being dumped into physical bulk.

While Arceus-Fairy is a great wall, it's unable to take on notable physical attackers like Necrozma-DM and Zacian-C without Terastallizing. As a result, defensive Necrozma-DM is a fantastic partner, and the two together reasonably cover nearly all physical threats in the tier. Ting-Lu and Clodsire can take on Miraidon and appreciate Arceus-Fairy's Dragon immunity that allows it to pivot into Draco Meteor, making them fantastic teammates. Defensive Ho-Oh, Gliscor, and Eternatus can handle offensive Ho-Oh without much fear of Sacred Fire burns, with Eternatus having the added benefit of checking Kyogre and absorbing Toxic Spikes. Strong but relatively slow wallbreakers such as Kyogre, Swords Dance Necrozma-DM, and offensive Ho-Oh like the paralysis support that Arceus-Fairy can provide. Kyogre notably helps with the Koraidon matchup, as it can pivot into Flare Blitz and bring rain that negates Koraidon's ability, making it a great partner. Giratina-O can handle Arceus-Ground and provide much-appreciated Defog support.

Ice Scales.description: Ice Scales Arceus-Fairy is a good wall to Pokemon such as Miraidon and Arceus-Ghost. Take Heart boosts Arceus-Fairy's offensive pressure, allowing to it sweep teams after checks like Mega Steelix and Primal Kyogre have been removed; the Special Defense boosts are also useful against boosting foes like Arceus-Ghost and Torch Song users. Thunder Cage traps and eliminates Imposter users, allowing Arceus-Fairy to Imposter-proof itself given it's at high HP. Arceus-Fairy struggles against Pokemon like Mega Garchomp because of Gigaton Hammer, so Fur Coat Pokemon like Mega Slowbro and Yveltal pair well with it. Strength Sap blockers, like Blissey, also pose a major problem by preventing Arceus-Fairy from meaningfully healing; as such, allies like mixed Ultra Necrozma can help pressure them. Arceus-Fairy Imposter-proofs itself thanks to Thunder Cage, but a Haze user like Chansey is recommended as a failsafe.

Fur Coat.description: Fur Coat Arceus-Fairy is a good option that compresses a wall and entry hazard remover into one slot. Tidy Up provides unblockable hazard removal and potentially allows Arceus-Fairy to sweep late-game when walls like Mega Steelix have been removed. Spirit Shackle allows Arceus-Fairy to Imposter-proof itself, as trapping Imposter users almost always means a KOed Imposter and a +6 Arceus-Fairy, and it also hits Fairy-resistant foes slightly harder than Magical Torque. Covert Cloak offers extra security against Magical Torque confusion from Imposter users, while Heavy-Duty Boots makes it more flexible as a hazard remover. Arceus-Fairy struggles against Sunsteel Strike users like Mega Lucario and Mega Garchomp, so checks to these like Miraidon and Ho-Oh are highly recommended. Arceus-Fairy also appreciates allies that can remove Steel-types like Mega Steelix and Celesteela in order to facilitate a late-game sweep. Spirit Shackle Arceus-Fairy Imposter-proofs itself.

Utility.description: Arceus-Fairy provides good utility with Stealth Rock and Taunt while blocking Koraidon from using Scale Shot and also threatening common Pokemon like Ting-Lu, Giratina-O, and Landorus-T. Utility Arceus-Fairy is generally seen on more offense-oriented teams, but it can be ran on balance teams occasionally. Will-O-Wisp prevents Pokemon like Dragon Dance Arceus-Ground, Extreme Killer Arceus, and Zacian-C from safely switching in on Arceus-Fairy. Taunt prevents Pokemon like Ting-Lu and Toxapex from setting up entry hazards and opposing Calm Mind Arceus-Fairy, and Calm Mind Arceus-Ground, and Tera Fire physical attackers such as the aforementioned Will-O-Wisp targets.Both Tera Fire and Tera Water give Arceus-Fairy key resistances to attacks like Koraidon's Flare Blitz and Zacian-C's Behemoth Blade, with Tera Water additionally helping against Kyogre's STAB moves and Tera Fire improving the matchup against opposing Arceus-Fairy. Tera Poison removes Arceus-Fairy's Steel-type weakness, lets it block Toxic from Pokemon like Eternatus and Toxapex, and lets it absorb Toxic Spikes. On hyper offense teams, Arceus-Fairy appreciates Pokemon like Calyrex-S, Arceus-Ground, Swords Dance Koraidon, and Extreme Killer Arceus, which benefit from it countering their checks in Ting-Lu and Landorus-T. On more balance-oriented teams, physical attackers such as Koraidon and Zacian-C can overwhelm Arceus-Fairy, so defensive checks to them in Landorus-T, Toxapex, and Skeledirge are appreciated. Arceus-Fairy also struggles with Calyrex-S, which makes Arceus and Ting-Lu great teammates.

Offensive Calm Mind.description: Calm Mind Arceus-Fairy is an excellent, self-sufficient wallbreaker and sweeper that matches up well against Koraidon and Ting-Lu. Earth Power hits foes like Zacian-C, Toxapex, and Skeledirge, as well as Tera Fire Pokemon such as Arceus and Koraidon. Tera Water gives Arceus-Fairy a resistance to attacks like Koraidon's Flare Blitz, Zacian-C's Behemoth Blade, and Choice Scarf Kyogre's Water Spout, making it harder to revenge kill and giving it more opportunities to set up. Tera Poison removes Arceus-Fairy's Steel weakness, provides it with an immunity to Toxic from foes like Toxapex and Eternatus, and lets it absorb bothersome Toxic Spikes. Tera Ground removes Arceus-Fairy's weakness to Behemoth Blade and lets +1 Earth Power OHKO Zacian-C and Toxapex. Calm Mind Arceus-Fairy fits on balance, bulky offense, and hyper offense teams that appreciate its ability to block Koraidon's Scale Shot and be a dangerous setup sweeper. Unlike bulkier Arceus-Fairy sets, Calm Mind Arceus-Fairy is unable to switch into Koraidon, and Pokemon like Zacian-C and Choice Specs Calyrex-S can revenge kill it, so on balance and bulky offense teams, it appreciates teammates such as Toxapex, Skeledirge, Landorus-T, and Ting-Lu checking these foes. On hyper offense teams, teammates like Calyrex-S and Arceus can take advantage of Zacian-C and opposing Calyrex-S for Arceus-Fairy. Hyper offense teams can also run an entry hazard lead like Glimmora or Ribombee to weaken Pokemon for Arceus-Fairy with Spikes or let it outspeed foes such as Choice Specs Calyrex-S, Zacian-C, and Choice Scarf Koraidon via Sticky Web, respectively. On all team playstyles, Calyrex-S appreciates Arceus-Fairy taking advantage of Ting-Lu and Choice Scarf Koraidon.

Extreme Killer.description: Extreme Killer Arceus-Fire is a good early-game wallbreaker and one of the most powerful late-game cleaners in the metagame thanks to its powerful Extreme Speed, which hits foes before they have a chance to revenge kill it. The combination of Swords Dance, Extreme Speed, and Tera Normal makes Arceus-Fire lethal if positioned correctly. Recover allows it to shrug off recoil damage from Flare Blitz with minimal difficulty. Tera Normal is essential for Arceus-Fire to have the necessary damage output to complete a sweep, as it cannot run a boosting item instead of Flame Plate; Tera Normal also removes its weaknesses to Ground- and Water-type attacks from the likes of Great Tusk, Landorus, and Palafin-H. 72 Speed EVs allow it to outspeed Timid Gholdengo. Arceus-Fire fits on a wide variety of teams, but it has a few notable partners. Arceus-Fire pairs especially well with Rillaboom, as it removes bulky Water-types like Dondozo for Arceus-Fire's sweep, and Grassy Terrain weakens Earthquake's damage and provides passive recovery. Hazard control from Great Tusk, Giratina, or Corviknight is also essential when using Arceus-Fire, as it suffers from a crippling weakness to Stealth Rock, greatly limiting its longevity. Arceus-Fire is vulnerable to Taunt and Encore users like Cyclizar, Magearna, and Ogerpon-H and Haze users like Toxapex, which can all prevent it from setting up. Teammates like Gholdengo, which is immune to all status moves, and Rillaboom, which typically does not use status or setup moves, are good partners to remedy this weakness. Arceus-Fire struggles to break through physical walls like Toxapex, Giratina, and Garganacl that resist its powerful Flare Blitz while also being able to take Extreme Speed, so partners like Landorus, Kyurem-W, and Zacian that can break through these threats form potent offensive cores with Arceus-Fire.

Utility Desolate Land.description: Fixes Desolate Land Arceus-Fire's main issue, being Imposter users, with Spirit Shackle. Offers additional utility with either entry hazard removal or the ability to easily dispatch Dondozo and Groudon.

Fur Coat.description: Arceus-Fire's great defensive typing and base stats make it a solid Fur Coat wall. Lava Plume's burn heavily cripples common physical attackers like Koraidon and Groudon and forces chip damage on opponents. Heal Bell allows Arceus-Fire to support its teammates by removing status conditions like paralysis, burn, and poison. U-turn allows Arceus-Fire to safely bring in offensive teammates to exploit passive Lava Plume switch-ins, such as Dondozo and Giratina; alternatively, Knock Off allows Arceus-Fire to remove items like Covert Cloak and Heavy-Duty Boots, as well as an Imposter user's Eviolite. Arceus-Fire best fits on balance teams that appreciate a reliable check to V-create users and a bulky pivot. Teammates like Palkia-O and Koraidon appreciate Arceus-Fire's pivoting and ability to bring in and force damage on passive walls. Imposter-proofing can be done with any Pokemon immune to burn, such as a Covert Cloak user. Tera Flying gives Arceus-Fire an immunity to Ground-type attacks from Groudon and Ursaluna, on top of gaining a Spikes immunity.

Desolate Land.description: Arceus-Fire's Desolate Land-boosted V-create is a brutally strong attack, letting it force out most Pokemon by threatening an OHKO. Arceus-Fire's niche over other V-create users is its powerful Solar Beam, which removes common physical walls such as Dondozo and Groudon. Growth enables Arceus-Fire to set up on passive walls, whereas Glacial Lance targets Dragon-types such as Eternatus and Giratina. Life Orb increases Arceus-Fire's power to absurd levels, OHKOing Arceus formes that don't resist its moves and 2HKOing most resistant targets with V-create. Heavy-Duty Boots, on the other hand, allows Arceus-Fire to take better advantage of its resistance to common Fairy- and Fire-type attacks. Arceus-Fire has difficulty breaking past Fire-immune foes, most commonly Well-Baked Body Steel-types, so it pairs well with teammates that can handle these targets like Groudon and Headlong Rush Enamorus. Imposter-proofing is done with Well-Baked Body Steel-types or Primordial Sea users. Tera Fire boosts the power of V-create even further, while Tera Grass grants a Ground resistance and a much stronger Solar Beam.

Fur Coat.description: Fur Coat Arceus-Ghost serves as both a sturdy physical wall and a potent setup wincon, having the unique ability to blank Knock Off and self-Imposter-proof with Spooky Plate + Judgment. Strength Sap is the preferred recovery option due to its higher healing against physical attackers like Mega Garchomp and ability to neutralize Attack boosts, but Shore Up can't be limited by Pokemon like Magic Guard Blissey. Take Heart and Nasty Plot bolster Arceus-Ghost's average Special Attack; Take Heart allows it to rid itself of sweep-ending poison from Mortal Spin, while Nasty Plot provides bigger boosts and means Shore Up sets can't be stalled by Imposter users. The last slot is dedicated to utility or coverage. Secret Sword nukes Blissey; Knock Off can ease Arceus-Ghost's sweep by removing Assault Vests, Yveltal's Heavy-Duty Boots, and the occasional Spooky Plate from Imposter users; Sludge Wave smashes Mega Audino and helps prevent Ice Scales Arceus-Fairy from PP stalling Arceus-Ghost; and Thunder Cage threatens Yveltal and Ho-Oh in addition to chipping special walls. Mega Garchomp appreciates Arceus-Ghost removing items from Yveltal and Mega Audino or, with certain coverage, straight up removing them; in return, Arceus-Ghost Imposter-proofs Mega Garchomp. Arceus-Ghost can struggle against Ash-Greninja, so a check to it like Fur Coat Mega Audino is a good partner. Arceus-Ghost generally Imposter-proofs itself, but in the event of your opponent having a rare Spooky Plate Imposter user, a teammate that can cover it like Magic Guard Blissey is recommended.

ubers.overview: Besides Koraidon and Miraidon, Arceus-Ground is perhaps the most terrifying setup sweeper in Ubers.
