Foul Play is a stronger alternative against physical attackers like Arceus and Dragon Dance Arceus-Ground that also does a decent chunk of damage to Koraidon and Zacian-C and allows Wo-Chien to punish physical attackers that have Taunt. Knock Off gives Wo-Chien more of a niche due relevant Pokemon that learn it being rare, and it is useful against foes like Ting-Lu and Landorus-T. However, Arceus formes, which can absorb Knock Off without losing their items, are quite omnipresent. Protect lets Wo-Chien safely rack up Leftovers and Leech Seed recovery. Alternatively, Taunt shuts down setup and entry hazard Pokemon such as Arceus formes and Ting-Lu on the switch. Tera Poison gives Wo-Chien key resistances to attacks like Koraidon's Low Kick, Zacian-C's Play Rough, Double Dance Miraidon's Dazzling Gleam, and the omnipresent U-turn from foes like Landorus-T, Koraidon, and Miraidon while also offering an immunity to Toxic and letting Wo-Chien absorb Toxic Spikes. However, Tera Poison also makes Wo-Chien weak to Ground-type moves from Arceus-Ground and Psychic-type moves from Calyrex-S, respectively. Wo-Chien fits best on balance and bulky offense teams that appreciate its ability to check Calyrex-S and Arceus-Ground while offering good recovery via Leech Seed to teammates. Wo-Chien benefits from teammates such as Skeledirge, Toxapex, and Landorus-T, which check Koraidon and Zacian-C for it. Special attackers in Arceus-Fairy, Substitute Kyogre, and Eternatus trouble Wo-Chien, so offensive checks to them such as Zacian-C, Choice Scarf Koraidon, Arceus, and Calyrex-S are appreciated. Water Absorb Closdire as a defensive teammate checks Arceus-Fairy, Kyogre, and Eternatus while setting up hazards.

monotype.comments:
Other Options

Dark

Chien-Pao can also run Psychic Fangs as an alternative coverage move to hit Toxapex, Iron Hands, Urshifu-R, and Okidogi while also breaking opposing screens or Aurora Veil.

All-Out Attacker (Dark).description:
Chien-Pao is an imposing force for any Dark team with its sky-high Speed, blitzing past threats like Iron Valiant and Greninja, and great Attack. Sword of Ruin lets it beat physical walls like Ting-Lu, Garganacl, and Toxapex, though it doesn't have great bulk, has to watch out for super effective priority moves from Scizor, Lokix, and Slither Wing, and struggles to break past walls like Dondozo and Quagsire. With Swords Dance, it can boost up to beat even the likes of Corviknight and Toxapex if it has Crunch. Fighting-type coverage picks off Dark-types like Kingambit and Greninja. Sacred Sword picks off weakened Garganacl, while Brick Break destroys opposing Dark or Fairy team's dual screens. Ice Shard stops common revenge killers like Choice Scarf Meowscarada, Flutter Mane, and Great Tusk.

As Chien-Pao focuses on breaking down foes with its sheer power and Speed, it appreciates support from its teammates. Ting-Lu can set up Stealth Rock and Spikes, while Skuntank can set up Toxic Spikes and pressure Fairy-types, all of which make wallbreaking for Chien-Pao easier. Grimmsnarl provides Chien-Pao with dual screens support, making setting up easier. Sableye can burn opposing Pokemon and cripple them with Taunt and Knock Off, removing Heavy-Duty Boots and making foes susceptible to entry hazards, while also acting as a Fighting-type move switch-in. Choice Specs Greninja can clean up after Chien-Pao has done enough damage while also countering Fire-types that would annoy Chien-Pao such as Skeledirge and Cinderace if Chien-Pao does not have Crunch. Hydreigon can break Steel-types for Chien-Pao if it forgoes Fighting-type coverage or Swords Dance, beating Fighting-neutral Steel-types like Corviknight and Scizor. Choice Scarf Meowscarada is able to threaten Pokemon that counter Chien-Pao such as Quaquaval and Choice Scarf users such as Iron Valiant, Gholdengo, and Great Tusk while also being able to pivot to Chien-Pao with U-turn.

Swords Dance Sweeper (Ice).description:
Chien-Pao's high Speed, solid Attack, and good offensive typing allow it to be a very potent setup sweeper. Icicle Crash is preferred over Ice Spinner for its flinch chance and higher Base Power, the latter of which—among other things—allows it to always 2HKO Sableye and bulky Great Tusk, while Ice Spinner may miss out on these 2HKOs. Crunch allows Chien-Pao to hit Skeledirge and Gholdengo—two problematic Pokemon for Ice teams. Sacred Sword and Brick Break both allow Chien-Pao to threaten Dark-, Steel-, and Ice-types such as Kingambit and opposing Chien-Pao. Sacred Sword is stronger and comes with the ability to ignore Defense boosts, while Brick Break removes Reflect and Light Screen, which is extremely helpful against teams with support from Grimmsnarl or Klefki. Psychic Fangs is an alternative option to Sacred Sword or Brick Break to hit Toxapex and Fighting-types such as Paldean Tauros-F. Sucker Punch is significantly stronger than Ice Shard and allows Chien-Pao to hit Pokemon like Gholdengo, Scizor, and Flutter Mane.

This set very much appreciates Aurora Veil support from Abomasnow, as it allows Chien-Pao to set up on many Pokemon that would otherwise threaten it out as well as allowing it to survive revenge killing attempts from the likes of Choice Scarf Meowscarada and Extreme Speed Dragonite. Spikes support from Froslass is also greatly appreciated, as they wear down Pokemon that may otherwise be difficult for Chien-Pao to break, such as Dondozo and Klefki. Although Chien-Pao is able to fit on practically any team, it pairs especially well with other powerful sweepers such as Baxcalibur and Cloyster, weakening or even KOing their checks such as Air Balloon Gholdengo and Skeledirge. Baxcalibur in particular can take on Pokemon such as Toxapex and Paldean Tauros-F with a powerful Earthquake, allowing Chien-Pao to KO them and sweep the opposing team; furthermore, Choice Band Baxcalibur pressures Chien-Pao answers such as Quagsire and Corviknight. Baxcalibur's Thermal Exchange also allows it to switch into Will-O-Wisp that would cripple Chien-Pao as well as be an emergency switch-in to a Fire-type attack. Shell Smash Cloyster appreciates the removal of Skeledirge and Froslass.

Choice Band Wallbreaker (Ice).description:
Choice Band Chien-Pao is a potent mid-game threat, powerful wallbreaker, and good late-game cleaner. Additionally, it is capable of breaking through physically defensive Pokemon such as Corviknight and Quagsire, both of which tend to be tough matchups for many other Ice staples. Icicle Crash is preferred over Ice Spinner for its flinch chance and slightly higher Base Power, notably being favored to 2HKO Azumarill and OHKO offensive Pelipper, neither of which are feats Ice Spinner is capable of. Sacred Sword and Brick Break provide crucial coverage for Pokemon such as Kingambit and opposing Chien-Pao, and Sucker Punch allows Chien-Pao to KO faster Pokemon such as Choice Scarf Gholdengo.

This set heavily appreciates Spikes from Froslass to wear down its switch-ins, sometimes allowing it to grab KOs it would otherwise miss out on; for example, Crunch always 2HKOes physically defensive Toxapex with one layer of Spikes, but it is favored to not 2HKO without any Spikes. Rapid Spin support from Avalugg is also appreciated, allowing Chien-Pao more opportunities to enter the field. Since this set focuses on opening holes in teams, setup sweepers are excellent partners for it, as Chien-Pao can dent or remove their checks to allow the sweep to happen much more easily. Shell Smash Cloyster in particular appreciates Chien-Pao's ability to beat Gholdengo and significantly damage other Pokemon such as Corviknight that Cloyster may otherwise struggle to break through. Dragon Dance Baxcalibur appreciates Chien-Pao's ability to 2HKO Quagsire and physically defensive Corviknight, which normally would stop Baxcalibur in its tracks. Finally, Belly Drum Cetitan appreciates Chien-Pao's ability to break Unaware walls such as Skeledirge and Quagsire; in return, Cetitan acts as speed control if snow is in effect, aiding in Chien-Pao's weakness to Choice Scarf users such as Iron Moth.

Choice Band (Dark).description:
Chien-Pao is a weapon of destruction for Dark teams, boasting a lofty Speed tier that allows it to outspeed most Pokemon in the metagame like Spectrier, Sneasler, and Tornadus-T. Icicle Crash helps significantly in the Flying matchup, 2HKOing Articuno and defensive Corviknight after Stealth Rock, thus preventing any Flying Pokemon from switching in safely, and in the Dragon matchup, OHKOing Walking Wake after Stealth Rock and 2HKOing Hisuian Goodra. Icicle Crash also OHKOes foes like Ursaluna-B, 2HKOes foes like defensive Great Tusk, and secures a 2HKO on defensive Quagsire. Crunch helps in securing an OHKO on Colbur Berry Spectrier and 2HKOing bulkier foes like Hatterene and mixed Toxapex after one layer of Spikes. Ice Shard's priority allows Chien-Pao to OHKO faster targets such as Dragapult and Choice Scarf Enamorus, Landorus, Meowscarada, and Flutter Mane after Stealth Rock. Sacred Sword allows Chien-Pao to secure an OHKO on foes like Kingambit, Choice Specs Greninja, Mamoswine, and Baxcalibur. It also allows Chien-Pao to hit opposing Chien-Pao, albeit with the threat of a Speed tie.

Chien-Pao appreciates Mandibuzz's Defog support to prevent it from being worn down by entry hazards. It can also bring Chien-Pao in safely using a slow U-turn. Mandibuzz is a great switch-in for Fighting-type attacks from enemies like Choice Scarf Sneasler and Choice Scarf Great Tusk as well, which Chien-Pao is extremely vulnerable to, as well as being capable of checking setup sweepers like Azumarill and Scizor with Foul Play. In return, Chien-Pao deals with opponents like Sandy Shocks and Baxcalibur, which can cause problems for Mandibuzz. Kingambit has impressive offensive synergy with Chien-Pao due to its neutrality to Fairy-type attacks, being able to eliminate foes like Hatterene with Iron Head and Choice Scarf Flutter Mane with Sucker Punch after Stealth Rock. In return, Chien-Pao hits threats to Kingambit like Dragon Dance Dragonite, Iron Treads, Landorus-T, and defensive Gliscor, whose Earthquake can prove disadvantageous for Kingambit. Sableye is a great teammate for Chien-Pao, as its Fighting-type immunity helps it switch directly into attacks from threats like Iron Hands and Zamazenta. Paired with Prankster, Sableye can easily burn threats to Chien-Pao like Azumarill and the aforementioned Fighting-types and paralyze foes like Dragapult, Volcarona, Iron Valiant and Flutter Mane, allowing Chien-Pao to break them with ease. Sableye also offers Knock Off support against foes like Articuno and Toxapex, which will suffer damage from hazards after the removal of Heavy-Duty Boots. Greninja is also a great teammate for Chien-Pao due to its excellent coverage, being able to OHKO Fire-type threats like Volcarona and Ogerpon-H after Stealth Rock with Hydro Pump and outspeed Choice Scarf users like Enamorus and Galarian Zapdos and eliminate them with Ice Beam when running Choice Scarf itself. Choice Scarf Greninja also takes care of opposing Chien-Pao and Kingambit with Low Kick, while Extrasensory 2HKOes threats like physically defensive Toxapex and Zamazenta and secures an OHKO on Okidogi. In return, Chien-Pao deals with Ogerpon-W, Alolan Muk, and Articuno, which can take advantage of Greninja. Choice Scarf Meowscarada boasts great synergy with Choice Band Chien-Pao, allowing fast pivoting with U-turn and sweeping in the Dark mirror with the help of Play Rough. It also threatens Quagsire, Choice Scarf Great Tusk, Urshifu-R, and Quaquaval with Flower Trick. In return, Chien-Pao breaks foes like Clodsire, Kingambit, Alolan Muk, and opposing Chien-Pao that can hamper Meowscarada's ability to sweep. Teammates like Ting-Lu and Hisuian Samurott can set Spikes for Chien-Pao, boosting its wallbreaking ability and breaking potential Focus Sashes from opponents like Ceruledge. Alolan Muk absorbs Fairy-type attacks from foes like Flutter Mane, Enamorus, and Hatterene for Chien-Pao and threatens them with Poison Jab. Overqwil, on the other hand, switches in against opposing Chien-Pao and Meowscarada with the help of Intimidate and threatens them back with Barb Barrage. Teammates like Galarian Moltres and Hydreigon are other alternatives that can help break foes like defensive Great Tusk and Heatran, which Chien-Pao appreciates. Hydreigon can switch into Fire-type moves aimed at Chien-Pao from foes like Moltres and Ceruledge and set Stealth Rock to facilitate its wallbreaking.

vgc2024.overview:
• Chien-Pao is an excellent offensive Pokemon bearing a great offensive typing and a fantastic Speed tier. Chien-Pao is capable of taking on the majority of the format, and it's especially strong against Tornadus and Landorus thanks to its typing and Sword of Ruin.

  • Incineroar has Intimidate and resists both of Chien-Pao's STAB attacks, which makes it difficult for Chien-Pao to deal with, therefore Urshifu-R is a strong partner as it utilizes Sword of Ruin and pressures Incineroar.

  • Chien-Pao also struggles to take on Urshifu-R and Iron Hands, which take any of its attacks comfortably and threaten it in return.

Glass Cannon.description:
• Ice Spinner is an alternative Ice-type STAB move that provides increased accuracy and a way for teams to handle Rillaboom and Indeedee-F in exchange for higher power and a flinch chance. However, it prevents Chien-Pao from attacking Rocky Helmet Amoonguss and Latias as freely.

  • Chien-Pao uses Sacred Sword as coverage for relevant Pokemon such as Incineroar and Kingambit.

  • Chien-Pao utilizes Focus Sash to make up for its poor defensive typing combined with its lackluster bulk, as it allows it to stay an extra turn on the field to help partners exploit Sword of Ruin, which is significant for offensive compositions.

  • With Tera Stellar, Chien-Pao has the option to pick up OHKOs on Pokemon it usually wouldn't be able to OHKO, such as Flutter Mane and Amoonguss. However, it has to be wary of pivots and foes using Protect, as the power boost is temporary. Chien-Pao can also use Tera Ghost to remove its Fighting weakness and become immune to priority moves like Fake Out, which is crucial for Focus Sash.

battlestadiumsingles.overview:
Welcome to Battle Stadium Singles Regulation F! This Pokemon has been updated to reflect the new Pokemon that The Indigo Disk has brought!

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

RUINOUS ATTACKER.description:
• With its high Attack and Speed, and incredible ability in Sword of Ruin, Chien-Pao is one of the strongest physical attackers in the game.

  • Icicle Crash: While Ice Spinner is perfectly accurate, Icicle Crash’s higher power and flinch chance makes it the preferred attack. Additionally, not being a contact move allows Chien-Pao to avoid unnecessary chip damage from Rocky Helmet users.

  • Sucker Punch versus Crunch: Sucker Punch offers priority with a strong base power at the cost of necessitating prediction, while Crunch is a more standard attack whose Defense drop can allow Chien-Pao to potentially break through bulky foes.

  • Ice Shard: Ice Shard is a more consistent albeit weaker alternative to Sucker Punch.

  • Sacred Sword: Sacred Sword provides coverage for Pokemon that resist one or both of Chien-Pao’s STAB attacks, like Chi-Yu and other Chien-Pao, plus its Chien-Pao's best shot against Porygon2. Additionally, ignoring defense boosts allows Chien-Pao to deal more consistent damage to foes who boost their Defense like Archaludon and Garganacl.

  • Psychic Fangs: Psychic Fangs rips up Dual Screens, which makes Focus Sash Chien-Pao's match-up against Alolan Ninetales more favorable. Otherwise, it does good damage to Primarina, Urshifu-R, and Toxapex.

  • Adamant versus Jolly: Adamant gives Chien-Pao a significant power boost for sniping Pokemon with Sucker Punch, but Jolly is important for Speed tying with Flutter Mane and opposing Chien-Pao.

  • 0-1 SpA IV: If using Tera Blast on Jolly Chien-Pao, make sure to to use a SpA IV that's 0-1. This is because if Flutter Mane uses Charm, any SpA IV that's higher will result in Tera Blast becoming a Special Attack.

Other Options

  • Swords Dance: While it can be difficult to fit and very reliant on Focus Sash, Swords Dance boosts Chien-Pao’s Attack to unwallable levels, making it a very potent sweeper.

  • Lash Out: Lash Out is a situational but powerful response to Charm Flutter Mane and Breaking Swipe Gouging Fire thanks to the doubled BP on the turn Chien-Pao's Attack is lowered.

  • Sheer Cold: While it may seem alluring, Sheer Cold is a very risky slot on this set, as its standard attacks already hit most relevant foes. Even if Chien-Pao fails to KO a foe, it will generally leave it within range for a teammate.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Chien-Pao offers power in spades without needing to Terastallize, only needing it on very rare occasions to break past specific walls or dodge priority moves aimed at it.

  • Electric: Tera Electric can be used in tandem with Tera Blast to improve Chien-Pao’s matchup against key threats such as Urshifu-R and Primarina while also making it immune to paralysis.

  • Ghost: Tera Ghost doesn’t offer much offensive benefit, but it allows Chien-Pao to dodge Normal-type priority from Dragonite, Ogerpon formes, and Entei, which can be particularly useful if using Swords Dance.

  • Stellar: Stellar's one-time boost per attacking type can open up new sweeping opportunities for Chien-Pao, especially for Life Orb sets.

  • Grass: Tera Grass lets Chien-Pao survive Urshifu-R's Surging Strikes, which otherwise threatens to OHKO through Focus Sash. Combined with Tera Blast, Chien-Pao still threatens big damage into Urshifu-R and Primarina.

  • Dark: Tera Dark boosts Sucker Punch to extreme power levels while making Crunch exceptionally difficult to switch into without a resistance.

  • Ice: Tera Ice can allow Chien-Pao to finish foes off with Ice Shard from higher ranges and makes Icicle Crash an even more formidable tool.

Items

  • Focus Sash: This is the most reliable item for Chien-Pao, flipping many potential match-ups such as offensive Flutter Mane, and makes Chien-Pao much easier to switch-in at least once.

  • Life Orb: Life Orb makes Chien-Pao a terrifying sweeper and wall-breaker in one, 2HKOing the vast majority of the metagame!

  • Sitrus Berry: While Sitrus Berry may seem strange on such an offensive Pokemon, it can save Tera Electric Chien-Pao from being OHKOed by Adamant Choice Scarf Urshifu-R's Surging Strikes. 36 HP and 36 Defense EVs can be used to guarantee this, but even without investment, Chien-Pao has around a 93% chance of surviving.

Choice Band Breaker.description:
• Choice Band transforms Chien-Pao into one of the most bloodthirsty wall-breakers in the metagame!

  • Ice Shard versus Sucker Punch: Ice Shard is the weaker but more reliable priority move for cleaning late-game. Sucker Punch is one of the most powerful priority moves in the metagame, but falters against support moves like Substitute and Thunder Wave.

  • Sacred Swords versus Psychic Fangs: Sacred Sword gives Chien-Pao useful coverage against bulky foes like Porygon2 and Archaludon, as well as opposing Chien-Pao. Psychic Fang's coverage is worse, but it hits the important Urshifu-R and Primarina, as well as breaking dual screens.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: While Chien-Pao is already plenty powerful, Choice Band combined with Tera can elevate 2HKOs to OHKOs on some of the bulkiest walls in the meta. For this reason, Tera can be worth using on Choice Band sets.

  • Dark: Tera Dark turns Choice Band Crunch into a devastating wallbreaker move that few can withstand, OHKOing Max HP Annihilape, Entei, and Scizor if using an Adamant nature. Neutralizing Chien-Pao’s Steel-type weakness also makes it less vulnerable to Scizor’s Bullet Punch.

  • Ice: Tera Ice gives Choice Band Icicle Crash enough power to challenge even physically defensive Ting-Lu, having approximately a 69% chance to OHKO if using an Adamant nature; be warned, however, that Ting-Lu often Terastallizes in front of Chien-Pao, making this inconsistent. The extra power behind Ice Shard is also a welcome boost.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy combined with Choice Band Tera Blast handily defeats some of Chien-Pao's less common checks, OHKOing standard variants of Annihilape and Urshifu formes. It also removes several weaknesses, most notably turning Chien-Pao's 4x Fighting-type weakness into a resistance. Make sure to use a Special Attack IV of 0 or 1 to avoid Charm flipping Tera Blast into a Special Attack!

EV Spreads

  • 20 HP / 228 Atk / 12 Def / 60 SpD / 188 Spe Adamant: This spread allows Chien-Pao to survive all but the highest damage rolls from Tera Normal Choice Band Dragonite's Extreme Speed, and Modest Ursaluna-B's Vacuum Wave. The Speed investment outspeeds Jolly Ogerpon formes.

  • 252 Atk / 4 Def / 252 Spe Jolly: This spread just attempts to speedtie with Flutter Mane and opposing Chien-Pao.

Choice Band.description: Choice Band Chien-Pao is a strong wallbreaker, being able to blast through many teams on its own. Its high Attack and Speed combined with its good STAB moves and Choice Band to bolster its damage even further make it extremely difficult to handle. Lash Out can be used over Crunch to hit Intimidate Corviknight harder. Ice Shard helps to pick up KOs on weakened, faster foes like Galarian Zapdos and Choice Scarf Roaring Moon; it can also OHKO frail targets like Hisuian Electrode from full HP. Sacred Sword hits Dark-, Steel-, and Rock-types like Kingambit, Heatran, and Garganacl. Chien-Pao can have a hard time breaking through defensive Pokemon like Intimidate Corviknight and Quaquaval, making partners like Ceruledge and Dragonite appreciated. Choice Scarf users like Walking Wake can be tough foes for Chien-Pao, forcing it out; this makes slow pivots like Meloetta and RegenVest Manaphy good teammates, as they can deal with these Choice Scarf users and also help bring it in safely after taking a hit. Chien-Pao's weakness to Stealth Rock can become a problem quickly if not accounted for, so entry hazard removers like Great Tusk and Mandibuzz are good partners.

Swords Dance.description: Access to Swords Dance and a high Attack and Speed stat make Chien-Pao a powerful wallbreaker and sweeper. It also has a STAB combination that is resisted by few Pokemon; hits physical walls like Mandibuzz, Deoxys-D, and Great Tusk super effectively; and can OHKO many offensive threats like Walking Wake after a Swords Dance. Ice Shard picks off faster foes like Hisuian Electrode and, after some chip damage, Choice Scarf Roaring Moon and Sandy Shocks. Adaptability lets Chien-Pao OHKO Iron Moth and makes breaking through walls like Intimidate Corviknight easier, while Magic Guard offers more longevity. Special attackers like Latios and Azelf appreciate Chien-Pao being able to threaten their switch-ins like Gholdengo and Swampert, letting them rip massive holes in or sweep teams; they can also safely pivot it in, allowing more opportunities for it to deal significant damage. Chien-Pao appreciates other physical wallbreakers like Choice Band Roaring Moon and Galarian Zapdos helping break through walls like Intimidate Corviknight that it struggles to deal with. Chien-Pao is also prone to getting revenge killed by Choice Scarf users such as Walking Wake and Azelf, so teammates that can switch into them and safely pivot it in like Swampert and Empoleon are appreciated.

All-out Attacker.description:
• Ice Spinner is an alternative to Icicle Crash because of its better accuracy, but it is slightly weaker, cannot flinch, and is a contact move.
  • Ice Shard hits Miraidon and Koraidon for super effective damage, 2HKOing the former, and 2HKOes Flutter Mane reliably. Sucker Punch may be considered over Ice Shard, as it does more damage to Iron Bundle and can KO Flutter Mane, but it misses out on revenge killing Koraidon and is often prediction-reliant.
  • Sacred Sword allows Chien-Pao to OHKO Chi-Yu, Kingambit, and opposing Chien-Pao, which otherwise resist its STAB moves.
  • Chien-Pao can use Tera Dark to make Crunch stronger and 2HKO Corviknight and Toxapex if it gets lucky with a Defense drop. Chien-Pao can also use Tera Ice in order to 2HKO Corviknight more reliably and boost Ice Shard damage—notably against Miraidon, Flutter Mane, and Koraidon. Lastly, Tera Electric Chien-Pao with Tera Blast can easily break through bulky checks like Toxapex, Corviknight, and Dondozo.
  • Chien-Pao fits best with other strong wallbreakers that benefit from the removal of defensive walls. These include Koraidon, Miraidon, Iron Bundle, and offensive Great Tusk.
  • Defensive partners like Ting-Lu, Great Tusk, and Skeledirge are mandatory to handle fast and strong threats like Koraidon and Miraidon, as Chien-Pao cannot OHKO them if they are at full health. Additionally, Great Tusk and Ting-Lu can set up entry hazards, which is crucial for getting chip on defensive walls.

Choice Band.description:
• Icicle Crash 2HKOes Corviknight and avoids Rocky Helmet, while Ice Spinner is more accurate and has the bonus of removing Electric Terrain.
  • Sacred Sword hits checks such as Kingambit and opposing Chien-Pao. Another option is to run a double priority combination with Ice Shard and Sucker Punch. Sucker Punch hits very crucial Pokemon that Ice Shard can't, such as Tera Fire Koraidon, Tera Fire Flutter Mane, and Iron Bundle.
  • An Adamant nature allows Chien-Pao to achieve ridiculous feats such as revenge killing Flutter Mane from 90% HP with Ice Shard. A Jolly nature lets Chien-Pao Speed tie with Koraidon, Miraidon, opposing Jolly Chien-Pao, and Flutter Mane, giving Chien-Pao the freedom to click its strongest moves less reluctantly.
  • Tera Dark allows Chien-Pao to 2HKO the entire tier while letting it still switch into weaker moves such as Shadow Ball. Tera Ice gives Chien-Pao the ability to OHKO Flutter Mane with Ice Shard, making it a terrific late-game cleaner.
  • Choice Band Chien-Pao is a wallbreaker that is best suited for bulky offense structures that love its revenge killing and wallbreaking capabilities.
  • Pokemon like Iron Treads, Hatterene, and Koraidon, which can provide entry hazard control or pivoting, are excellent teammates for Chien-Pao.

Swords Dance.description:
• Swords Dance makes Chien-Pao immensely threatening, letting it break through bulky foes such as Toxapex, Great Tusk, and Corviknight.
  • Ice Spinner is a more reliable option thanks to its perfect accuracy, but Icicle Crash's power and flinch chance greatly help out against all foes that can take a hit from Chien-Pao, such as Corviknight and Great Tusk.
  • Ice Shard is a reliable priority attack mainly used to better deal with Miraidon and Koraidon.
  • Sucker Punch can be used as a stronger but prediction-reliant alternative that OHKOes Flutter Mane without a boost and OHKOes the likes of Iron Bundle and Miraidon after a boost. It also provides a favorable roll to OHKO Koraidon if it has Terastallized into the Fire typing.
  • Tera Dark boosts Crunch, allowing Chien-Pao to more reliably beat physically defensive Corviknight and Toxapex. Tera Dark Chien-Pao holding Life Orb can OHKO both Pokemon after a Swords Dance boost.
  • Tera Ice can be used instead to boost Chien Pao's Ice-type attacks. This also makes Ice Shard a better revenge killing option.
  • Sacred Sword can be used to hit foes that resist Chien-Pao's STAB moves, like Kingambit and opposing Chien-Pao.
  • Life Orb is the primary item choice because it gives Chien-Pao a lot of power while allowing it to run a Jolly nature and not lose out on potential OHKOs.
  • Heavy-Duty Boots sacrifices a lot of power but gives Chien-Pao the ability to ignore entry hazards, allowing it to come in and potentially set up multiple times throughout a game.
  • Black Glasses in conjunction with an Adamant nature can be used as an alternative to Life Orb to not have recoil while still being able to OHKO the likes of Corviknight and Toxapex after obtaining a Swords Dance boost and using Tera Dark.
  • This set can be used as both an early-game wallbreaker and a late-game sweeper thanks to Chien-Pao's strong STAB attacks and priority moves.
  • Chien-Pao has very little defensive utility, so having a defensive core for it to fall back on is recommended for balance teams. On offensive teams, it can afford to run Focus Sash to take at least one hit from foes that would usually threaten it out.
  • Great Tusk is Chien-Pao's best teammate, as Great Tusk can handle one of Chien-Pao's hardest checks in Koraidon and provide Rapid Spin support. Rapid Spin also helps keep Focus Sash intact.

Cheems Pao.description:
• Chien-Pao is a fantastic physical attacker that can improve its and its teammates' physical damage through Sword of Ruin. It is very effective with priority attackers such as Dragonite and Palafin, as well as other fast physical attackers such as Choice Band Dragapult and Choice Scarf Basculegion-F.

  • Ice Spinner is a STAB option that easily grabs OHKOs on Dragonite and Landorus-T while clearing Psychic Terrain for its own Sucker Punch and teammates' priority moves. Icicle Crash can be used for a slight increase in power, a sizeable flinch chance, and avoiding Rocky Helmet damage, however it comes with a chance to miss and cannot clear Psychic Terrain. If used with Rillaboom, Icicle Crash is recommended to avoid clearing your own Grassy Terrain.

  • Sucker Punch allows Chien-Pao to pick off faster threats such as Booster Energy Flutter Mane and Booster Energy Iron Bundle. Sucker Punch is also crucial to keeping Chien-Pao relevant against Tailwind or Trick Room, and pressures opposing priority users such as Palafin.

  • Sacred Sword OHKOs many relevant Pokemon that resist Chien-Pao's STAB combination such as Kingambit, Chi-Yu, and opposing Chien-Pao. Crunch is a more consistent option for Dark-type STAB, knocking out Indeedee-F through Psychic Terrain and threatening Pokemon such as Cresselia that are using status moves.

  • Life Orb is used to push Chien-Pao's offenses to dizzying heights, OHKOing bulky Rillaboom and Flutter Mane with Ice Spinner and Sucker Punch, respectively. Focus Sash gets around Chien-Pao's poor defenses and allows it to survive a hit against strong, fast attackers such as Flutter Mane and Choice Scarf Chi-Yu. However, the item is rendered useless by Stealth Rock, a relatively common sight.

  • Jolly nature Chien-Pao speed ties Flutter Mane and opposing Chien-Pao. An Adamant nature can be used for more power, giving Life Orb Chien-Pao a chance to OHKO Cresselia with Crunch.

  • Tera Dark boosts the damage of Sucker Punch, allowing it to more effectively pick off weakened foes and score an OHKO on all variants of Flutter Mane. Tera Ghost provides an immunity to Fighting-type moves, improving its matchup into Iron Hands, as well as priority such as Fake Out and Extreme Speed that would otherwise threaten Chien-Pao.

  • In addition to other physical attackers, Chien-Pao appreciates partners that can cover its defensive shortcomings, notably to Fire-, Fairy-, and Fighting-types. Volcanion and Heatran perform well against Fairy-types such as Flutter Mane and can hold off opposing Fire-types. Amoonguss and Landorus-T can be used to switch into Fighting-type attacks from Iron Hands aimed at Chien-Pao.

Weakness Policy.description: This EV spread survives Choice Band Hisuian Avalugg's Avalanche and Timid Choice Specs Iron Bundle's Hydro Pump; the remaining EVs are invested in Attack.

vgc2024.overview:
• Ting-Lu is an offensive threat with incredibly high defensive stats and massive HP. Thanks to Vessel of Ruin, it can slow down the metagame's special attacking compositions, like Farigiraf + Ursaluna-B and Indeedee + Iron Crown.

  • Ting-Lu synergizes well with Kommo-o, as the combination of Vessel of Ruin and Iron Defense makes Kommo-o difficult to remove and allows for a sweep. Ting-Lu appreciates Trick Room from Porygon2, while Porygon2 benefits from the added bulk from Ting-Lu's ability Vessel of Ruin.

  • Due to its poor typing, Ting-Lu generally struggles against physical attackers that threaten it for super effective damage like the Urshifu formes, Ogerpon-W, and Rillaboom. It relies on teammates like Incineroar and Amoonguss to slow these threats down with Intimidate and redirection support.

Bulky Attacker.description:
• Heavy Slam allows it to OHKO Flutter Mane. Ruination consistently chips foes when they resist Stomping Tantrum or if Ting-Lu is Intimidated, making it a premier move for Ting-Lu, as it stays on the field for a long time. Snarl slows down special attackers, which, in combination with Vessel of Ruin, allows Ting-Lu to shut down almost every special attacker.

  • Ting-Lu uses Assault Vest to bolster its special bulk in combination with its ability, Vessel of Ruin.

  • The EV spread allows Ting-Lu to survive Tera Fairy Choice Specs Flutter Mane Moonblast and avoid getting 2HKOed by Tera Fairy Choice Specs Dazzling Gleam from Flutter Mane. It also allows it to almost always take Tera Water 156 EV Adamant Surging Strikes from Urshifu-R and comfortably survive Tera Water Ivy Cudgel from Ogerpon-W. The Attack investment ensures an OHKO on Flutter Mane with Heavy Slam when not Intimidated and a 2HKO on Incineroar and Raging Bolt with Stomping Tantrum.

  • Tera Poison is the most consistent Tera type for Ting-Lu, as it provides a resistance to Flutter Mane's Moonblast, the STAB moves of Rillaboom, and Close Combat from the Urshifu formes. It also becomes neutral to Water-type attacks from Urshifu-R and Ogerpon-W.

ubers.overview: Ting-Lu's titanic bulk makes it the premier special wall and check to Miraidon in Ubers. Unlike Arceus-Ground and Clodsire, Ting-Lu is able to take on Miraidon and generate momentum in the process thanks to Vessel of Ruin and a fantastic support movepool featuring Spikes, Ruination, and Whirlwind. Other special threats such as Calm Mind Arceus-Ground and offensive Eternatus are hurt in viability by Ting-Lu's presence alone. Ting-Lu's physical bulk should not be underestimated either, as it can take on threats like Dragon Dance Necrozma-DM and Zekrom when needed. These incredible defenses come at the cost of lacking any form of reliable recovery, making Ting-Lu extremely vulnerable to entry hazard damage, Knock Off, and status. As such, some teams may prefer either Clodsire due to its superior role compression in checking Kyogre, absorbing Toxic Spikes, and ability to run Heavy-Duty Boots or Arceus-Ground for its better offensive presence and reliable recovery. Effective use of Ting-Lu requires careful management of its so that it fulfills its role of setting entry hazards early-game and staying healthy enough to check threats late-game.
ubers.comments:
Other Options

Heavy-Duty Boots may be run over Leftovers, as it better preserves Ting-Lu's longevity should Spikes be set on its side of the field. However, Leftovers is usually preferred, as Ting-Lu itself likes to tank some hits early-game to set its own Spikes, and Heavy-Duty Boots removes Ting-Lu's only form of healing. Taunt is an option to harass opposing Ting-Lu and prevent setup from incoming Pokemon such as Gliscor, but Whirlwind can achieve similar results and offers more utility for checking threats.

Checks and Counters

Gliscor: Gliscor is the most notable threat to Ting-Lu, as it can heal off any Ruination damage with Poison Heal and use it as an easy chance to set entry hazards or use Toxic.

Chip Damage: Ting-Lu is completely vulnerable to all forms of entry hazard and status effect chip damage, which can rack up quickly thanks to its lack of recovery.

Knock Off: Knock Off from Necrozma-DM and Gliscor removes Ting-Lu's only form of recovery, devastating Ting-Lu's longevity.

Physical Attackers: Despite Ting-Lu's massive physical bulk, it is vulnerable to super effective coverage from strong physical attackers like Koraidon, Zacian-C, Calyrex-I, Kyurem-B, and Chien-Pao. Also, Ho-Oh is immune to Earthquake and can heal off Ruination damage with Regenerator while being able to cripple Ting-Lu with a burn from Sacred Fire. These threats may come in on Ting-Lu easily with support from U-turn Miraidon.

Kyogre: Kyogre is one of the few special attackers that is not bothered by Ting-Lu thanks to its rain-boosted STAB Water-type attacks, although it hates directly switching in.

Taunt: Taunt prevents Ting-Lu from using Spikes and Whirlwind, so Taunt users like Arceus-Ground and Landorus-T can prove severely annoying.

Special Wall.description:
Whirlwind prevents opposing setup threats such as Double Dance Miraidon and Calm Mind Arceus-Ground from snowballing out of control. This can also rack up entry hazard damage and is a decent way to maintain momentum against an incoming Gliscor. Protect can also be used in this moveslot, which allows for more Leftovers recovery and scouting of Choice item users and Tera types. Stealth Rock may be chosen in the fourth slot to save moveslots for Ting-Lu's teammates, but it makes Ting-Lu less reliable at checking threats in general. Ting-Lu will very rarely need to Terastallize, as its natural typing provides a strong Electric immunity against Miraidon. Tera Steel provides a Fairy and Dragon resistance, which can be critical for handling Calm Mind + Tera Fairy or Tera Dragon Miraidon sets. It has the additional benefit of an immunity to Toxic from Gliscor and Eternatus. Tera Fairy provides a Dragon immunity against Miraidon, allowing Ting-Lu to better answer Tera Dragon sets holding either Calm Mind or Choice Specs while making Ting-Lu resistant or immune to Koraidon's STAB moves. However, this comes at the expense of not resisting Fairy versus Tera Fairy Miraidon. Tera Poison is useful against Koraidon, Zacian-C, and Tera Fairy Miraidon, and it allows Ting-Lu to absorb Toxic Spikes. Tera Water allows Ting-Lu to take Kyogre's STAB moves while also resisting Koraidon's Flare Blitz and Necrozma-DM's Sunsteel Strike. It also lets Ting-Lu check the rare, but otherwise hard to check, Chi-Yu and Walking Wake.

Ting-Lu struggles against physical threats such as Koraidon, Zacian-C, and Arceus, so it is best paired with Pokemon that can switch into them reliably such as defensive Necrozma-DM, Arceus-Fairy, Gliscor, Arceus-Water, Skeledirge, and Landorus-T. Gliscor deserves special mention, as it can allow Ting-Lu to run Stealth Rock or alternatively allow Gliscor itself to run Toxic Spikes, forming an impressive hazard-stacking core. Necrozma-DM is also notable for having Knock Off, which makes Ting-Lu's Spikes even more deadly. Fairy-types like Arceus-Fairy, Zacian-C, and Flutter Mane are useful for their Dragon immunity, which forces Miraidon to predict between its Dragon- and Electric-type coverage, potentially allowing Ting-Lu to switch in for free. Eternatus and Arceus-Grass are valuable teammates for their ability to take on Kyogre, with Eternatus notably absorbing Toxic Spikes, which severely threaten Ting-Lu. Giratina-O is a great partner that can check Arceus-Ground and Extreme Killer Arceus while providing Defog support, which massively increases Ting-Lu's longevity. Revenge killers like Choice Scarf Koraidon and Miraidon greatly appreciate chip damage from Ting-Lu's Ruination and Spikes for cleaning up weakened teams, and they may take on Miraidon should Ting-Lu not be healthy enough to do so.

Entry Hazard Setter.description:
With incredible bulk, Vessel of Ruin, and access to both Spikes and Stealth Rock, Ting-Lu is one of OU's premier hazard setters and also doubles as a special wall. Spikes are used to hit grounded Stealth Rock-resistant Pokemon like Kingambit and Gholdengo harder, while Stealth Rock can be used instead to damage Spikes-immune Pokemon like Enamorus and Corviknight that repeatedly switch into Ting-Lu, as well as punish Stealth Rock-weak Pokemon like Booster Energy Gouging Fire and Choice Specs Kyurem. Thanks to its huge bulk, Ting-Lu is able to take super effective hits from setup sweepers like Volcarona, Kyurem, and Iron Boulder and phaze them with Whirlwind in return; in addition to this, Whirlwind forces in opposing Pokemon, which will take damage from Ting-Lu's hazards unless they hold Heavy-Duty Boots. Ruination deals meaningful damage to switch-ins like Rillaboom, Great Tusk, and Hatterene, while Stone Edge can be run instead to allow Ting-Lu to OHKO Volcarona and hit Flying-types like Dragonite and Zapdos. Tera Poison is used to help Ting-Lu better check Fairy- and Fighting-types like Enamorus, Zamazenta, and especially Iron Valiant and grant it an immunity to Toxic, while Tera Ghost can be run instead to nullify Ting-Lu's Fighting-type weakness and allow it to spinblock Great Tusk and Iron Treads, though this comes at the cost of being weak to Ghost-types like Gholdengo and Choice Specs Dragapult as well as Dark-types like Darkrai, Kingambit, and Roaring Moon that Ting-Lu would otherwise check.

Ting-Lu fits well as a support option on nearly any balance team. Offensive partners like Dragapult, Gouging Fire, and Kyurem appreciate entry hazard support to make foes easier to KO, while physically defensive partners like Dondozo and Skarmory benefit from Ting-Lu's ability to handle special attackers like Gholdengo and Raging Bolt. Skarmory is particularly notable for forming a strong defensive hazard-stacking core with Ting-Lu, being able to switch into Pokemon like Meowscarada and Weavile that threaten it. Aside from being potent late-game cleaners that appreciate Ting-Lu spreading chip damage early-game, offensive partners like Weavile and Meowscarada pair well, since they're able to remove Heavy-Duty Boots from opposing Pokemon with Knock Off to make Ting-Lu's hazard stacking more effective as well as pressure Gliscor, which Ting-Lu struggles significantly against. Galarian Slowking and Gholdengo are both great defensive partners for Ting-Lu to handle Fairy-types like Hatterene and Iron Valiant, with the former able to provide additional pressure with Future Sight and the latter also able to block hazard removal.

Defensive Hazard Setter (Dark).description:
Ting-Lu is a fantastic asset for Dark teams due to its access to entry hazards and great bulk, supported further by Vessel of Ruin weakening special attackers such as Iron Valiant and Hatterene. Earthquake is a reliable STAB move that hits most of the metagame for decent damage while also scaring Clodsire out and preventing it from setting Toxic Spikes. Heavy Slam hits Fairy-types that would otherwise overpower Ting-Lu, such as Flutter Mane and Iron Valiant, while also threatening Hatterene trying to bounce back hazards. Stealth Rock and Spikes allow Ting-Lu to support wallbreakers such as Meowscarada or Greninja. Whirlwind allows Ting-Lu to phase out setup sweepers such as Dragonite and Curse Dondozo and rack up entry hazard damage, while Ruination provides consistent damage against other walls such as Amoonguss and Corviknight that don't mind any of Ting-Lu's other moves.

Wallbreakers such as Meowscarada, Chien-Pao, Kingambit, and Greninja all appreciate Ting-Lu's ability to set entry hazards, as they wear down common defensive answers such as Toxapex, Iron Treads, and Dondozo. In return, they can scare out threats to Ting-Lu; Meowscarada can deal with Greninja, Chien-Pao and Greninja can threaten Great Tusk, and Kingambit can force out Fairy-types such as Hatterene. Skuntank is a good partner as well, since it offers a crucial neutrality to Fairy, threatens Fairy-types, and sets and clears Toxic Spikes, augmenting Ting-Lu's entry hazards and improving its longevity. Additionally, Skuntank can utilize Fire Spin to further chip down teams and trap Klefki, improving Ting-Lu's matchup against Fairy. In return, Ting-Lu can assist in Ground matchups through its bulk. Sableye is also a great partner due to its Fighting immunity, taking attacks Ting-Lu can't such as Great Tusk's and Iron Hands's Close Combat.

Physically Defensive (Ground).description:
Ting-Lu's exceptional bulk and utility options make it an invaluable asset to Ground teams, walling threats like Dragapult, Espathra, and Hydreigon. Earthquake threatens Pokemon such as Gholdengo, Kingambit, and Volcarona. Alternatively, Throat Chop hits Espathra for more damage and shuts down Air Balloon Gholdengo. Ruination allows Ting-Lu to quickly wear down the likes of opposing Ting-Lu, Hatterene, and Dragonite, while Body Press may be used to deal more damage to Chien-Pao, Kingambit, and Hydreigon. Spikes or Stealth Rock in conjunction with Whirlwind sets Ting-Lu apart from other entry hazard setters; it's capable of wearing down the opponent's defensive core and weakens threats such as Greninja, Meowscarada, and Baxcalibur. Additionally, Whirlwind phazes threatening sweepers like Scizor and Ceruledge.

Ting-Lu's entry hazards are heavily appreciated by Great Tusk, which threatens out Choice Specs Flutter Mane, Gallade, and Greninja; Sandy Shocks, which deals with Water-types like Pelipper, Quaquaval, and Dondozo; and Garchomp, which threatens Corviknight, Rotom-C, and Breloom with its Fire-type coverage. Furthermore, Choice Scarf Great Tusk removes Heavy-Duty Boots from Sableye and Brambleghast via Knock Off to enhance Ting-Lu's phazing, which enables Clodsire and Gastrodon as entry hazard setters to wither down threats such as Greninja and Ceruledge more efficiently. Water Absorb Clodsire adds a Water immunity, can switch into attacks from Greninja, Quaquaval, and Meowscarada, and helps wear down the opposing team with Toxic Spikes or Toxic. Gastrodon walls Water-type Pokemon like Pelipper, Dondozo, and Rotom-W and assists with spreading entry hazards. Iron Treads eases Ting-Lu's pivoting by removing entry hazards with Rapid Spin and checks Fairy-types like Flutter Mane and Hatterene. Quagsire stalls out physical setup sweepers such as Mimikyu, Chien-Pao, and Iron Hands and also helps wear down defensive cores using Toxic.

Specially Defensive.description: Ting-Lu is a sturdy specially defensive wall thanks to its high bulk further augmented by Vessel of Ruin. Because of this, Ting-Lu is more than capable of handling common special attackers such as Heatran, Moltres, and Volcarona. Its Dark typing is also useful to check Stored Power setup sweepers such as Cresselia as well as absorb Future Sight from Tapu Lele and Galarian Slowking. Ting-Lu also functions as an exceptional entry hazard setter, as it can easily set up Stealth Rock and Spikes against threats such as Tapu Koko, Zapdos, and Heatran. Ting-Lu is capable of checking even more threats with Tera Poison, such as Iron Valiant, Mega Lopunny, Sneasler, and Zamazenta, while also gaining an immunity to poison. Tera Ghost is a good alternative that allows Ting-Lu to block Rapid Spin from Great Tusk while keeping a good matchup into Sneasler and Zamazenta. Ruination helps force progress against potential switch-ins to Ting-Lu such as Landorus-T, Ferrothorn, Mega Charizard Y, and Rotom-W. Alternatively, Spikes can be run in conjunction with Stealth Rock on more offensive structures in order to provide additional entry hazard support, but this makes Ting-Lu a lot more passive against threats such as Tornadus-T, Landorus-T, Gliscor, and Mega Charizard Y. Ting-Lu can also run Stone Edge in order to better check Mega Charizard Y, Volcarona, and Moltres. Finally, Whirlwind is a vital move in order to deter setup sweepers such as Tera Grass Volcarona, and Nasty Plot Tornadus-T. Ting-Lu is great at supporting partners such as Iron Valiant and Zamazenta by dealing with their checks such as Cresselia and Galarian Slowking while providing entry hazard support. In return, they can help deal with threats such as Ferrothorn, Great Tusk, and Baxcalibur. On more defensive teams, partners such as Skarmory and Toxapex appreciate Ting-Lu's ability to take on threats such as Fire-types such as Volcarona and Heatran and Electric-types such as Tapu Koko and Zapdos for them. In return, they can help Ting-Lu deal with dangerous physical attackers such as Mega Lopunny and Sneasler. Ting-Lu hates having to deal with Flying-types such as Tornadus-T and Gliscor, so partners such as Baxcalibur and Rotom-W are apprecated to help deal with them. Grass-types such as Ogerpon-W, Kartana, and Ferrothorn also annoy Ting-Lu, so teammates such as Zapdos, Tornadus-T, and Dragonite are good partners to check them for it. Water-types such as Rotom-W and Mega Swampert also give Ting-Lu trouble, so Grass-type partners such as Ferrothorn, Ogerpon-W, and Rillaboom are good at shoring up that weakness.

battlestadiumsingles.overview:
Welcome to Battle Stadium Singles Regulation F! This Pokemon has been updated to reflect the new Pokemon that The Indigo Disk has brought!

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

Stealth Rock Support.description:
• Ting-Lu's absurd bulk and excellent support movepool make it the premier Stealth Rock setter in the metagame!

  • Ruination: Ruination gives Ting-Lu the most consistent option for damage output, without resorting to offensive investment.

  • Taunt: While Ting-Lu's Speed is awful compared to most Taunt users, using Taunt against foes like Urshifu formes on the switch is still useful, plus Ting-Lu can use some specialized Speed EVs to outspeed certain paralyzed threats. Note that while using Taunt against Toxapex can be useful, it is highly likely to run Mental Herb, which risks getting Ting-Lu poisoned.

  • Protect: Protect with Leftovers is a strong choice when running Ting-Lu with high sustain teammates such as Toxapex, and can keep Ting-Lu's health up when its in risky situations like trapped by Dragonite's Fire Spin.

  • Heavy Slam: Heavy Slam deals serious damage to Fairy-types, with Flutter Mane in particular needing a huge amount of defensive investment to avoid being OHKOed by it.

Other Options

  • Fissure: Fissure lets Ting-Lu potentially punish passive Pokemon without Substitute, such as Toxapex.

  • Spikes: Getting Stealth Rock and Spikes together makes Whirlwind a very effective damage dealing tool, in addition to supporting other offensive Pokemon. However, it can be difficult to set up without compromising Ting-Lu's damage output.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Even with Ting-Lu's fantastic bulk, Terastallization greatly increases the amount of Pokemon it can beat one-on-one, such as Flutter Mane and Iron Bundle.

  • Poison: Tera Poison gives Ting-Lu an important resistance to Fairy and Fighting, and it lets it absorb Toxic Spikes.

  • Fairy: In addition to a useful Fighting resistance, Tera Fairy helps Ting-Lu against powerful Dragon-types like Choice Band Dragonite and Choice Band Gouging Fire.

  • Water: With Tera Water, Ting-Lu has a significantly better matchup against Urshifu-R. The Chien-Pao and Chi-Yu matchups can also benefit, but be mindful of potential Tera Blast coverage.

  • Steel: Tera Steel retaining a Fighting weakness is unfortunate, but in exchange, Heavy Slam will OHKO even most bulky Flutter Mane, and it gives Ting-Lu a good matchup against Iron Bundle.

Items

  • Sitrus Berry versus Leftovers: Ting-Lu's lack of reliable recovery usually makes Sitrus Berry the most reliable method of surviving an extra attack. Leftovers is a good alternative if Sitrus Berry is needed somewhere else, and even preferable if running Protect.

  • Mental Herb: Mental Herb can be used to nullify one use of Taunt or Encore, which Ting-Lu is fairly vulnerable to, at the cost of reducing its lifespan with a lack of any recovery.

EV Spread Information

  • Physical Defense versus Special Defense: Specializing in one defensive stat depends on which threats Ting-Lu needs to handle, with physically defensive variants preforming better against threats like Dragonite and Roaring Moon, and when Terastallized, Chien-Pao, Ogerpon-H, and Urshifu-R. For specially defensive variants, major targets include Gholdengo and Latios, and when Terastallized, Flutter Mane, Iron Bundle, and Chi-Yu.

  • HP Stat Adjustments with Sitrus Berry: When using a Sitrus Berry, running an even HP number is the best option, so Ting-Lu will eat its berry right after being hit by Ruination.

  • 252 HP / 156 Def / 100 SpD with Impish: When Terastallized to a neutral typing and holding a Sitrus Berry, Ting-Lu survives up to four Icicle Crashes from Jolly Focus Sash Chien-Pao. It also avoids a 2HKO from Timid Flutter Mane's Moonblast even without Terastallizing thanks to Sitrus Berry.

  • 140 HP / 116 Def / 252 SpD with Careful: This Specially Defensive spread withstands even Modest Choice Specs Chi-Yu's Overheat!

Speed Benchmarks With Taunt

  • Investing in Speed may seem absurd, but with paralysis support, Ting-Lu can realistically outspeed some major threats!

  • 60 Speed EVs: This outspeeds up to paralyzed Jolly Dragonite, which can save Ting-Lu from Encore.

  • 76 Speed EVs: This outspeeds up to paralyzed Adamant Urshifu-R, and many variants of Ursaluna-B.

  • 92 Speed EVs: This outspeeds up to paralyzed Modest Chi-Yu.

Assault Vest.description:
• Assault Vest and Vessel of Ruin combine to make Ting-Lu an especially formidable tank.

  • Heavy Slam: Heavy Slam deals far more damage to Flutter Mane and Mimikyu than any other attack, with even Bold Flutter Mane having a good shot at being OHKOed after Stealth Rock damage.

  • Fissure: Fissure is Ting-Lu's best shot at KOing bulky foes like Stamina Archaludon and Ursaluna-B.

  • Payback versus Throat Chop: Payback will usually deal more damage thanks to how slow Ting-Lu is, but Throat Chop will punish Pokemon that switch in more.

  • EV Spread: The given EV spread maximizes Ting-Lu's Attack and special bulk.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: While Ting-Lu doesn't need Terastallization to function, it makes it far more effective at beating a wide variety of Pokemon one-on-one.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy not only helps Ting-Lu against powerful Dragon- and Fighting-type attacks, but it also gives Ting-Lu a good Tera Blast to hit Dragonite and Roaring Moon with.

  • Poison: Tera Poison gives Ting-Lu a vital Fairy resistance against Flutter Mane and Mimikyu, and it lets it absorb the dreaded Toxic and Toxic Spikes. It still makes a reasonable Tera Blast option for hitting Primarina and Serperior hard as well.

  • Water: Tera Water is a fantastic defensive typing, letting Ting-Lu avoid a 2HKO from Tera Fire Choice Specs Chi-Yu's Overheat.

  • Steel: Tera Steel gives Ting-Lu a powerful STAB Heavy Slam, giving it a great matchup against Flutter Mane and Iron Bundle. It does become an issue against common Fire-types like Ogerpon-H and Gouging Fire though.

Defensive Support.description: Ting-Lu is an effective defensive support in STABmons, as with Ceaseless Edge or Spikes, it can serve as a very bulky entry hazard setter. In addition, thanks to its ability, its well-distributed stats, and Shore Up, it is able to check many attackers such as Iron Moth, Ceruledge, and Garganacl. Spikes should be used if reliability and lack of PP are a concern, especially on stall teams. Precipice Blades maximizes damage against Toxapex and other Ground-weak Pokemon like Iron Hands; however, Earthquake is a fine option if accuracy is a concern. There are multiple options for the last moveslot: Parting Shot lets Ting-Lu safely bring in offensive teammates via a slow pivot, Foul Play gives it a better matchup against setup sweepers like Salamence, Whirlwind phazes setup sweepers that Ting-Lu can't handle like non-Taunt Annihilape, and Knock Off can remove items like Heavy-Duty Boots from pivots like Tyranitar. Covert Cloak prevents Ting-Lu from being poisoned from Mortal Spin users like Toxapex, while Leftovers gives to it more passive recovery. Both Tera Ghost and Tera Poison allow Ting-Lu to surprise Fighting-types like Iron Hands; Tera Poison grants it an immunity to Toxic and lets it resist Grass-type attacks, while Tera Ghost allows it to spinblock. Alternatively, Tera Fairy and Tera Water provide great resistances to Roaring Moon and Palafin, respectively. Ting-Lu fits in a variety of teams, ranging from bulky offense to stall. Offensive teammates such as Iron Valiant, Palafin, and Iron Hands appreciate that Ting-Lu can both set Spikes and act as a slow pivot with Parting Shot. These three Pokemon also beat Great Tusk, one of Ting-Lu's biggest checks, as it is able to beat it with Fighting-type moves and remove its entry hazards with Rapid Spin. Defensive Pokemon like Toxapex, Amoonguss, and Dondozo are able to check Pokemon that Ting-Lu can't, which include Azumarill, Rotom-W, and Mimikyu. Ting-Lu struggles to make progress with entry hazards up, so entry hazard removal from the likes of Great Tusk, Toxapex, Rotom-W, and Corviknight is recommended.

Specially Defensive.description: Ting-Lu's absurd mixed bulk and unusual typing make it a formidable mixed wall, capable of checking several key threats such as Kingambit, Ceruledge, and Iron Moth. Ting-Lu's best entry hazard depends on its team, as it can form a strong hazard-stacking core with Stealth Rock and/or Spikes setters like Garganacl and Glimmora. Ruination spreads consistent damage, especially against Ground-immune foes like Earth Eater Kingambit, and forces defensive Pokemon like Corviknight, Hippowdon, and Blissey to waste their recovery PP. Whirlwind forces entry hazard damage onto foes and ensures Ting-Lu isn't setup fodder for threats like Talonflame and Quaquaval. The Speed IVs let it underspeed Corviknight to punish its Roost with Earthquake. Foes like Scream Tail and Lucario can endanger Ting-Lu by targeting its weaknesses, so Corviknight is a good teammate that also provides Defog.

RegenVest Wall.description: Ting-Lu's excellent defensive stats and useful typing let it check a plethora of special attackers such as Hydreigon and Iron Moth. Throat Chop provides STAB damage and lets it beat Boomburst users, Ruination + Sand Tomb traps and eliminates opposing Ting-Lu and Skeledirge, while also draining recovery PP from Hippowdon and Blissey. Some special attackers like Scream Tail can prove dangerous, so pairing Ting-Lu with Corviknight and Desolate Land Iron Moth are good options. Ting-Lu can switch into weaker physical attackers like Roaring Moon, but it should be used as help for the main physical wall on the team. Ting-Lu is vulnerable to opposing setup sweepers, so teammates like Unaware Corviknight are greatly appreciated. Corviknight can also reduce Ting-Lu's weakness to entry hazards.

RegenVest.description: RegenVest Ting-Lu is a reliable special wall and a premier momentum generator. Regenerator gives Ting-Lu reliable recovery without conflicting with Assault Vest. Nuzzle discourages dangerous attackers like Palkia-O from switching in. U-turn allows Ting-Lu to safely bring in teammates thanks to its low Speed. Stone Axe forces chip damage on foes, letting offensive teammates wallbreak more easily. Knock Off removes items like Heavy-Duty Boots and Covert Cloak, making Ting-Lu's own utility more effective; it also punishes Imposter users attempting to gain Regenerator. Ting-Lu fits best on balance teams, which appreciate its ability to spread paralysis and safely bring in teammates thanks to its huge bulk. Dangerous wallbreakers like Koraidon and Palkia-O help maximize the effectiveness of U-turn pivoting. Ting-Lu is unable to naturally check Palkia-O and Fairy-types like Flutter Mane, so a teammate that helps shore up this weakness, such as Arceus-Grass or Hisuian Goodra, is appreciated. Tera Fairy provides an immunity to Dragon, allowing Ting-Lu to block Dragon Energy from Palkia-O and Glaive Rush from Koraidon; alternatively, Tera Grass provides a Water resistance, covering for Palkia-O's Water Spout.

Mixed Wall (Dark).description:
Not 2HKO'ed by Choice Scarf Tapu Lele and OHKO'es it back with Heavy Slam.

This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Physically Defensive (Ground).description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Hazard Support.description: Ting-Lu, or more accurately the Spikes that it effortlessly stacks, defines the AG metagame like little else due to the scarcity of relevant Defog and Rapid Spin users or airborne Pokemon. An incredible defensive profile allows Ting-Lu to be a consistent, valuable check to Calyrex-S, Miraidon, and Calm Mind Arceus-Ground. Taunt prevents Arceus formes from setting up or healing and shuts down Toxapex. Ruination reduces Ting-Lu's passivity and hits Giratina-O and Landorus-T. Earthquake hits Miraidon and prevents Zacian-C from safely switching in, while Payback OHKOes Calyrex-S and—with Ting-Lu's low Speed—consistently has 100 Base Power. Whirlwind can be used over Taunt or Ruination on teams that are more vulnerable to setup sweepers like Calm Mind Arceus-Ground. Fissure is a niche alternative over Ruination that helps with Taunt Arceus formes and is more of a threat to setup Pokemon. Tera Grass, Poison, and Steel all allow it to resist Calyrex-S's Grass Knot and offer varying defensive utility, with Tera Grass helping with Kyogre and Arceus-Ground, Tera Poison helping with Koraidon and Toxic Spikes, and Tera Steel helping with Arceus and Miraidon. Ting-Lu's defensive utility and the pressure brought by its entry hazards are appreciated by nearly every team bar hyper offense. Ting-Lu is vulnerable to strong physical attackers like Zacian-C and Koraidon, so teammates that can check them, like Landorus-T on bulky offense teams and Toxapex and Skeledirge on balance teams, make for natural partners. Extreme Killer Arceus is a great partner that helps check Calyrex-S and appreciates Ting-Lu's Spikes bringing opposing Pokemon into Extreme Speed range. Zacian-C is another attacker that loves Spikes weakening its targets and checks Arceus-Fairy in return.

vgc2024.overview:
• Chi-Yu is the strongest offensive Pokemon in the format, thanks to a high Special Attack stat and Beads of Ruin. Chi-Yu threatens to OHKO the majority of the format, including Amoonguss, Rillaboom, Kingambit, and Gholdengo, with it also walling the latter two. Chi-Yu also outspeeds them with minimal investment, making it a great counter to the common Grass- and Steel-types.

  • While Chi-Yu has fantastic damage, it also has a lackluster Speed tier, which makes Tornadus, Whimsicott, and Speed Booster Energy Flutter Mane great partners; the former two being consistent sun setters, and all of them can pressure Fighting-types such as Urshifu-R that Chi-Yu may be afraid of. Chi-Yu also pairs well with the majority of special attackers, helping them with Beads of Ruin.

  • Incineroar and Urshifu-R resist Chi-Yu's STABs and threaten to either mitigate its damage output or OHKO it. Bulky Assault Vest Pokemon that hit it super effectively like Entei and Iron Hands are also great options against it.

Choice Specs.description:
• Snarl is used as general utility and as a way to counter Psychic Terrain threats like Hatterene and Iron Crown. Chi-Yu can opt for Tera Blast instead to OHKO frailer Urshifu-R and Flutter Mane without committing to Overheat.

  • The defensive investment allows for Chi-Yu to survive a Tera Fairy Special Attack Booster Energy Moonblast from Flutter Mane, and, when Terastallized, Urshifu-R's Mystic Water Surging Strikes. The Speed EVs allow Chi-Yu to outspeed Adamant Urshifu-R, and the remaining EVs are put into Special Attack to maximize offensive pressure.

  • Chi-Yu uses Tera Ghost to negate its Fighting weakness and become immune to priority like Fake Out and Extreme Speed, which is crucial, as it can't Protect.

Glass Cannon.description:
• Chi-Yu uses Overheat over Snarl for OHKOs on Landorus and Tera Grass Entei.

  • Focus Sash can make up for Chi-Yu's poor bulk and mediocre defensive typing.

  • Chi-Yu uses Tera Ghost to avoid Fighting-type moves and priority moves like Fake Out and Extreme Speed, preserving its Focus Sash and allowing for aggressive plays.

Choice Scarf.description: Choice Scarf Chi-Yu is one of the strongest revenge killers in Ubers UU thanks to its monstrous Special Attack and typing that lets it check threats like Zamazenta-C and Kingambit. Overheat is used alongside a Modest nature to OHKO Zacian after Stealth Rock damage; it is also useful to OHKO Magearna after it uses Calm Mind, a benchmark that Flamethrower misses on. Tera Blast coupled with Tera Fairy lets Chi-Yu OHKO Palkia-O and 2HKO Arceus-Dark, while Fire Blast is weaker than Overheat but does not lower Chi-Yu's Special Attack, potentially allowing it to sweep weakened teams. In adition to making Tera Blast useful, Tera Fairy provides a useful resistance to Dragon- and Fighting-type attacks from the likes of Palkia-O and Great Tusk and lets Chi-Yu switch in more times by removing its Rock weakness. Tera Fire bolsters Chi-Yu's Fire-type attacks to nuclear levels, allowing it to 2HKO Pokemon like Arceus-Dark after entry hazard damage. Good partners for Chi-Yu include entry hazard setters like Magearna and Great Tusk, which help it get some KOs more easily, such as against Arceus-Dark and Terastalized Solgaleo. Magearna, Landorus-T, and Solgaleo can safely get Chi-Yu in the field with their slow pivoting moves. Chi-Yu appreciates entry hazard removal from Great Tusk and Corviknight so it can be an effective revenge killer. Chi-Yu may struggle to revenge kill bulky foes like Blissey, Arceus-Dark, and Terastalized Solgaleo, so teammates that can deal with them like Great Tusk, Zacian, and Zamazenta-C are appreciated. Torkoal is a decent partner for Chi-Yu, as it bolsters its Fire-type attacks to atomic levels, making it capable of OHKOing and 2HKOing the majority of the tier. Lastly, Chi-Yu struggles against priority moves like Jet Punch and Extreme Speed, so teammates that can switch into these attacks, like Skarmory, Corviknight, Dialga, and Giratina, are appreciated.

Choice Specs.description: Choice Specs Chi-Yu is one of the strongest wallbreakers in Ubers UU, being able to destroy almost everything in its path with its superb Special Attack stat and typing that lets it check Pokemon like Mewtwo and Kingambit; however, its middling Speed stat doesn't let it wallbreaker as consistently. Overheat OHKOes and 2HKOes the majority of the metagame, including Fire-resistant foes and bulky walls like Blissey; however, it comes at the cost of making Chi-Yu prone to getting revenge killed. Fire Blast is a weaker but more consistent option than Overheat, as it does not drop Chi-Yu's Special Attack while still incinerating everything. Tera Fire bolsters Chi-Yu's Fire-type attacks to ungodly levels, allowing it to OHKO even walls like Blissey after very minimal chip damage. Tera Blast Fairy is an option if Chi-Yu instead wants to OHKO Palkia-O and Arceus-Dark. Good teammates for Chi-Yu include fast wallbreakers like Zacian, Palkia-O, and Deoxys that can help make up for its middling Speed. Pokemon that can deal with Arceus formes like the aforementioned Palkia-O and Zacian are good teammates as well. Entry hazard removal from the likes of Great Tusk and Mandibuzz is also appreciated for Chi-Yu to wallbreak effectively. Lastly, Chi-Yu often gets significantly chipped or outright OHKOed if it doesnt OHKO the opposing threat. Therefore, pivots like Landorus-T, Great Tusk, and Solgaleo, that can get Chi-Yu in against targets in its KO range, are good teammates.

battlestadiumsingles.overview:
Welcome to Battle Stadium Singles Regulation F! This Pokemon has been updated to reflect the new Pokemon that The Indigo Disk has brought!

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

Choice-Yu.description:
• With a Choice item, Chi-Yu can choose to become either a spicy revenge killer or a scorching wallbreaker!

  • Flamethrower versus Lava Plume: Flamethrower's higher power makes it the better cleaning tool, but Lava Plume's higher burn chance gives Chi-Yu a good shot of punishing major physical attacking fores such as Dragonite, Azumarill, and Garchomp that resist Fire.

  • Psychic: This is Chi-Yu's most powerful attack against Urshifu-R and Toxapex and can pick off weakened Annihilape without Overheat's Special Attack drop.

  • Tera Blast: Even before Terastallizing, Tera Blast is a decent coverage move that hits Primarina and Roaring Moon.

  • Modest versus Timid: Modest is generally preferred since Chi-Yu's Speed isn't too impressive, but Timid does ensure that Chi-Yu outspeeds Urshifu formes, Annihilape, and Mimikyu, who are fully capable of revenge killing Chi-Yu that lack Choice Scarf.

Other Options

  • Fire Blast: Fire Blast's shaky accuracy can be an issue, but it's a far better sweeping tool than Overheat.

  • Memento: Support isn't Chi-Yu's forte, but Memento lets Choice Scarf sets potentially set-up a sweeper in exchange for KOing itself.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Chi-Yu's damage output is red hot even without Terastallization, making it a fairly flexible Pokemon.

  • Fire: Tera Fire Overheat is extremely difficult to wall without a resistance, making it an easy choice for Chi-Yu. It also lets Tera Blast become a powerful STAB move while Chi-Yu is locked into using it, letting it get around the normal limitations of using a Choice item.

  • Grass: Tera Grass is a good response to Urshifu-R and Primarina, and lets Chi-Yu avoid being OHKOed by Iron Bundle's Hydro Pump.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy is Chi-Yu's best shot of defeating Roaring Moon and and gives it an important Fighting-type resistance.

  • Ghost: Tera Ghost lets Chi-Yu surprise common users of Normal-type priority such as Dragonite, Ogerpon-H, and Entei, with the bonus of blocking Breloom from an easy revenge kill.

  • Dark: While Tera Dark is nowhere near as impressive as a boosted Overheat, Dark Pulse has excellent coverage and also removes Chi-Yu's troublesome Stealth Rock weakness.

  • Water: Getting a Water-type resistance is always useful against Urshifu-R, but the real key for Tera Water is that it helps Chi-Yu in the mirror match-up, especially against Assault Vest Chi-Yu.

Items

  • Choice Scarf: Choice Scarf patches up Chi-Yu's lukewarm Speed into something usable for revenge killing and also makes bulkier builds easier to use.

  • Choice Specs: Choice Specs trades revenge killing for terrifying wallbreaking power. With Tera Fire, the heat gets so extreme that even Blissey is 2HKOed by Overheat!

Bulkier EV Spread

  • 228 HP / 12 Def / 124 SpA / 4 SpD / 140 Spe with Modest: This is a bulky spread meant for Choice Scarf, outspeeding up to Iron Bundle. The bulk investment survives Breloom's Mach Punch, Mimikyu's Play Rough followed by Shadow Sneak, and has a good shot of surviving Tera Normal Choice Band Dragonite's Extreme Speed. 40 EVs can be moved from Special Attack to Speed to outspeed Dragapult at a serious cost to power.

Offensive.description:
• Chi-Yu's sizzling offensive power lets it get away with a wide variety of options that wouldn't fit on a Choice item set.

  • Flamethrower versus Lava Plume: Flamethrower's greater power makes it the better option in most instances, but Lava Plume's higher burn rate is good at punishing switch-ins like Roaring Moon and Dragonite.

  • Flame Charge: Chi-Yu is powerful enough that even without an offensive item, getting a Speed boost makes cleaning teams late-game very achievable.

  • Psychic: Psychic is Chi-Yu's best option against Urshifu-R and Toxapex. Note that Overheat will out-damage targets like Annihilape though.

Other Options

  • Will-O-Wisp: If not using Assault Vest, Will-O-Wisp severely punishes bulky physical threats like Roaring Moon and Dragonite that may switch in and works great with Terastallization to surprise other bulky threats such Ting-Lu.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Chi-Yu has a ton of weaknesses to common attacking types, so while Terastallization isn't needed to function, it can especially help bulkier Chi-Yu check more threats and otherwise focus less on hit-and-run attacking.

  • Fire: Beyond giving Overheat soul-melting damage output, Tera Fire gives Chi-Yu a vital Fairy-type resistance against Flutter Mane and a good shot of OHKOing even bulky Flutter Mane with Overheat.

  • Grass: Tera Grass is a huge help against Urshifu-R and Primarina, and can save Chi-Yu from Choice Scarf Landorus-T revenge kills as long as it doesn't use Flying Tera Blast.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy has good synergy with Chi-Yu's former typing, giving it a vital Fighting-type resistance and ensuring Chi-Yu is not walled by Roaring Moon.

  • Ghost: Tera Ghost is Chi-Yu's best hope against Dragonite and Entei's Extreme Speed, as well as blocking snipes from Ogerpon-H's Quick Attack.

  • Water: Tera Water works great on Assault Vest Chi-Yu with Tera Blast, ironically turning it into a decent check against other Chi-Yu! It also eases the matchup against Urshifu-R.

Items

  • Assault Vest: Chi-Yu has shockingly decent Special Defense, so Assault Vest lets it preform much better against Flutter Mane and opposing Chi-Yu.

  • Life Orb: Life Orb lets you get away with playing this set far more offensively at the cost of being even weaker to priority attacks than usual.

  • Focus Sash: If using a more offensive spread, Focus Sash can be worth it to flip the tables on fast offensive foes such as Iron Bundle.

  • Eject Pack: This turns Overheat into a one-use pivot move, surprising foes with a momentum shift in your favor.

EVs

  • 228 HP / 12 Def / 124 SpA / 4 SpD / 140 Spe with Modest: This bulky spread is perfect for Assault Vest and Flame Charge, letting Chi-Yu outspeed Iron Bundle after a boost and avoid an OHKO from Breloom's Mach Punch. It also avoids a KO from Mimikyu's Shadow Sneak following Play Rough and often survives Tera Normal Dragonite's Choice Band Extreme Speed. If outspeeding the rare Dragapult after Flame Charge is a priority, 40 Special Attack EVs can be moved to Speed.

  • 4 HP / 252 SpA / 252 Spe with Modest or Timid: When using more offensive items like Life Orb or Focus Sash, going a more offensive route makes Chi-Yu a better late-game sweeper. Modest is preferred for the damage output, but Timid outspeeds Urshifu formes and Annihilape.

Nasty Plot.description:
• While not easy to sweep with due to it's Speed, Chi-Yu becomes a a hot wallbreaker after setting up Nasty Plot!

  • Overheat: Overheat's Special Attack drop may conflict with Nasty Plot, but it'll deep-fry almost any Pokemon slower than Chi-Yu, making it a worthy wallbreaking tool.

  • Psychic: Psychic shatters Urshifu-R, a common revenge killer against Chi-Yu.

  • Substitute: Substitute does a great job of punishing common status users such as Archaludon. If Terastallized, Chi-Yu has a good chance of retaining its Substitute against Salt Cure as well.

  • Timid versus Modest: While this Chi-Yu is more focused on extreme wall-frying than sweeping, Timid is nice for outspeeding Urshifu formes and Annihilape, whom certainly can't handle boosted attacks well.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Chi-Yu's poor defensive typing can make it fairly easy to revenge kill, so having Terastallization free gives Chi-Yu much more KO opportunities beyond cooking slower threats.

  • Fire: Tera Fire makes Overheat an insane wall-breaking move, with Life Orb threatening to OHKO Blissey after a boost!

  • Ghost: Tera Ghost covers Chi-Yu's Fighting-type weakness and helps against Extreme Speed and Quick Attack, making it much harder to stop its sweep.

  • Grass: With Tera Grass, Chi-Yu can threaten to OHKO Primarina after a boost in addition to resisting Urshifu-R's Aqua Jet.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy gives Chi-Yu a helpful Fighting-type resistance and a better match-up against powerful Dragon-types like Dragonite and Roaring Moon.

  • Dark: With Nasty Plot and Life Orb, Tera Dark Chi-Yu is capable of OHKOing even the most specially defensive Annihilape with Dark Pulse!

  • Water: Tera Water lets Chi-Yu deal with opposing Chi-Yu more comfortably.

Items

  • Focus Sash: Focus Sash makes setting up Nasty Plot much easier, at the cost of power.

  • Life Orb: While it makes Chi-Yu even more vulnerable to priority moves, Life Orb is otherwise an excellent wallbreaking item, notably giving Chi-Yu a better matchup against stall teams.

Alternate EV Spreads

  • 24 HP / 12 Def / 220 SpA / 252 Spe with Timid or Modest: If using Substitute, this spread prevents Garganacl with 4 Attack EVs from breaking a Terastallized Chi-Yu's Substitute with Salt Cure. Note that Body Press and Earthquake will still break the Substitute unless using the correct Tera Type.

Choice Item Attacker.description: Chi-Yu's strong base stats and excellent STAB coverage make it a flexible offensive threat. Choice Specs provides maximum wallbreaking power, notably allowing it to OHKO physically defensive Ting-Lu with Desolate Land + Overheat, whereas Choice Scarf gives it the Speed to clean late-game and chase out faster threats like Cinderace and Chien-Pao. Desolate Land provides the most damage amplification and comes with an immunity to Water, whereas No Guard enables Chi-Yu to liberally spread burns with Inferno. Psychic is useful coverage to hit Clodsire and Iron Moth super effectively; alternatively, Will-O-Wisp allows Desolate Land sets to reliably spread burn, however Chi-Yu's poor bulk means it can be dangerous to use. Chi-Yu's best fit is on balance and offense teams that appreciate its high damage output, as well as its good matchups against common special walls like RegenVest Iron Treads. Bulky pivots, like the aforementioned Corviknight and Iron Treads, make particularly good Chi-Yu partners because both can clear entry hazards, particularly Stealth Rock.

Nasty Plot.description: Thanks to its high Special Attack and decent Speed, Chi-Yu is a potent wallbreaker that makes use of Nasty Plot and its unresisted STAB combination to tear through common walls like Sand Stream Garganacl and non-Unaware Florges. Chi-Yu generally prefers to run Heavy-Duty Boots to avoid entry hazard damage, but Life Orb can be run on Sheer Force sets for extra power. Chi-Yu also has several Fire-type STAB moves to choose from: Fire Blast is the most powerful, Flamethrower is the most consistent option, and Inferno is used on No Guard sets to punish switch-ins like Garganacl and Ting-Lu with a burn. Chi-Yu does struggle against special walls like Clodsire and Blissey, so physically offensive Pokemon like Meowscarada and Kingambit make good teammates. Chi-Yu is also physically frail, so it appreciates teammates like Corviknight and Avalugg that can switch into strong physical attacks and Wish passers like Florges and Scream Tail that can help it stay healthy.

Feesh (Offensive Wallbreaker).description:
• Overheat hits extremely hard and can 2HKO even the bulkiest of Pokemon. Fire Blast and Flamethrower can be used to KO foes without Chi-Yu suffering a Special Attack drop, with Flamethrower having perfect accuracy.
  • The only reason to run Timid over Modest is to outspeed Jolly Great Tusk, Jolly Annihilape, and fast Iron Treads with Special Defense investment.
  • Tera Fire allows Chi-Yu to turn 2HKOs to OHKOs, for example OHKOing opposing Chi-Yu with Overheat. Tera Fire also lets it 2HKO any prominent special wall, including Toxapex, Blissey, and Ting-Lu, OHKOing them with sun.
