Its STAB Moonblast is one of its best qualities, being able to easily beat Mega Sableye and OHKO most opposing Fighting- and Dragon-types such as Buzzwole and Mega Altaria. Thunderbolt is great coverage to hit Flying- and Water-types like Tornadus-T and Toxapex that otherwise wall Iron Valiant, while Energy Ball lets it deal with Mega Swampert, which it can outspeed even under rain, Rotom-W, and Gastrodon more easily. Shadow Ball prevents Iron Valiant from being walled by Gholdengo, Skeledirge, and Aegislash while also improving the Psychic matchup. Knock Off and Trick cripple defensive switch-ins such as Toxapex, Celesteela, and Clodsire by removing or replacing important items and forcing them to go without passive recovery or be Choice locked. Iron Valiant is also a great asset in the Fairy and Electric matchups, as it uses opposing Tapu Koko's Electric Surge to activate its own Quark Drive and outspeed even Regieleki and Alolan Raichu under Electric Terrain. Iron Valiant appreciates support from Mega Gallade, as it easily takes care of Poison-types like Clodsire, Mega Venusaur, and Alolan Muk. Iron Hands and Great Tusk are great teammates for the Electric matchup while also beating the likes of Toxapex, Galarian Moltres, and Gholdengo. Cobalion and Great Tusk can set up Stealth Rock and even clear entry hazards in the case of the latter. Cobalion also helps against Fairy-types such as Tapu Bulu and Tapu Lele, while Great Tusk helps deal with Tapu Koko and Assault Vest Iron Hands. Choice Band Urshifu-R is a great ally to beat Fire-types such as Volcarona and Skeledirge and Ground-types such as Landorus-T and Excadrill. Kommo-o deals with bulky Water-, Fire-, and Grass-types like Toxapex, Skeledirge, and Mega Venusaur with its massive Clangorus Soulblaze in conjunction with Taunt. Breloom is also a natural counter to Water-types, being able to deal with Swampert, and hindering defensive walls such as Toxapex with Spore. Galarian Zapdos is another great teammate that can weaken foes and safely get in Iron Valiant with U-turn.

Bolt-Beam Swords Dance (Fairy).description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Scale Shot.description:
With its incredible power, speed, ease of setup, and lack of reliable checks, Scale Shot Koraidon is the most influential and dangerous sweeper in the entire metagame. In conjunction with Loaded Dice, Scale Shot is a powerful attack that allows Koraidon to threaten the many Dragon-types in Ubers, such as Koraidon, Miraidon, Eternatus, and Giratina-O. It is a bit luck-dependent, however, as it sometimes needs to hit a certain number of times to achieve certain KOs. For example, after a Swords Dance boost, Scale Shot must hit five times to OHKO defensive Ho-Oh. In addition to the staples of Scale Shot, Flare Blitz, and Swords Dance, this set has a lot of versatility when it comes to its last move and Tera type. Low Kick dispatches Extreme Killer Arceus trying to revenge kill it with Extreme Speed, as Koraidon is bulky enough to survive Extreme Speed after a Scale Shot. Opposing Koraidon, Miraidon, Zacian-C, Kyogre, and Necrozma-DM also fall to Low Kick after a Swords Dance, meaning Koraidon does not have to risk missing Scale Shot or taking recoil damage from Flare Blitz, especially against Zacian-C, which commonly tries to switch into Koraidon to absorb Scale Shot. Substitute scouts for any potential Terastallizations attempting to slow Koraidon down, most notably Tera Fairy on several Pokemon like Miraidon and defensive Arceus formes such as Arceus-Ground and Arceus-Water. In conjunction with Tera Ghost, Substitute is also useful for turning Pokemon like Arceus-Water, Gliscor lacking Earthquake, and Skeledirge into setup fodder. Tera Ghost gives Koraidon an immunity to Low Kick from opposing Koraidon and, more importantly, Extreme Speed from Extreme Killer Arceus, letting it use these Pokemon as setup fodder, especially if running Substitute. Tera Fire, on the other hand, gives Koraidon a Fairy resistance, immunity to Will-O-Wisp and Sacred Fire burns from Ho-Oh, and STAB on Flare Blitz, letting it turn the tables on Zacian-C and Arceus-Fairy, which are good checks to unboosted Koraidon.

Scale Shot Koraidon is best used on hyper offense teams that can easily overwhelm its checks, but it can also be used as a ferocious sweeper on bulky teams. It loves pairing with Miraidon, as Miraidon can pivot to Koraidon for it to set up on Miraidon's common checks in Ting-Lu and Clodsire. Double Dance Miraidon also pairs extremely well with Scale Shot Koraidon on hyper offense. Zacian-C is also a superb Koraidon partner, as the two can overwhelm their shared checks, such as Ho-Oh, Landorus-T, and defensive Arceus formes like Arceus-Ground and Arceus-Water. Dragon Dance Necrozma-DM can switch into Arceus-Fairy and lure and heavily damage Skeledirge with a boosted Photon Geyser, making it a solid partner. Entry hazard support in the form of leads like Deoxys-S and Glimmora and bulkier hazard stackers like Gliscor is greatly appreciated, as Arceus-Fairy, Koraidon's best check, takes enormous damage from a Swords Dance-boosted Flare Blitz and is cleanly OHKOed after Stealth Rock and a single layer of Spikes.

Choice Scarf.description: Choice Scarf Koraidon is one of the best revenge killers in the metagame. Flare Blitz hits Arceus-Fairy, Calyrex-S, and Zacian-C. Low Kick threatens Arceus and Ting-Lu and is Koraidon's preferred STAB move for its 120 Base Power against the majority of the metagame without Close Combat's downside. Outrage and Dragon Claw both OHKO Miraidon and opposing Koraidon, but Outrage is preferred for its ability to 2HKO Toxapex and Skeledirge, though it lets any remaining Fairy-types easily revenge kill Koraidon. An Adamant nature allows Choice Scarf Koraidon to 2HKO Arceus-Fairy after Stealth Rock and always OHKO Calyrex-S. Tera Fire boosts Flare Blitz's power to insane levels, gives Koraidon a Will-O-Wisp immunity, and allows it to resist attacks from Arceus-Fairy and Zacian-C. Tera Ghost makes Koraidon immune to Extreme Speed, letting it more effectively serve as an Extreme Killer Arceus check. Koraidon can use U-turn to safely pivot in Pokemon like Calyrex-S and Calm Mind Arceus-Ground, which threaten its checks such as Toxapex and Skeledirge. Teammates like Calm Mind Arceus-Fairy, Zacian-C, and Arceus can weaken Koraidon's checks and potentially bait out Terastallization, enabling Koraidon to clean up late-game. Defensive teammates like Ting-Lu and Landorus-T are appreciated. Ting-Lu checks Choice Scarf users faster than Koraidon, such as Calyrex-S and Miraidon, and provides entry hazard support. Landorus-T offers immense utility via U-turn, bringing pokemon like Calm Mind Arceus-Ground and Calyrex-S in to threaten Koraidon's checks. Rocky Helmet also helps to chip opposing Koraidon, Zacian-C, and Extreme Killer Arceus to bring them into Low Kick range.

Swords Dance.description: Koraidon is one of the best setup sweepers thanks to its perfect coverage and good Speed tier. Scale Shot, when paired with Loaded Dice, gives Koraidon an incredibly strong Dragon-type STAB attack that lets it outspeed Zacian-C and Calyrex-S and break Eternatus, Giratina-O, Skeledirge, and Toxapex. Flare Blitz is Koraidon's best way of hitting Arceus-Fairy, Zacian-C, and Calyrex-S. Low Kick is Koraidon's most spammable move, being 120 Base Power against most of the metagame without the drawback of Close Combat, and it threatens Arceus. Tera Fire gives Koraidon a Fairy-type resistance, letting it beat both Arceus-Fairy and Zacian-C, gives Koraidon a Will-O-Wisp immunity, and increases Flare Blitz's damage output. Tera Ghost gives Koraidon an immunity to Extreme Speed. Koraidon fits best on offensive teams, where it can break through physical walls for its teammates. Teammates like Zacian-C and Arceus can bait out Terastallization, making it easier for Koraidon to sweep. In return, Koraidon can break through physical walls such as Skeledirge, Toxapex, and Landorus-T for them, as it 2HKOes all three with Scale Shot. Koraidon is reliant on Scale Shot's Speed boost to avoid being revenge killed by Calyrex-S, Zacian-C, and Choice Scarf Koraidon, so having teammates that can take advantage of Fairy-types that switch into Koraidon, such as Landorus-T and Skeledirge for Zacian-C and Zacian-C and Toxapex for Arceus-Fairy, are appreciated. Finally, Scale Shot's Defense drop means that Koraidon is susceptible to priority such as Arceus's Extreme Speed. As such, Pokemon that can switch into Arceus, such as Landorus-T and Zacian-C, and Pokemon that can break through it, such as Life Orb Calyrex-S, are appreciated.

ubers.overview: Miraidon's absurd Speed tier, Hadron Engine-boosted power, and strong STAB combination make it a devastating wallbreaker that forces most teams to use both a Ground-type and a Dragon resistance in order to pivot around it. Furthermore, Miraidon's access to Calm Mind, Taunt, Agility, and boosting items makes it incredibly versatile and difficult to play around. However, Miraidon can have a hard time coming onto the field thanks to its Dragon- and Ground-type weaknesses and low physical bulk. Furthermore, Choice Scarf Koraidon, Zacian-C, and Extreme Killer Arceus being prevalent means that Miraidon cannot stay on the field too long. Nonetheless, Miraidon's great Speed tier, utility in Taunt and U-turn, and raw power make it a staple on many teams, and no team is complete without multiple forms of counterplay to it.
ubers.comments:
Other Options

An alternative Double Dance set can be run with Solar Beam over Calm Mind and Tera Grass. When paired with a Life Orb, Tera Grass-boosted Solar Beam can OHKO Ting-Lu and specially defensive Arceus-Ground. However, this set relies on Koraidon's sun being up to work and is more Tera-reliant than Miraidon's standard Double Dance set. Tera Blast Ice is another option on both Double Dance and Calm Mind sets to give Miraidon BoltBeam coverage, but this option also comes with the weaknesses of the Ice typing, a reliance on Terastallization, and a lack of power compared to standard Tera Dragon sets. Tera Fairy is an option on non-Double Dance sets that lets you flip the matchup into Koraidon and opposing Miraidon. However, this comes at the risk of being revenge killed by Zacian-C and threatened by Sunsteel Strike from Necrozma-DM. An alternate EV spread of 208 HP / 252 SpA / 48 Spe is an option on Double Dance sets that lets you outspeed Rayquaza and Kyurem without using Agility.

Checks and Counters

Ting-Lu: Ting-Lu is capable of taking any unboosted attack from Miraidon and can either threaten it out with its powerful Earthquake or use Miraidon's presence as a chance to set up entry hazards. It can also Terastallize into a type that resists Draco Meteor such as Tera Steel or Fairy. However, Ting-Lu's lack of recovery means that it can only pivot into Miraidon a limited amount of times and must be wary of a +1 Tera Dragon Life Orb Draco Meteor, +1 Tera Fairy Life Orb Dazzling Gleam, or a +1 Life Orb Solar Beam, as these threaten to OHKO Ting-Lu after one layer of Spikes.

Ground-types: Bulky Arceus-Ground, Clodsire, specially defensive Gliscor, and Iron Treads can pivot into Miraidon's Electro Drift and take at least one unboosted Draco Meteor. They can also Terastallize into a type that resists Draco Meteor such as Tera Steel or Fairy. Arceus-Ground and Clodsire additionally have access to recovery moves that let them check Miraidon long-term, unlike Ting-Lu. However, they can struggle against Taunt variants of Miraidon and can be OHKOed by Choice Specs and Calm Mind sets.

Revenge Killers: Choice Scarf Koraidon and Miraidon, as well as Zacian-C, outspeed and threaten to OHKO Miraidon with their STAB attacks. However, Koraidon and Miraidon can only enter on a predicted Electro Drift. Extreme Killer Arceus can revenge kill Miraidon if it is heavily chipped, but must be wary of Tera Ghost. Iron Bundle in Electric Terrain also outspeeds Miraidon and threatens to OHKO it with either Choice Specs-boosted Ice Beam or simply Tera Ice-boosted Ice Beam.

Dragon Resists: Zacian-C, Arceus-Fairy, and Flutter Mane can pivot into Miraidon's Draco Meteor and threaten it out with a strong Fairy-type attack. Necrozma-DM can also pivot into Draco Meteor and run Tera Ground paired with Earthquake to threaten Miraidon. However, all of the aforementioned Pokemon are heavily threatened by Electro Drift and must be wary of switching into a predicted attack.

Blissey: Blissey can pivot into any of Miraidon's attacks and is never 2HKOed by Choice Specs- or Life Orb-boosted attacks. However, Blissey must be wary of Taunt blocking its use of Recover. Furthermore, Blissey can only touch Miraidon with Seismic Toss and must be wary of a potential Tera Ghost Miraidon.

Arceus-Grass: Arceus-Grass resists Miraidon's Electro Drift and can pivot into its Draco Meteor. However, it must be wary of Overheat on Choice Specs sets and can be outdamaged by Tera Dragon sets.

Pivot.description:
Miraidon's natural power and access to U-turn make it a strong pivot for offensive teams. Heavy-Duty Boots maximizes Miraidon's longevity against entry hazard-stacking teams and gives it an advantage against Sticky Web teams. Miraidon can use U-turn to bring in Koraidon, Arceus, Kyogre, and Chien-Pao on its checks, such as Ting-Lu, Clodsire, and Arceus-Ground. Taunt prevents Arceus formes and Clodsire from using Recover while limiting hazards and setup from the likes of Arceus, Necrozma-DM, and Ting-Lu. Tera Dragon powers up Miraidon's Draco Meteor, letting it 2HKO Arceus formes and Clodsire and hit Ting-Lu even harder. Tera Steel gives Miraidon the ability to avoid Toxic from Clodsire and Eternatus while letting it resist the likes of Scale Shot and Dragon Claw from Koraidon, Draco Meteor from opposing Miraidon, Play Rough from Zacian-C, Extreme Speed from Arceus, and Judgment from Arceus-Fairy. Tera Ghost sheds Miraidon's weaknesses while also preventing Extreme Killer Arceus from consistently revenge killing it.

Miraidon is quite fast but can still be revenge killed by Choice Scarf Koraidon and Zacian-C. As such, Ho-Oh and Necrozma-DM pair well with it. Necrozma-DM's access to Knock Off especially helps Miraidon and its teammates win the hazard war. Hazard setters such as Ting-Lu and Gliscor appreciate Miraidon limiting both hazards from opposing setters and preventing recovery while also checking opposing Miraidon and Ground-types such as Arceus-Ground, Clodsire, and Ting-Lu. Pivot Miraidon also pairs especially well with Choice Scarf Koraidon thanks to their shared access to U-turn, letting them form a strong pivot core that can wear down Pokemon in conjunction with hazards. Finally, Miraidon pairs well with Calm Mind Arceus formes such as Arceus-Fairy and Arceus-Ground, as Miraidon's strong Draco Meteors and access to Taunt let it wear down special walls such as Arceus-Fairy, Arceus-Ground, Arceus-Grass, Clodsire, and Ting-Lu for them.

Choice Specs.description:
Choice Specs Miraidon is the strongest wallbreaker in Ubers and has the power to 2HKO Arceus formes and Clodsire without the use of Terastallization. Overheat is the standard coverage move on Choice Specs sets, as it offers a midground between hitting Ground-types such as Arceus-Ground, Clodsire, and Ting-Lu and Fairy-types such as Arceus-Fairy, Flutter-Mane, and Zacian-C. U-turn and Volt Switch are both options for the set, but Volt Switch requires the player to be more aggressive against opposing Ground-types. Tera Dragon lets Miraidon 2HKO Ting-Lu and defensive Necrozma-DM while also OHKOing Ho-Oh. Tera Electric powers up Miraidon's Electro Drift and Volt Switch immensely, making them much harder to pivot around with Electric resistancdes such as Koraidon and Eternatus. Tera Fire is an option that pairs well with Overheat, as it lets Miraidon OHKO both Arceus formes and Clodsire in sun without any need for prediction, but it is generally outclassed thanks to the lack of defensive utility and Stealth Rock weakness that it brings.

Miraidon's ability to break special walls, such as Clodsire for Calm Mind Arceus-Fairy and Kyogre and Ting-Lu for Calm Mind Arceus-Ground, is appreciated. In return, they can pivot into Miraidon's revenge killers, such as Koraidon, Zacian-C, and opposing Miraidon. Physical wallbreakers such as Koraidon, Dragon Dance Necrozma-DM, and Zacian-C can wear down shared checks such as Arceus-Ground while giving Miraidon a turn of free entry. Koraidon in particular is a very strong partner for being able to pivot Miraidon into Ho-Oh, and the two of them can wear down Arceus-Fairy together. Finally, Miraidon's reliance on prediction makes it necessary to have teammates that can pivot into the aforementioned Ground- and Fairy-types, such as Ho-Oh and Necrozma-DM.

Double Dance.description:
Double Dance Miraidon utilizes its high Speed, decent bulk, and immediate power to become a fearsome sweeper. Although Electro Drift is the preferred option for its power against Arceus formes, Necrozma-DM, and Zacian-C, Parabolic Charge is an option to increase Miraidon's longevity. Dazzling Gleam is an option over Dragon Pulse that pairs well with Tera Fairy to break Ting-Lu. Electric Seed's Defense boost lets Miraidon set up easily against physical attackers, including Extreme Killer Arceus, Choice Scarf Koraidon, Necrozma-DM, and Zacian-C lacking Play Rough. Leftovers gives Miraidon some flexibility to set up when pivoting into play. Finally, Life Orb boosts Miraidon's damage output massively, letting its Electro Drift OHKO Zacian-C without a Calm Mind boost. Tera Dragon is preferred for its power boost to Dragon Pulse, letting Miraidon 2HKO Clodsire and Ting-Lu with one layer of Spikes up after a Calm Mind boost while also letting it more easily set up on Arceus-Ground and Ting-Lu. Tera Fairy gives Miraidon the ability to set up on Koraidon and opposing Miraidon and powers up Dazzling Gleam enough to OHKO Ting-Lu when using a Life Orb, although Miraidon cannot beat Clodsire with this set. 8 Speed EVs allows Miraidon to outspeed Iron Bundle in Electric Terrain after an Agility boost.

Double Dance Miraidon is best on hyper offense teams, where other teammates like Koraidon and Zacian-C can wear down opposing Pokemon enough to let Miraidon easily sweep. Agility Eternatus is a strong teammate, since it can help wear down Miraidon's checks in Arceus-Ground, Clodsire, and Ting-Lu while absorbing Toxic Spikes. Glimmora, Deoxys-S, and Deoxys-A are good partners for setting entry hazards to wear down Miraidon's checks. Arceus-Ground and Necrozma-DM can help wear down a shared check in Ting-Lu, and Miraidon can pivot into Arceus-Water and Kyogre for them. Other hyper offense support Pokemon such as Grimmsnarl and Orthworm can help Miraidon set up, with the former letting Miraidon set up more easily under dual screens and the latter setting up Shed Tail against on Ground-types.

Wallbreaker.description:
This Miraidon set is a strong wallbreaker without the prediction reliance of Choice Specs Miraidon. Parabolic Charge is an option over Electro Drift in order to make up for Life Orb recoil, but Electro Drift's higher power lets Miraidon OHKO Zacian-C and Arceus-Fairy unboosted. Dragon Pulse provides a more spammable alternative to Draco Meteor that still 2HKOes Arceus-Ground and Clodsire after a Calm Mind boost. Taunt prevents recovery from Arceus formes and Clodsire, and Substitute eases prediction against Ground- and Fairy-type cores as well as against Terastallization. However, Substitute and Life Orb can significantly decrease Miraidon's longevity, so Draco Plate is generally preferred when running Substitute. Draco Plate is an alternative over Life Orb for similar power without the recoil. Tera Dragon is the preferred Tera type thanks to the significant power increase. Tera Dragon-boosted Draco Meteor Miraidon has a 50% chance to OHKO Ting-Lu after a Calm Mind, and a Modest nature guarantees the OHKO. Alternatively, Tera Bug paired with Substitute turns some of Miraidon's checks into setup fodder, as Arceus-Ground's Earthquake and Judgment and Clodsire's Earthquake do not break through Substitute. Solar Beam is another option that threatens to OHKO Ting-Lu after a Calm Mind boost and has no charge turn in sun.

This Miraidon set fits on offensively minded teams that don't mind the lack of longevity in exchange for its wallbreaking power. Sticky Web teams appreciate Miraidon's wallbreaking power to open up setup sweepers like Koraidon and Basculegion-M late-game and can make up for Miraidon's lack of Speed. Arceus-Ground and Necrozma-DM appreciate Miraidon potentially removing Ting-Lu. Entry hazard support from Clodsire, Ting-Lu, Glimmora, and Gliscor can wear down Ting-Lu and Arceus formes into range of Miraidon's unboosted attacks. Choice Scarf Koraidon and Zacian-C can revenge kill Miraidon, so checks to them such as Ho-Oh, Necrozma-DM, and Gliscor are appreciated.

Choice Scarf.description:
Choice Scarf Miraidon is a potent form of speed control that leverages its power and great Speed tier to be a strong alternative to Choice Scarf Koraidon. Miraidon's access to U-turn lets it bring teammates into the Ground-types it cannot power through immediately, such as Kyogre, Koraidon, Arceus-Fairy, and Chien-Pao. Tera Dragon powers up Miraidon's Draco Meteor and Dragon Pulse, letting Draco Meteor 2HKO Clodsire. Tera Electric powers up Miraidon's Electro Drift and Volt Switch but can be risky to use before opposing Ting-Lu, Clodsire, and Arceus-Ground are eliminated. Tera Steel gives Miraidon a resistance to Dragon-type coverage and Extreme Speed, letting Miraidon revenge kill Extreme Killer Arceus, Scale Shot Koraidon, and Flutter Mane in sun in a pinch.

Miraidon's Speed tier makes it the fastest revenge killer in the tier, only tied with Choice Scarf Koraidon and outsped by Iron Bundle in Electric Terrain. However, it struggles with Ground-types such as Ting-Lu and Clodsire, which freely pivot into it and use it to set up entry hazards. Physical wallbreakers such as Koraidon, Necrozma-DM, and Zacian-C can pressure the aforementioned Ground-types. Koraidon in particular is a very strong partner for being able to pivot Miraidon into Ho-Oh, and the two of them can wear down Arceus-Fairy together. This also frees up Koraidon's item slot, letting Koraidon run sweeper sets instead. Miraidon appreciates partners that can set entry hazards such as Gliscor, Ting-Lu, and Clodsire. Gliscor can remove Heavy-Duty Boots from opposing Pokemon while setting Spikes and Toxic Spikes, and Clodsire can absorb Toxic Spikes for Miraidon. Miraidon being locked into any of its STAB moves is exploitable, so having checks to Electric-type resists, such as Koraidon, Miraidon, and the aforementioned Ground-types, and Dragon-type resists, such as Arceus-Fairy, Zacian-C, and Necrozma-DM, is appreciated.

Fur Coat.description: Fur Coat Miraidon is an excellent support Pokemon due to its favorable typing and high Speed, crucially outspeeding threats like Mega Mewtwo X and Kartana to neutralize them with Strength Sap. Thunder Cage provides a consistent, high PP STAB move that is effective at wearing down checks such Ice Scales Arceus-Fairy. Torch Song provides coverage against Steel-types like Mega Steelix and Ferrothorn. Mortal Spin provides entry hazard removal in a pinch and is effective against Imposter users, while synergizing with Thunder Cage's trapping. Judgment hits Dragon-types like Mega Garchomp and opposing Miraidon. Take Heart allows Miraidon to also boost its Special Defense while removing crippling status conditions like poison, making it a potent bulky setup sweeper; note that if Take Heart is opted, then Lava Plume can be used over Torch Song. Fire-immune Steel-types synergize well defensively with Miraidon by switching into threatening wallbreakers like Mega Diancie and Kyurem-B and can also block Imposter users' Mortal Spin. Ho-Oh checks Mega Diancie, provides a Ground-immunity, and appreciates Miraidon as an Imposter-proofer. Other strong physical wallbreakers like Kartana and Mega Blaziken can also be Imposter-proofed by Miraidon.

Calm Mind.description: Calm Mind Miraidon is able to fit on balance and bulky offense teams as a potent wallbreaker due to the raw power provided to it by its ability, Hadron Engine, and great Special Attack. Overheat is used as a midground into teams with both Ground- and Fairy-types. Solar Beam when paired with sun or Power Herb allows Miraidon to hit Ting-Lu super effectively while avoiding the drawbacks of Draco Meteor. Tera Dragon boosts Draco Meteor's damage to horrifying levels, allowing Life Orb Miraidon to OHKO Ting-Lu after one Calm Mind boost and OHKO Arceus-Ground unboosted, both after one layer of Spikes, and it removes Miraidon's Ground-type weakness. Tera Grass allows Life Orb Miraidon to OHKO Ting-Lu with a little bit of chip damage and resist Ground-type moves from Ting-Lu and Arceus-Ground. Life Orb is the preferred item due to it letting Miraidon more easily KO foes such as Ting-Lu and Arceus formes. Alternatively, Heavy-Duty Boots provides Miraidon with greater longevity, letting it come in more freely and potentially outlast its checks. Power Herb is also an option to remove the need of setting sun for Miraidon, allowing it to use Solar Beam freely once. Koraidon is an absolutely mandatory partner for Miraidon running Solar Beam without Power Herb, as it sets up sun for Miraidon and can also pivot it in. Teammates such as Calm Mind Arceus-Ground and Calyrex-S are highly appreciated, as after Miraidon gets rid of Ting-Lu for them, they can potentially sweep. Zacian-C, Koraidon, and Arceus are also highly valuable teammates for Miraidon, as it is able to switch into their checks such as Skeledirge and Toxapex with ease, set up Calm Mind, and heavily damage or potentially KO switch-ins such as Ting-Lu. As Miraidon is easily revenge killed by Pokemon such as Choice Scarf Calyrex-S, Choice Scarf Koraidon, Extreme Killer Arceus, and Zacian-C, checks to them such as Ting-Lu, defensive Arceus formes, Landorus-T, and Toxapex are greatly appreciated.

Pivot.description: Miraidon is a good wallbreaker and pivot found on a variety of balance and bulky offense teams due to its excellent Speed and power. Taunt provides utility by preventing opposing Ting-Lu, utility Arceus formes, and leads such as Glimmora and Ribombee from setting up entry hazards, and it also prevents Pokemon such as Arceus formes from setting up on Miraidon and stops Arceus and Clodsire from using Recover. U-turn enables Miraidon to allow offensive partners to come in against its checks such as Ting-Lu and Arceus-Ground, providing momentum. Tera Dragon boosts Draco Meteor to be able to break through Ting-Lu while also making Miraidon neutral to its Earthquake. Tera Electric boosts Electro Drift, allowing it to OHKO Arceus-Fairy after one layer of Spikes, OHKO Zacian-C, and OHKO Calyrex-S while also taking neutral damage from attacks like Zacian-C's Play Rough and Arceus-Fairy's Judgment. Tera Ghost prevents Extreme Killer Arceus from revenge killing Miraidon while also making it neutral to all previously super effective attacks. Heavy-Duty Boots provides longevity to Miraidon, allowing it to outlast its checks and repeatedly pivot in its offensive teammates. Calm Mind Arceus-Ground and Calyrex-S are also notable partners for Miraidon, as the three of them wear down Ting-Lu for each other. Teammates such as Zacian-C, Extreme Killer Arceus, and Koraidon are beneficial for Miraidon, as they threaten Ting-Lu for it. In return, Miraidon is also able to switch into their checks such as Toxapex and Skeledirge and force them out. Defensive Pokemon such as Ting-Lu, Landorus-T, and defensive Arceus formes are appreciated as well, as Miraidon gets forced out by Calyrex-S, Choice Scarf Koraidon, Zacian-C, and Extreme Killer Arceus. As Miraidon is not able to check faster threats by itself, some form of Speed control such as Extreme Killer Arceus or Choice Scarf Koraidon is necessary.

Double Dance.description: Double Dance Miraidon is an excellent sweeper thanks to its great ability, movepool, and Special Attack and Speed stats. Agility lets Miraidon outspeed all Pokemon in the metagame, including Choice Scarf users such as Calyrex-S and Koraidon. Parabolic Charge lets Miraidon heal itself, making it harder to revenge kill. Dazzling Gleam and Dragon Pulse both hit Dragon-types such as Koraidon, opposing Miraidon, and Giratina-O, but Dazzling Gleam should be used with Tera Fairy and hits Ting-Lu harder, while Dragon Pulse should be used with Tera Dragon and is less reliant on Terastallizing to beat other Ground-types and Eternatus. Leftovers increases Miraidon's overall longevity, while Electric Seed improves its matchup against physical attackers such as Arceus, Zacian-C, and Koraidon, but is single-use. Tera Fairy is great defensively, letting Miraidon set up on Pokemon such as Koraidon, Giratina-O, Arceus-Ground, and opposing Miraidon; it also lets Dazzling Gleam 2HKO Ting-Lu with a layer of Spikes and Arceus-Ground at +1. Tera Dragon is used to remove Miraidon's Ground weakness and boost Dragon Pulse's damage, letting it 2HKO Clodsire and Ting-Lu and OHKO offensive Arceus-Ground at +1 after a layer of Spikes. 92 Speed EVs let Miraidon outpace Choice Scarf Calyrex-S after Agility. Miraidon fits best on bulky offense and hyper offense teams, which try to overwhelm the opposing team. Dual screens let Miraidon set up more easily and make it harder to revenge kill, so Grimmsnarl is a great teammate on hyper offense teams. Miraidon also appreciates entry hazards from Pokemon such as Landorus-T and Glimmora, which can put Pokemon into its KO range. Miraidon can struggle to break through walls such as Clodsire and Ting-Lu, so it pairs well with other offensive Pokemon such as Calyrex-S, Calm Mind Arceus-Ground, and Calm Mind Arceus-Fairy, which can pressure the aforementioned walls for Miraidon. In return, Miraidon can weaken the same walls for these teammates to pick up on. Koraidon and Zacian-C threaten Ting-Lu and lure in physically defensive walls such as Toxapex and Skeledirge for Miraidon to set up against; Miraidon, Koraidon, and Zacian-C can also weaken defensive Arceus-Ground for each other.

Choice Specs (Water).description:
Walking Wake is a terrifying wallbreaker on Water teams due to its powerful STAB combination, great offensive stats, and Dragon typing that aids against Dragon, Grass, Poison and Electric teams. Draco Meteor OHKOes Dragon-types like Baxcalibur, Kommo-o, and Hydreigon and deals with troublesome Water-type answers such as Toxapex, Sinistcha, Volcanion, and Gastrodon. Hydro Pump offers a powerful Water-type STAB attack to hit Steel- and Fairy-types like Gholdengo, Clefable, Kingambit, and Heatran as well as OHKOes Volcarona after a Quiver Dance. Scald offers a reliable Water-type STAB attack due to its accuracy and ability to potentially burn switch-ins such as Alolan Muk, Assault Vest Iron Hands, and Snorlax, while Flip Turn provides Walking Wake with a pivoting move, reducing the need to predict and also maintaining momentum in a match. Alternatively, Hydro Steam not only is reliable accuracy-wise but also aids against sun Fire teams, tearing through every Pokemon barring Volcanion in conjunction with Protosynthesis. Flamethrower may be used instead to threaten the aforementioned Steel-types as well as Ice- and Grass-types such as Alolan Ninetales, Frosmoth, and Amoonguss The given EV spread ensures that Protosynthesis always give a Speed boost under sun, allowing Walking Wake to outpace threats like Ogerpon-H and Choice Scarf Ninetales.

Empoleon offers a resistance to Dragon- and Fairy-type attacks, walling opposing Walking Wake, Flutter Mane, Hydreigon, and Alolan Ninetales. Furthermore, Empoleon has a notable Freeze-Dry neutrality and provides Stealth Rock and Knock Off support to wear down walls like Alolan Muk and Assault Vest Iron Hands. In return, Walking Wake threatens Pokemon like Baxcalibur, Great Tusk, and Zapdos and forms a pivoting core via Flip Turn. Toxapex is heavily valued for its Fairy-type resistance, switching into threats such as Flutter Mane, Iron Valiant, and Enamorus, as well as adds on to Walking Wake's offensive pressure via Toxic Spikes. Urshifu-R and Ogerpon-W break special walls like Empoleon, Gastrodon, and Clodsire. In return, Walking Wake threatens Poison-type walls such as Toxapex, Amoonguss, and Galarian Weezing. Pelipper provides rain support to enhance Walking Wake's wallbreaking capabilities, notably allowing Walking Wake to 2HKO Assault Vest Iron Hands with Hydro Pump, as well as Knock Off to remove vital items like Iron Hands and Galarian Slowking's Assault Vests and U-turn to form a pivoting core and bring in Walking Wake safely. Choice Scarf Hisuian Samurott removes faster Pokemon like Chien-Pao, Dragapult, Greninja, and Flutter Mane using its Fighting- and Dark-type coverage while providing Spikes support with Ceaseless Edge. Additionally, Hisuian Samurott offers vital pivoting with Flip Turn, preserving momentum and wearing down switch-ins while also luring in entry hazard removers like Corviknight and Great Tusk for Walking Wake. Quaquaval offers entry hazard removal via Rapid Spin to allow Walking Wake to pivot more freely, as well as Knock Off support and pivoting using U-turn and Flip Turn. Choice Scarf Greninja is a great speed control option and a great check to enemies like Iron Valiant and Dragapult. Gastrodon can wall Choice Specs Dragapult and Flutter Mane lacking Energy Ball and provides entry hazards to aid in Walking Wake's wallbreaking. Manaphy can heavily wear down Steel and Poison teams and wears down shared checks like Alolan Muk and Water Absorb Clodsire. In return, Manaphy appreciates Walking Wake taking care of Electric-types such as Zapdos, Thundurus-T, and Rotom-W and Dragon-types like Hydreigon and Baxcalibur.

Choice Scarf (Dragon).description:
Walking Wake is a great Choice Scarf user for Dragon teams due to its part-Water typing and coverage, allowing it to revenge kill a plethora of threats such as Chien-Pao, Baxcalibur, and Scizor. It also outspeeds common Choice Scarf users such as Great Tusk, Flamigo, and Iron Treads, which lets it clean Ground, Flying, and Fire teams late-game. With strong STAB moves in Draco Meteor and Hydro Pump, Walking Wake blows past Baxcalibur and Great Tusk. Flamethrower roasts Steel-types like Scizor and Gholdengo, though it lacks the firepower to 2HKO specially defensive Corviknight. Hydro Steam, emboldened by sun, lets Walking Wake demolish Fire teams. Alternatively, Dragon Pulse provides a weaker but more consistent STAB attack, which is great against opposing Dragon teams. The given EV spread and Timid nature cause Protosynthesis to boost Speed, allowing Walking Wake to outspeed Chlorophyll Scovillain and Choice Scarf Cinderace.

Choice Specs Dragapult is an excellent teammate, as it can wear down or eliminate bulky threats such as Corviknight and Hatterene and is also fast enough to deal with Choice Specs Flutter Mane for Walking Wake. Baxcalibur, Hydreigon, and Haxorus appreciate Walking Wake providing speed control, allowing them to wallbreak more effectively. These teammates also batter down defensive walls such as Clodsire, Gholdengo, and Toxapex, making cleaning up with Walking Wake much easier. Dragalge can pivot into Fairy-type moves from Choice Scarf Meowscarada and Choice Scarf Iron Valiant as well as set Toxic Spikes to further wear down the opposing team. This also synergizes well with Garchomp, which sets entry hazards in Spikes and Stealth Rock, phazes the opposition with Dragon Tail or Roar, and pressures Poison- and Steel-types like Clodsire and Klefki. Cyclizar gets rid of entry hazards for Walking Wake, allowing it to come onto the field more.

Other Options

Water

Dragon Pulse is a nice option to consistently wear down Regenerator cores when combating Poison teams, not leaving Special Attack drops like Draco Meteor.

Special Attack Booster Energy.description:
• Flamethrower beats Corviknight and non-Assault Vest Iron Leaves.
  • The HP and Defense EVs allow Walking Wake to survive a hit from Adamant Choice Band Great Tusk, the Special Defense EVs allow Walking Wake to survive Dazzling Gleam from Modest Choice Specs Iron Moth, and the Speed EVs allow Walking Wake to outspeed maximum Speed Corviknight.
  • After using Aqua Jet, Special Attack Booster Energy Walking Wake beats Magnezone and Avalugg with Flamethrower while avoiding being KOed by Mirror Coat.
  • Walking Wake 2HKOes Donphan and Assault Vest Iron Moth by using Aqua Jet after Hydro Pump, and it OHKOes non-specially defensive Sableye by alternating between Hydro Pump and Draco Meteor to OHKO and avoid Sableye's Disable.

Speed Booster Energy.description:
• Snarl beats non-Clear Amulet Espathra and Farigiraf.
  • Flamethrower beats Scizor, as well as non-Weakness Policy Magnezone after using Snarl.
  • Hurricane beats Iron Valiant, Slither Wing, and most Meowscarada.
  • Speed Booster Energy allows Walking Wake to outspeed and OHKO Great Tusk, Haxorus, Dragapult, non-Speed Booster Energy Iron Bundle, and Garchomp.
  • 244 Special Attack EVs allow Walking Wake to maximize its Special Attack while also getting the Speed boost from Booster Energy.
  • Walking Wake should use Snarl twice against non-Choice Specs Magnezone and then use Flamethrower to ensure that it does not lose to Weakness Policy Magnezone.

Choice Item.description: Walking Wake is a strong wallbreaker thanks to its high Special Attack and powerful STAB moves with excellent coverage. Choice Specs can be run to provide Walking Wake with more wallbreaking power, notably giving it a chance to 2HKO RegenVest Swampert, while Choice Scarf helps to make up for its relatively poor Speed and lets it outspeed and OHKO the likes of Chien-Pao and Deoxys-S. Weather Ball is run on Primordial Sea sets for consistency and to chunk Desolate Land Heatran, while Hydro Pump is preferred on Dragon's Maw variants. Draco Meteor hits Desolate Land Iron Moth and Water-resistant switch-ins like RegenVest Manaphy and Hisuian Goodra, outdamaging Regenerator on the latter two and OHKOing the former with Dragon's Maw sets. Knock Off can be run to let Walking Wake better enable its own wallbreaking by crippling RegenVest Pokemon, while Scald and Dragon Pulse can be used if its team already has Knock Off support as more consistent damaging options with no drawbacks and, in the case of Scald, the chance to burn foes. Flip Turn allows Walking Wake to maintain momentum and pivot in teammates safely. Due to its middling Speed when running Choice Specs, Walking Wake is susceptible to being revenge killed by Chien-Pao and Gengar, so it appreciates teammates like Choice Scarf Roaring Moon and Azelf that can take care of faster threats. While Walking Wake can play around RegenVest Pokemon with Knock Off, it still benefits from physically offensive teammates like Galarian Zapdos and Iron Boulder that can more easily handle them. Due to its lack of recovery, Walking Wake appreciates entry hazard removal support from the likes of Great Tusk and Corviknight to allow it to come in safely.

Wallbreaker.description:
• Walking Wake is one of the most dangerous sun wallbreakers in Ubers, capable of 2HKOing even the bulkiest of Water resists and special walls alike.
  • Hydro Steam is Walking Wake's most spammable move; in sun, it 2HKOes Koraidon, OHKOes Flutter Mane, and 2HKOes Toxapex, making it very hard for teams to have a consistent switch-in to it.
  • Dragon Pulse, albeit weaker than Draco Meteor, doesn't come with any drawbacks, making it a much better move to spam if lowering Walking Wake's Special Attack is not desired.
  • Tera Water turns Walking Wake into an unwallable Pokemon, 2HKOing defensive walls like Blissey and OHKOing offensive pivots like Assault Vest Flutter Mane in sun. Tera Fairy can be used instead, as it gives Walking Wake useful resistances to Sucker Punch from Chien-Pao and Kingambit while also making it immune to Dragon-type attacks from Koraidon and Miraidon. Lastly, Tera Steel gives Walking Wake a resistance to Iron Bundle's Ice-type attacks, mainly Freeze Dry.
  • A Modest nature lets Walking Wake wallbreak with extreme ease, allowing for Draco Meteor to 2HKO Clodsire in sun. Alternatively, a Timid nature gets the jump on Timid Chi-Yu and opposing Modest Walking Wake, although the difference in power is very noticeable.
  • Walking Wake is best suited for offensive sun teams and should be used as such, making use of its unique typing to switch into Pokemon like Chi-Yu and counterattack with a nuclear Hydro Steam.
  • Walking Wake is somewhat slow for Ubers standards, so fast partners like Choice Scarf Koraidon and Flutter Mane are a must to compensate for its Speed stat. Koraidon's sun also greatly powers up Walking Wake's attacks.
  • Secondary wallbreakers such as Flutter Mane and Chi-Yu are also recommended, as Walking Wake's Speed hinders its performance as a standalone wallbreaker. Defensive teammates like Clodsire and Great Tusk are also helpful, as they check Miraidon, Flutter Mane, and Koraidon, respectively.

Choice Specs.description:
Walking Wake is a powerful wallbreaker and a staple on sun teams due to its unique offensive typing, amazing Special Attack, high Speed, and signature Hydro Steam, which is a powerful Water-type STAB move that takes full advantage of the sun. Draco Meteor is a brutally powerful STAB move that synergizes wonderfully with Hydro Steam, capable of OHKOing Water-resistant Pokemon including the likes of Ogerpon-W, Raging Bolt, and Kyurem in addition to 2HKOing nearly every Pokemon in the metagame barring Fairy-types such as Clefable and Primarina. Flamethrower guarantees an OHKO on Corviknight and bulky variants of Kingambit, though Flamethrower isn't used very often in practice due to Walking Wake's already fantastic STAB combination; Weather Ball is a stronger alternative to Flamethrower and allows Walking Wake to still take advantage of opposing weathers such as rain or snow. Dragon Pulse can be used in the last slot, which forgoes Draco Meteor's raw power for more consistency; however, Flip Turn allows Walking Wake to generate momentum for its team, taking advantage of switch-ins from the likes of Galarian Slowking and Primarina to safely bring in its teammates; lastly, Knock Off allows it to remove Heavy-Duty Boots from checks such as Galarian Slowking. 244 Special Attack EVs gives Walking Wake a Speed boost from Protosynthesis, making it a potent late-game cleaner against offensive teams due to its power coupled with its heightened Speed, letting it outspeed and threaten would-be revenge killers like Dragapult and Choice Scarf Enamorus; alternatively, Walking Wake can sacrifice the Speed boost for even more power by fully investing in Special Attack, allowing it to break through the likes of Primarina through sheer strength. Tera Water boosts its Hydro Steam's power even further, bolstering its cleaning potential against offense while 2HKOing even resistant Pokemon such as Toxapex after Stealth Rock, and allows Walking Wake to 2HKO even Blissey should it opt for a Special Attack boost; however, Tera Fairy could be considered as an alternative, granting it an immunity to Draco Meteor from Dragapult and opposing Walking Wake as well as a resistance to Kingambit's Sucker Punch.

Choice Specs Walking Wake is a mainstay on sun teams, requiring Torkoal to set the sun with Drought. Torkoal can also set Stealth Rock, which makes defensively answering Walking Wake even more difficult, as checks such as Primarina would repeatedly have to sustain chip damage. Hatterene and Great Tusk are also great teammates for Walking Wake, alleviating the issue of entry hazards limiting its longevity; Hatterene is also capable of forcing out checks such as Toxapex and Iron Valiant, while Great Tusk can check priority revenge killers such as Dragonite and Kingambit. In return, Walking Wake can consistently KO or force out either Pokemon's checks, notably taking on Skarmory for Great Tusk and Heatran for Hatterene. Gouging Fire and Choice Band Roaring Moon can pair with Walking Wake to form a devastating wallbreaking core, which can rapidly overwhelm each of their respective checks through raw power, such as Skarmory, Dondozo, Primarina, and Galarian Slowking, as well as enabling Gouging Fire to clean late-game. Walking Wake also appreciates Roaring Moon's powerful STAB Knock Off removing Heavy-Duty Boots from the likes of Toxapex, and can pivot on its switch-ins with Flip Turn to bring Roaring Moon onto the field. Hisuian Lilligant and Venusaur can threaten Water-types such as Primarina and Ogerpon-W; both also appreciate Walking Wake blowing holes into the opposing team's defenses, giving them ample opportunity to run off with the game after their checks have been weakened. Lastly, Raging Bolt greatly enjoys Walking Wake's efficiency in dismantling its checks, notably Unaware Clodsire, as doing so enables Raging Bolt to sweep more efficiently in mid- or late-game scenarios.

Sun Attacker.description:
• Walking Wake is a powerful special attacker and can function as a Water-type attacker on sun teams thanks to Hydro Steam and Protosynthesis.
  • Hydro Steam is Walking Wake's primary STAB move. While it's simply good outside sun, there are very few things that can switch in on it in sun.
  • Draco Meteor is Walking Wake's strongest move and can slam common Water-resistant Pokemon such as opposing Walking Wake and Palafin.
  • Flamethrower is a strong sun-boosted coverage move that deals super effective damage to Pokemon like Amoonguss and Kingambit, which otherwise resist Walking Wake's STAB moves.
  • Protect keeps Walking Wake safe against faster threats and through field effects and should always be used with Life Orb. Choice Specs Walking Wake should run Dragon Pulse as a consistent Dragon-type STAB option to lock into.
  • Tera Fairy is chosen to remove Walking Wake's weaknesses to Dragon and Iron Bundle's Freeze-Dry. Tera Dragon can also be run to increase Draco Meteor's damage and grant Walking Wake an important Electric resistance against Iron Hands. Tera Water greatly increases Hydro Steam's damage while removing Walking Wake's weaknesses to Dragon- and Fairy-type moves.
  • The EVs listed boost Walking Wake's Speed in sun. If a Special Attack boost is desired, move 8 EVs from Special Defense into Special Attack.

Choice Specs (Water).description:
The EV spread provides a Speed Protosynthesis boost under sun.

This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Swords Dance (Grass).description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

monotype.comments:
Other Options

Ghost

Strength Sap provides Sinistcha with an additional means of recovery and lets it take on physical attackers better. However, this makes Sinistcha susceptible to status and easier to force out. Iron Defense is situationally useful, as it ensures that Shadow Ball Sinistcha can handle Gouging Fire while still dealing with physical attackers, though it is inferior to Strength Sap due to the lack of recovery. Opting for Leftovers over Heavy-Duty Boots enables Sinistcha to set up more Substitutes, but Ghost teams with Sinistcha are unlikely to have entry hazard removal support, which makes Sinistcha easier to wear down. Similarly, an itemless Sinistcha is plausible, as it effectively walls Ceruledge and prevents Knock Off users like Gliscor from breaking its Substitute. However, this is discouraged due to how circumstantial this is.

Calm Mind (Ghost).description:
Calm Mind Sinistcha serves as an effective wincon against types like Ground and Water, as it readily handles walls like Clodsire and Toxapex, which pose problems for Ghost teams. Matcha Gotcha threatens Ursaluna-B and puts physical attackers, such as Choice Band Excadrill, Assault Vest Iron Hands, and Mamoswine, in a situation where they risk getting burned to break Sinistcha's Substitute. The chance to burn also affects the ability of Articuno, Empoleon, and Alolan Muk to wall out Ghost teams in the long run, making it advantageous even if the damage dealt to these walls is negligible. Matcha Gotcha also is Sinistcha's only form of recovery, allowing it to set up and threaten opposing teams longer. Shadow Ball provides more upfront damage and allows Sinistcha to OHKO Flutter Mane and Ceruledge at +1, while Hex synergizes with Matcha Gotcha's ability to spread burns and threatens Gliscor better. Substitute keeps Sinistcha away from status, especially Toxic, from the aforementioned walls and also provides a better matchup against Ursaluna-B, as it prevents Sinistcha from taking damage from Blood Moon. Substitute also takes advantage of forced switches, allowing Sinistcha to fish for burns as often as possible and letting it set up on physical attackers after they have been inflicted with a burn. With 96 Speed EVs, Sinistcha outspeeds and removes Adamant Belly Drum Azumarill, while the remaining EVs are invested in Defense and HP to maximize its bulk, enabling it to sponge hits from Excadrill and Barraskewda. Heatproof is effective against Hisuian Goodra, Cinderace, and Volcanion in a pinch.

Sinistcha annoys almost every special wall in the metagame with its ability to inflict burns, making it a valuable teammate for every special attacker Ghost teams have. For instance, Hex Spectrier can clean up after Sinistcha has burned the opposition. Flutter Mane appreciates the removal of Clodsire, Empoleon, and Zamazenta, while Gholdengo benefits from special walls like Alolan Muk being burned, making it easier for Gholdengo to set up. In return, these teammates dispatch of faster threats like Latios, Ogerpon-H, and Baxcalibur. Dragapult pivots Sinistcha in against walls like Clodsire, deals with Gouging Fire and Roaring Moon, and spreads status to give Sinistcha more setup opportunities. Ceruledge appreciates Sinistcha dealing with bulky Ground- and Water-types, which wall it after a Swords Dance. In return, Ceruledge makes quick work of Flutter Mane, Gholdengo, and Heatran. Furthermore, Ceruledge can also handle threats like Kingambit and Chien-Pao if its Focus Sash remains intact. Mimikyu takes advantage of Sinistcha removing Quagsire and Toxapex, and in return, it provides Ghost teams with a failsafe against threats like Hisuian Samurott, Kingambit, and Chien-Pao. Froslass and Golurk provide entry hazards in Spikes or Stealth Rock to soften up opposing teams. Froslass also provides Thunder Wave to capitalize on Hex and allows Sinistcha to outpace threats like Spectrier, while Golurk can use a Kasib or Colbur Berry to lure and remove threeats like Flutter Mane or Kingambit for it. Skeledirge checks Fire-types that overwhelm Sinistcha like Gouging Fire, Volcarona, and Heatran, and is able to burn foes like Kingambit.

Calm Mind (Grass).description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Hospitality Support.description: • This EV Spread survives a Chien-Pao Ice Spinner and Gholdengo Shadow Ball.

Calm Mind (Ghost).description:
96 Speed EVs outspeeds Adamant Azumarill.

This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Bulk Up.description: The given EV spread allows Okidogi to avoid the 2HKO from Pivot Tornadus-T's Hurricane after Stealth Rock when terastallized into Tera Fairy or Dragon while outspeeding Azumarill. The leftover investment goes into attack along with an Adamant nature.

monotype.comments:
Other Options

Poison

An Adamant nature can instead be used to to give Okidogi a bit more striking power, which can allow it to OHKO threats like Kingambit or Gliscor with Ice punch after a single Bulk Up. 208 HP / 136 SpD / 164 Spe EVs with a Jolly nature can be used to outspeed Adamant Mamoswine, Frosmoth, and faster Gliscor sets. An ultra bulky set with 248 HP / 244 SpD / 16 Spe can be used to maximize Okidogi's bulk, allowing it to survive threatening attacks like Gholdengo's Psychic, +2 Hydreigon's Earth Power, Choice Specs Walking Wake's Draco Meteor, and Tornadus-T's Hurricane while still getting the jump on threats like Adamant Azumarill, Adamant Kingambit, and Mandibuzz.

Bulk Up (Poison).description:
Okidogi has cemented itself as an incredible setup sweeper for Poison teams with its diverse movepool and solid natural bulk, allowing it to safely set up and blow through any Steel- or Dark-type that stands in its way. Toxic Chain and Guard Dog are both helpful in allowing Okidogi to break through teams. Toxic Chain puts more pressure on bulky walls like Sableye, Avalugg, Quagsire, and Skeledirge, which forces them to either switch out or repeatedly use recovery moves. Guard Dog, on the other hand, punishes Intimidate from the likes of Landorus-T, Gyarados, and Paldean Tauros-F and stops phazing from threats such as Ting-Lu and Empoleon. Drain Punch is a useful STAB move that keeps Okidogi healthy and deals solid damage against threats like Kingambit, Garganacl, and Heatran. Knock Off is used to punish Ghost-types like Gholdengo, Ceruledge, and Dragapult that effortlessly wall Okidogi otherwise. It also annoys switch-ins like Toxapex, Galarian Weezing, and Quagsire by removing their Black Sludge. For the final moveslot there are three main options. Taunt prevents Haze from Toxapex and Articuno, Substitute is useful to set up in the face of Pokemon like Amoonguss and Galarian Weezing, and Ice Punch blows through Flying- and Ground-types like Dragonite, Clodsire, and Gliscor. 96 Speed EVs allow Okidogi to outspeed threats like Adamant Torterra, Jolly Kingambit, and Jolly Azumarill, with the rest of the EVs maximizing Okidogi's specially defensive bulk, allowing it to comfortably survive offensive Heatran or Glimmora's Earth Power.

Okidogi's crippling weakness to any Psychic-type attack makes Alolan Muk an essential teammate, being able to handle threats like Espathra, Iron Valiant, Hisuian Zoroark, and Hatterene with its STAB moves. Overqwil, while not as specially bulky, still provides a Psychic immunity while providing support in stacking entry hazards to ease Okidogi's sweep. Galarian Weezing similarly fills an important role with its immunity to Ground-type attacks from threats like Great Tusk, Mamoswine, and Clodsire. Once switched in, it can burn physical threats along with removing hazards, allowing Okidogi to have a much easier time switching in and setting up late-game. Assault Vest Galarian Slowking can soak up special attacks from foes such as Greninja and Walking Wake, remove Landorus with Ice beam, and provides a Psychic neutrality and the ability to create Future Sight traps for Okidogi to exploit. Amoonguss provides assistance in scaring off Ground- and Water-types like Great Tusk, Quagsire, and Urshifu-R with its Grass-type STAB attacks and provides Spore support to give Okidogi a safe opportunity to switch in and begin setting up. Toxapex's solid physical bulk in conjunction with Haze and a Rocky Helmet provides utility in wearing threats down like Zamazenta, Mimikyu, and Ceruledge. Salazzle, thank to its high Speed and ability to wear down physical walls like Toxapex, Galarian Weezing, and Corviknight with Corrosion-enabled Toxic and ability to impede setup sweepers, such as Baxcalibur, Manaphy, and Ogerpon formes, with Encore excels at removing threats Okidogi doesn't like. Glimmora provides similar Corrosion utility, along with the ability to set up hazards and threaten dangerous Flying-types like Dragonite, Moltres, and Zapdos with STAB Power Gem. It can also remove hazards with Mortal Spin to give Okidogi safe entry. Choice Specs Iron Moth's Overheat is great at removing dangerous threats such as Gliscor and Landorus instantly, along with using Discharge to remove Flying- and Water-types like Moltres, Enamorus, and Toxapex. Gengar has valuable utility in its ability to remove pesky Ghost-types like Skeledirge, Gholdengo, and Brambleghast along with being able to Trick its Choice Specs onto walls like Clodsire, making them far easier to break through. Choice Scarf Sneasler makes a solid friend for Okidogi, being able to handle faster threats like Baxcalibur and Chien-Pao, along with using Switcheroo against their shared checks like Skeledirge and Quagsire.

Assault Vest (Fighting).description:
16 Speed EVs lets it outspeed Azumarill. Gunk Shot lets Okidogi deal with Flutter Mane.

This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Choice Scarf (Poison).description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Bulk Up.description:
EV Spreads

  • 100 Speed EVs: This Speed investment outspeeds Jolly Ursaluna.

Choice Scarf (Psychic).description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Bulky Pivot.description: 184 Speed allows you to outspeed Hisuian Arcanine, to allow you to freely U-turn for Toxic Chain chances against it.152 Speed allows you to underspeed Moltres and Moltres-Galar for slow U-turns against them, while still outspeeding Rotom-W to prevent it freely using Volt Switch for free damage.

vgc2024.overview:
• Ogerpon is a strong offensive Pokemon that is unique in being able to check many top Pokemon such as Incineroar and Flutter Mane thanks to its ability Defiant and Speed-boosting Embody Aspect after Terastallization. Combined with access to Follow Me and natural immunity to Spore, Ogerpon is capable of being a constant threat while still providing good supportive value.

  • Ogerpon is almost exclusively used on teams built around Dondozo. With its ability Defiant, Ogerpon can be used to punish Incineroar and Gouging Fire, disincentivizing them from weakening both Dondozo and Chien-Pao and even picking up a clean OHKO on Incineroar with Superpower. Once Terastallized, It can outspeed and OHKO Flutter Mane and both Urshifu formes, which are difficult for Dondozo and Chien-pao or Dragonite to handle.

  • Ogerpon struggles against Pokemon that resist Grass STAB as Tornadus and Raging Bolt as well as foes that outspeed it, either forcing Ogerpon to Terastallize or be unable to attack before fainting, such as Chien-Pao, which outspeeds and can survive one hit thanks to it usually holding a Focus Sash. Ogerpon's Grass typing means it's weak to common threats such as Chien-Pao and Gouging Fire, and its middling bulk makes it unable to take more than two attacks most of the time.

Offensive Redirector.description:
• Superpower is used as coverage to hit Steel- and the plethora of Dark-types that resist Ivy Cudgel, such as Kingambit or Chi-yu. Follow Me can be used to redirect attention from the frailer Chien-Pao and Glimmora, making both exponentially harder to deal with, especially so considering Ogerpon resists Urshifu-R Surging Strike's, one of the best counters to Chien-Pao and Glimmora

  • Covert Cloak is used to prevent a flinch from Fake Out, allowing Ogerpon to pressure Incineroar and its partner turn one. Additionally, blocking certain secondary effects such as Icy Wind's Speed drops from opposing Flutter Manes is useful.

  • The Attack investment is necessary to guarantee an OHKO on Incineroar with Superpower, on Flutter Mane once Ogerpon Terastallizes, and to have the highest chance of an OHKO on Urshifu-R. The Speed investment allows Ogerpon to outspeed Choice Scarf Landorus-T after Terastallization. The rest of the EVs are used to round out Ogerpon's bulk.

Swords Dance.description: Ogerpon, similar to its masked counterparts, occupies a niche as a Swords Dance wallbreaker and sweeper, but with a few tricks up its sleeve. Ogerpon’s unique Speed boost upon Terastallizing and ability to hold an item give it more potential to clean through a weakened team while outrunning common revenge killers such as Choice Scarf Tapu Lele and Kartana. However, Ogerpon faces stiff competition from other offensive Grass-types such as Rillaboom and Kartana, as well as the other Ogerpon formes that possess a beneficial dual typing and an automatic 1.2x boost to their attacks. Superpower allows Ogerpon to wreak havoc on defensive cores using Ferrothorn and Heatran as Grass-type switch-ins, scoring a clean OHKO on Heatran and heavily denting physically defensive Ferrothorn after a Swords Dance. Meadow Plate is the item of choice, OHKOing Gliscor after Swords Dance with Stealth Rock chip, as well as potentially OHKOing Toxapex after Tera Grass and Swords Dance. Knock Off is Ogerpon's strongest option to hit Tornadus-T, Moltres, Zapdos, and Galarian Slowking. Additionally, Defiant leverages Landorus-T's Intimidate against it; however, its poor matchup versus Defog users such as Zapdos, Tornadus-T, and Corviknight render it unable to effectively switch in on Defog attempts and activate Defiant. Teammates that match up effectively into these aforementioned Defog users, such as Ting Lu, Mega Tyranitar, and Gliscor, serve as quality teammates, with Mega Tyranitar in particular being able to chip these foes into range of Ogerpon's attacks. Skarmory and Corviknight are also major roadblocks for Ogerpon, so teammates that can switch into them and force progress like Zapdos and Heatran make for effective teammates.

monotype.comments:
Other Options

Water

Power Whip can be run over Horn Leech. Although this sacrifices its longevity, it now has extra power to be able to deal with several Pokemon Horn Leech usually struggles against. Notably, Power Whip 2HKOes Hatterene and bulky Garchomp. Taunt can also be run to prevent several walls, such as Skeledirge and Sableye, from impeding its wallbreaking through status, thus giving Ogerpon-W a better matchup against them. Aside from this, Taunt gives Ogerpon-W a hand in its matchup against Toxapex, and it can set up freely in front of Ting-Lu and Empoleon without fearing phazing. Encore is another option to let Ogerpon-W exploit setup attempts from sweepers such as Kingambit and Manaphy.

Swords Dance (Water).description:
Ogerpon-W is a strong wallbreaker on Water teams by virtue of its access to Swords Dance combined with a damage multiplier from Wellspring Mask. Apart from this, its part Grass typing grants it a neutrality to Electric and Grass, which helps in matchups against foes such as Assault Vest Iron Hands and Thundurus-T. Aside from this, its ability makes it great in the Water mirror matchup, since it is able to switch safely into Manaphy without fearing burn from Scald. Its Water-type Ivy Cudgel is able to 2HKO Corviknight after a Swords Dance. Horn Leech allows Ogerpon-W access to some form of longevity, with the potential to recover a good amount of HP after a Swords Dance. It notably 2HKOes Rotom-W without a Swords Dance boost and 2HKOes Toxapex after one, which most Water-types struggle against; however, it has to be wary of the former carrying Will-O-Wisp. Play Rough grants Ogerpon-W coverage against the Dragon-types that resist both its STAB moves, such as Baxcalibur and Kommo-o, while Trailblaze allows it to outpace the likes of Chien-Pao and unboosted Iron Valiant after it is used once. Knock Off grants Ogerpon-W some degree of utility, being able to remove Heavy-Duty Boots from the likes of Dragonite and Amoonguss to make them more vulnerable to entry hazards; it also hits Sinistcha and Brambleghast, which resist both of Ogerpon-W's STAB moves.

Hisuian Samurott and Empoleon make for good partners for Ogerpon-W, as the two of them are able to stack hazards to make Ogerpon-W's wallbreaking easier. Choice Scarf Hisuian Samurott is also able to outspeed and remove faster threats to Ogerpon-W like Chien-Pao and Dragapult, while Empoleon can bring it in safely with Flip Turn, wall Alolan Ninetales, and provide a neutrality to Freeze-Dry. In return, Hisuian Samurott appreciates Ogerpon-W breaking through Corviknight, while Empoleon benefits from the removal of Great Tusk. Pelipper makes for another great teammate for Ogerpon-W, setting up rain to strengthen Ogerpon-W's Ivy Cudgel. Aside from rain, Pelipper can pivot into Ogerpon-W via U-turn and threaten Hisuian Lilligant and Amoonguss with Hurricane. Entry hazards from the likes of Gastrodon, Toxapex, and Quagsire can wear down incoming foes for Ogerpon-W to take advantage of. Quagsire can also remove setup sweepers that can outspeed and threaten Ogerpon-W out like Dragonite and Baxcalibur thanks to a combination of Unaware and Toxic, while Toxapex is able to serve as a wall against the likes of Chien-Pao and Meowscarada. As Ogerpon-W struggles with certain bulky Pokemon, such as Galarian Weezing and Zamazenta, it appreciates teammates that can either remove them or wear them down for Ogerpon-W to finish off, such as boosted Manaphy for the former and Basculegion-F under rain for the latter. Urshifu-R pairs well with Ogerpon-W, as it can break bulky Steel-types such as Hisuian Goodra and Empoleon. Lastly, Toxapex and Amoonguss can stop any Ogerpon-W wallbreaking attempts; hence, Choice Specs users such as Walking Wake and Greninja make for great partners.

vgc2024.overview:
• Ogerpon-W has a very well-rounded stat spread, a solid typing, and an amazing movepool with great STAB moves, Spiky Shield, and Follow Me which helps it support frailer teammates.

  • A great example of a less-bulky teammate is Flutter Mane; Ogerpon-W's ability to redirect moves away from Flutter Mane can help it break through the opposing team with its strong Tera Fairy Dazzling Gleam in just a few turns.

  • Another great partner for Ogerpon-W is Kingambit, as it discourages Intimidate, which is one of the few ways to slow down Ogerpon-W's offensive capabilities, and Kingambit can even run a Swords Dance set to set-up with Follow Me support from Ogerpon-W.

  • Ogerpon-W is also already a big threat on its own, as it pressures top threats such as Landorus, Incineroar, Flutter Mane, and Urshifu-R, being especially dangerous with Tera. Ogerpon-W does struggle against Rillaboom and Raging Bolt, which resist both STAB types and can hit it super effectively after Tera.

Offensive Redirector.description:
• Horn Leech is the Grass-type move of choice, as Ogerpon-W appreciates the extra longevity, which becomes especially notable when combined with the Special Defense boost provided by Terastallizing.

  • The EV spread outspeeds Modest Landorus, OHKOes bulky Flutter Mane after Tera, and survives Rillaboom's terrain-boosted Wood Hammer.

Swords Dance.description: A complementary typing and a great Attack stat, especially when considering the 1.2x boost from its Wellspring Mask, give Ogerpon-W a niche as a powerful wallbreaker. Water- and Grass-type attacks hit most Pokemon for at least neutral damage, and after a Swords Dance boost, anything that doesn't resist its STAB combination is KOed. Even checks such as Baxcalibur and Tera Grass Heatran struggle to take a Swords Dance-bolstered Ivy Cudgel, and some of the stoutest walls, such as Toxapex, take heavy damage from a boosted Power Whip. Ivy Cudgel is its strongest Water-type STAB option and hits most Pokemon for neutral damage. Power Whip punishes common Water-resistant Pokemon such as Toxapex, Rotom-W, and Alomomola and is preferred to Wood Hammer despite the potential inaccuracy to avoid recoil. Horn Leech can also be used in order to supplement Ogerpon-W's longevity and let it come in more often. Trailblaze is another niche option, usually seen on Aurora Veil or dual screens hyper offense teams, boosting Ogerpon-W's Speed and allowing it to sweep. Play Rough notably hits Dragon-types that otherwise could resist Ogerpon-W's STAB combination such as Baxcalibur and Dragonite. Superpower is another great option, notably KOing Ferrothorn after a Swords Dance boost. Due to its great wallbreaking capability, setup sweepers such as Volcarona and Booster Energy Iron Valiant appreciate defensive cores being heavily weakened, allowing them to sweep. Water Absorb is a particularly useful ability prior to Terastallizing, as Ogerpon-W can find opportunities to set up on Pokemon such as Mega Swampert and Manaphy, as well as block Alomomola's Flip Turn. Ogerpon-W also appreciates entry hazards from Hisuian Samurott and Landorus-T, as the chip helps it pressure defensive cores even further. Despite all this, bulky Grass-types such as Ferrothorn, Amoonguss, and Kartana can check Ogerpon-W, so Pokemon like Iron Valiant, Mega Medicham, and Zapdos are beneficial as teammates. Ogerpon-W is also threatened by faster attackers like Iron Valiant and Mega Lopunny, so defensive pivots such as Landorus-T, Galarian Slowking, and Mega Scizor are also extremely useful. Despite being locked to Tera Water, this is actually very beneficial to Ogerpon-W, taking away its weaknesses to Flying- and Poison-type attacks and letting it stay in on threats such as Tornadus-T and Sneasler. In addition, Tera Water boosts its Ivy Cudgel to stupendous amounts, 2HKOing Ferrothorn after Stealth Rock and minimal chip at +2. The 1.5x Special Defense boost granted upon Terastallizing can also help mitigate attempts to revenge kill Ogerpon-W by foes like Choice Scarf Tapu Lele, Iron Valiant, and Choice Scarf Gholdengo.

battlestadiumsingles.overview:
Welcome to Battle Stadium Singles Regulation F! This Pokemon has been updated to reflect the new Pokemon that The Indigo Disk has brought!

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

Swords Dance.description:
• This set's write-up has not started yet, but here's some basic info to get you started!

  • 4 HP / 196 Atk / 52 Def / 4 SpD / 252 Spe with Jolly: This spread lets Embody Aspect Ogerpon-W survive both Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Tera-boosted Moonblast and Adamant Ogerpon-H's +1 Tera Fire Ivy Cudgel after Stealth Rock damage.

  • 156 HP / 156 Atk / 4 Def / 12 SpD / 180 Spe with Adamant: This spread lets Embody Aspect Ogerpon-W survive Tera Normal Silk Scarf Ursaluna-B's Blood Moon. It also outspeeds Modest Chi-Yu and survives Adamant Urshifu's Close Combat after Stealth Rock damage.

Specially Defensive.description:
• Ogerpon-W's great support movepool and Embody Aspect's Special Defense boost give it the opportunity to face premier special attackers such as Flutter Mane, Ursaluna-B, and Gholdengo head on.

  • Horn Leech: Horn Leech's recovery can help maintain Ogerpon-W's defensive profile without compromising its offenses.

  • Substitute: Substitute has great synergy alongside Ogerpon-W's other support moves, especially Leech Seed. It's also useful for blocking status moves from foes like Ursaluna-B and Archaludon.

  • Leech Seed versus Synthesis: Due to being forced to run Wellspring Mask, Ogerpon-W misses passive recovery from items such as Leftovers, making Leech Seed a solid option for recovery. Synthesis is a more reliable recovery option at the cost of making Ogerpon-W more vulnerable to Archaludon.

  • Encore: Locking targets into an undesirable move can discourage setup attempts and passive play and allow opportunities for healing.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 4 Atk / 4 Def / 188 SpD / 60 Spe with Careful: This spread aims to maximize Ogerpon-W's special bulk, and it outspeeds positive nature base 70 Speed foes such as Modest Gholdengo, Jolly Breloom, and neutral nature base 85 Speed foes such as Rillaboom.

  • 236 HP / 4 Atk / 52 Def / 156 SpD / 60 Spe with Careful: If using Substitute and Leech Seed, this spread sacrifices some special bulk in exchange for letting Substitute withstand Archaludon's Dragon Tail.

Embody Aspect

Ogerpon-W is locked into a Water Tera type. When it Terastallizes, Water Absorb becomes Embody Aspect. This forme's Embody Aspect boosts Special Defense, making it essentially like an Assault Vest without the downsides, which can be key to taking strong hits such as those from Choice Specs Tera Fairy Flutter Mane and Tera Normal Ursaluna-B.

Swords Dance.description: Fantastic STAB coverage, a solid Speed tier, and good coverage options all make Ogerpon-W a force to be reckoned with, being able to shatter most of the tier's physical walls such as Corviknight, Gholdengo, and Mandibuzz after a Swords Dance. Power Whip packs more of a punch, letting it OHKO RegenVest Manaphy without a Swords Dance boost, while Horn Leech grants it more longevity. Knock Off lets it threaten Desolate Land users such as Iron Moth, Ceruledge, and Heatran, while Play Rough picks off Dragon-types such as Roaring Moon, Dragonite, and Latios. Trailblaze enables Ogerpon-W to act as more of a sweeper, letting it outspeed threats such as Iron Boulder, Chien-Pao, and Deoxys-S, while Spikes can be used to help chip down Hisuian Goodra and other walls for its teammates. Ogerpon-W pairs well with fast cleaners such as Iron Boulder and Choice Scarf Roaring Moon, as they appreciate its ability to pressure Fluffy users such as Corviknight and Great Tusk thanks to Ivy Cudgel not making contact. In spite of its solid speed, Ogerpon-W is still threatened by faster targets such as Chien-Pao, Choice Scarf Azelf, and Roaring Moon, making defensive pivots such as Corviknight and Swampert crucial in order to bring it in safely.

Bulky Attacker.description:
• Ivy Cudgel is a strong STAB option that hits common threats like Landorus, Incineroar, and Diancie super effectively and threatens an OHKO on Flutter Mane while also dealing solid damage to neutral targets.
  • Ogerpon-W has quite a few options for its Grass-type STAB attack to hit Water-resistant foes like Palafin, Volcanion, and opposing Ogerpon-W. Horn Leech has respectable power in addition to giving Ogerpon-W a way to sustain itself, which can be helpful considering how crucial its health is. Power Whip a stronger option, allowing Ogerpon-W to hit some targets harder than it would with Ivy Cudgel such as Tyranitar and Ursaluna.
  • Follow Me leverages Ogerpon-W's good typing to support its team and shield its teammates from threatening attacks and status moves, with Water Absorb allowing it to heal from Water-type attacks such as Palafin's Jet Punch and Volcanion's Steam Eruption. Encore punishes Fake Out, Protect, and speed control moves, forcing the Encore target to switch out or repeatedly use a detrimental move, generating momentum for Ogerpon-W's team.
  • Ogerpon-W usually uses Spiky Shield, but on faster-paced teams it might opt drop this for Encore due to the utility of Follow Me being desired in addition to Encore's potential to swing the momentum of a game.
  • In addition to the usual benefits, Ogerpon-W gains +1 Special Defense upon Terastallizing, considerably improving its matchups against Flutter Mane and Deoxys-A.
  • The given EV spread lets Ogerpon-W outspeed Landorus and survive a Tera Stellar Chien-Pao Icicle Crash, with the rest of the EVs going into Attack to allow Power Whip to OHKO maximum HP Flutter Mane. Alternatively, an EV spread of 252 HP / 28 Atk / 84 Def / 72 SpD / 72 Spe with an Adamant nature can be used to survive a Choice Band Tera Normal Extreme Speed from Dragonite with Sword of Ruin active or a Choice Specs Tera Fairy Moonblast from maximum Special Attack Flutter Mane while still outspeeding Smeargle and Modest Glimmora.
  • Tornadus makes a great partner for Ogerpon-W, as it provides Prankster Tailwind support it and threatens Grass-types Ogerpon-W can't touch such as Rillaboom and opposing Ogerpon-W with Bleakwind Storm, and it can even strengthen Ivy Cudgel with Rain Dance. Flutter Mane threatens out Dragon-types like Baxcalibur and Raging Bolt that resist Ogerpon-W's STAB combination, and it appreciates the potential Follow Me support Ogerpon-W provides to draw strong priority attacks like Kingambit's Sucker Punch and Rillaboom's Grassy Glide away from it. Setup Pokemon such as Swords Dance Kingambit appreciate Ogerpon-W providing both Follow Me and Encore support to generate setup opportunities for them by either redirecting attacks or shutting down an opposing Pokemon.

Swords Dance (Water).description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

monotype.comments:
Other Options

Fire

Ogerpon-H can opt to run Power Whip over Horn Leech. With Power Whip, Ogerpon-H is able to OHKO Toxapex after a Swords Dance boost and Stealth Rock support. However, Ogerpon-H sacrifices its longevity by running Power Whip. Knock Off is also an option in the fourth slot to threaten Skeledirge and remove Heavy-Duty Boots from Baxcalibur and Dragonite to make them susceptible to Stealth Rock; however, it leaves Ogerpon-H susceptible to Dragon-types and faster revenge killers without Play Rough and Trailblaze, respectively.

Grass

Knock Off can be used in order to provide coverage against Skeledirge while also removing key items such as Heavy-Duty Boots from the likes of Dragonite and Pelipper. Power Whip with Rillaboom support can be used to OHKO Toxapex with Grassy Terrain and minimal chip damage.

Swords Dance (Fire).description:
Ogerpon-H makes a terrifying wallbreaker on Fire teams with access to Swords Dance in conjunction with the damage multiplier from Hearthflame Mask. Apart from this, its part Grass typing allows Ogerpon-H to match up well against various Water-, Rock-, and Ground-types such as Dondozo, Garganacl, and Great Tusk. With Hearthflame Mask, Ogerpon-H's Ivy Cudgel becomes a Fire-type move capable of 2HKOing Baxcalibur and Clodsire without a Swords Dance boost while also breaking through sturdy walls such as Hisuian Goodra, Ting-Lu, and Galarian Weezing after a Swords Dance boost. With Horn Leech, Ogerpon-H has access to some form of recovery especially against the Ground-types that most Fire-types tend to struggle against such as Ursaluna-B and Gastrodon. Play Rough allows Ogerpon-H to threaten the Dragon-types that take little from its STAB moves, OHKOing Kommo-o without a Swords Dance boost and OHKOing tanky Garchomp after a Swords Dance boost. On the other hand, Trailblaze allows Ogerpon-H to outspeed Iron Valiant and Flutter Mane after it is used once.

Ninetales and Torkoal are key teammates for Ogerpon-H, as they set up sun to boost Ogerpon-H's damage from Ivy Cudgel to devastating levels. Notably, it is able to 2HKO Gliscor under sun without a Swords Dance boost. Torkoal is also able to set up Stealth Rock to weaken foes, putting them in OHKO range from Ogerpon-H's attacks. Ogerpon-H appreciates forms of entry hazard removal such as Cinderace's Court Change, Torkoal's Rapid Spin, and Talonflame's Defog. Court Change is notable, since it can possibly gain dual screens placed by foes such as Klefki and Alolan Ninetales, although it is best used when any hazards are not on the opponent's side of the field. Ogerpon-H struggles with certain walls such as Toxapex, so it appreciates Heatran being able to trap and eliminate it with Earth Power. In return, Ogerpon-H is able to threaten Ground-types Heatran struggles with such as Ting-Lu. Volcanion and Hisuian Arcanine make for great partners, as they are able to check various offensive Pokemon Ogerpon-H struggles with.
