Volcanion, with its immunity Water and its great bulk, checks the likes of Azumarill and Greninja, while Hisuian Arcanine is able to revenge kill sweepers like Dragonite and Baxcalibur. Lastly, Ogerpon-H's wallbreaking allows it to enable sweeps from Ceruledge and Volcarona, with the former appreciating Great Tusk's removal, while the latter appreciates Dondozo's removal.

Swords Dance (Grass).description:
Ogerpon-H is an invaluable asset on Grass teams. With Swords Dance and the damage bonus from Hearthflame Mask, Ogerpon-H serves as a strong wallbreaker, and its Fire typing also gives Grass teams a hand in both the Steel and Ice matchups. Aside from this, its access to Mold Breaker allows it to bypass abilities such as Heatran's Flash Fire, Dondozo's Unaware, and Dragonite's Multiscale. With Hearthflame Mask, Ivy Cudgel turns into a powerful Fire-type move, and combined with its Speed, Ogerpon-H is able to beat the likes of Alolan Ninetales and Corviknight before a Swords Dance boost, as well as Hisuian Goodra after. Horn Leech grants Ogerpon-H some form of longevity. Play Rough allows Ogerpon-H to threaten the likes of Kommo-o, and after a Swords Dance Boost, it can 2HKO Dragonite. Alternatively, Trailblaze gives Ogerpon-H potential as a sweeper. After one Trailblaze, Ogerpon-H outspeeds the likes of Chien-Pao and Choice Specs Greninja. Lastly, with Zen Headbutt, Ogerpon-H can surprise would-be switch-ins such as Toxapex, Clodsire, and Iron Moth.

Entry hazard support from the likes of Brambleghast and Toedscruel is appreciated to wear down foes into OHKO range from Ogerpon-H. Notably, Ogerpon-H has a chance to OHKO Kingambit with one layer of Spikes. The two of them also have access to Rapid Spin, allowing them to remove hazards so that Ogerpon-H has more opportunities to switch in without getting worn down. Toedscruel can also take Fire-type attacks from Iron Moth and KO it back, while Brambleghast can switch into a predicted Flying-type move as well as revenge kill Flutter Mane with Shadow Sneak. Amoonguss is another great teammate, as its bulk and access to Spore allow it to either incapacitate or force out foes such as Dragonite. Choice Scarf Meowscarada outspeeds and removes potential threats to Ogerpon-H like Spectrier and faster Dragon-types, and it can bring Ogerpon-H in safely. Ogerpon-H's wallbreaking enables sweepers such as Hisuian Liligant and Torterra. In return, the two of them can handle foes Ogerpon-H struggles with, such as Landorus for the former and Toxapex for the latter. Rillaboom is a great revenge killer and wallbreaker to pair with Ogerpon-H, as with Grassy Glide, it can remove faster threats such as Flutter Mane and Hoopa-U. Aside from this, Rillaboom also provides Grassy Terrain to boost the power of Ogerpon-H's Grass-type moves. In return, Rillaboom appreciates Ogerpon-H removing foes Rillaboom struggles with such as Corviknight and Articuno. Breloom is another great teammate, as due to its Fighting typing and access to Mach Punch, it can easily deal with Kingambit. Lastly, Abomasnow has some niche as a teammate, as it can set up Aurora Veil to make Ogerpon-H and its teammates harder to KO.

vgc2024.overview:
• With a solid stat spread, incredible damage output with Terastallization, a unique typing and access to utility such as Follow Me, Ogerpon-H can provide some unique assets to a team.

  • Ogerpon-H has a strong STAB combination that is only walled by Fire- and Dragon-types. Because of this, some of its best partners include Urshifu-R, Landorus and Flutter Mane, which are all powerful attackers that pair well with Ogerpon-H and enjoy Follow Me support. Another strong partner is Kingambit, which dissuades Intimidate from weakening Ogerpon-H, while Follow Me provides an opportunity for Swords Dance Kingambit to set up.

  • Ogerpon-H becomes an extremely powerful offensive threat once Terastallized, being able to OHKO metagame staples like Flutter Mane, Urshifu-R, Rillaboom, and Landorus. Ogerpon-H also has a fantastic matchup against Amoonguss; not only is it able to completely ignore Amoongus's Spore and Rage Powder, but it is also able to OHKO it with Ivy Cudgel or with Wood Hammer should Amoonguss Terastallize into a Water-type. Additionally, Mystic Water variants of Urshifu-R get outsped and OHKOed.

  • Bad matchups for Ogerpon-H include Pokemon such as Entei and Raging Bolt that can wall its STAB combation. For this reason, as well as Intimidate hampering Ogerpon-H's offensive capabilities, Incineroar is a very stable check to it. Lastly, despite having solid bulk, powerful threats that can outspeed Ogerpon-H can OHKO it such as Choice Scarf Urshifu-R. However, with speed control or Fake Out support from Pokemon like Rillaboom, Ogerpon-H can take on Choice Scarf Urshifu-R.

Offensive.description:
• Horn Leech trades Wood Hammer's power for greater longevity.

  • Follow Me is by far the best third move on this Pokemon, but if the team does not require a redirector, Ogerpon-H can use Grassy Glide; if this is the case, it is almost always paired with Rillaboom to ensure Grassy Glide is a priority move. Alternatively, Stomping Tantrum allows it to hit opposing Fire-types such as Entei and Chi-Yu.

  • The Speed EVs allow Ogerpon-H to outspeed Modest Landorus and Adamant Urshifu-R. The Attack EVs with the Adamant nature allow it to OHKO Flutter Mane after Terastallization even when Ogerpon-H is Intimidated.

  • The bulk investment allows Ogerpon-H to live most Choice Scarf Urshifu-R's Tera Water Surging Strikes while having a favorable roll to survive Timid Landorus's Sludge Bomb.

battlestadiumsingles.overview:
Welcome to Battle Stadium Singles Regulation F! This Pokemon has been updated to reflect the new Pokemon that The Indigo Disk has brought!

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

ALL STAR.description:
• With its great offensive presence and incredible ability in Mold Breaker, Ogerpon-H is one of the premier threats in Regulation F.

  • Ivy Cudgel: Ivy Cudgel offers a consistent STAB move with an elevated critical hit rate, allowing Ogerpon-H to power through even foes that resist Fire.

  • Horn Leech VS. Trailblaze: Horn Leech provides a consistent Grass-type STAB move and a form of healing to assist in longevity; however, Trailblaze’s Speed boost can allow Ogerpon-H to take over games on the spot if given the chance.

  • Play Rough VS. Rock Tomb: Play Rough is good coverage for foes such as Dragonite and the Urshifu formes, as well as Pokemon that might try to use Tera Dragon to resist Ogerpon-H’s STAB combination. Rock Tomb doesn't hit as many Dragon-types, but in exchange offers speed control and is Ogerpon-H's best attack against Fire-types like Entei and Incineroar.

  • Swords Dance: Swords Dance boosts Ogerpon-H’s Attack to frightening levels, and thanks to Mold Breaker, it cannot be ignored by the likes of Unaware Dondozo.

  • Quick Attack: While difficult to run without giving up Swords Dance, Quick Attack is great for cleaning up late game with Embody Aspect.

Other Options

  • Knock Off: Knock Off provides team support with its item removal, removing pesky items like Porygon2's Eviolite and the rare Skeledirge's Ability Shield. It's coverage isn't as good as the other options though.

  • Encore: Ogerpon-H’s good Speed allows it to make decent use of encore to lock foes into utility moves, providing itself or its teammates turns to set up.

  • Substitute: Substitute when paired with Swords Dance is a huge help against Dragon Tail Archaludon, though this will come at the cost of coverage.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 100 Atk / 92 Def / 60 Spe with Adamant: This spread outspeeds Iron Bundle after Trailblaze while avoiding a 2HKO from Focus Sash Chien-Pao's Sucker Punch; however, it will no longer outspeed Urshifu.

Tera Types

The Hearthflame Mask grants Ogerpon-H a Fire Tera type. When Ogerpon-H Terastallizes, it is given a new ability, Embody Aspect, Which boosts Ogerpon-H’s attack. However, it will no longer have access to Mold Breaker.

Bulky-pon.description:
• Ogerpon-H's incredible power in Embody Aspect, unique typing, and utility-laden movepool make it the crown jewel of bulky Fire-types!

  • Rock Tomb: Rock Tomb provides fantastic speed control and punishes common switch-ins like Dragonite and Gouging Fire.

  • Quick Attack: Quick Attack pairs beautifully with Embody Aspect to pick off weakened foes late-game.

  • Encore: Even without Swords Dance to set up with, Encore is still a great way to punish support moves from Pokemon that Ogerpon-H otherwise struggles with such as Archaludon and Tera Poison Garganacl.

  • Swords Dance: Even with this set's focus on bulk, Ogerpon-H is fully capable of charging through slower teams after a boost, with common stall team members like Dondozo being particularly juicy targets thanks to Mold Breaker.

  • Synthesis: Synthesis is Ogerpon-Hs most reliable form of recovery, sacrificing offensive utility for longevity.

Other Options

  • Taunt: Taunt is a good way to stop Stealth Rock from flying up from the likes of Ting-Lu and Archaludon, in addition to making Clear Amulet Dragonite switch ins easier to handle.

  • Power Whip: The accuracy can be a big issue, but in addition to greater power, it won't be blocked by Psychic Noise from Primarina and Iron Crown like Horn Leech

Tera Types

  • Embody Aspect: Ogerpon-H is locked into a Tera Fire, but it trades that and Mold Breaker in exchange for an Attack boost via Embody Aspect! This is perfect for cleaning up teams late-game and saving Ogerpon-H from opposing Ogerpon-H, but note that it completely nullifies Ogerpon-H's potential to check Urshifu-R rc and can open it up to being picked off by other Aqua Jet users like Basculegion and Primarina late-game.

EV Spreads

  • Ogerpon-H is very customizable in terms of EVs, so only take these as examples. For more exact fine-tuning, feel free to experiment with our damage calculator!

  • 252 HP / 4 Atk / 60 Def / 36 SpD / 156 Spe with Adamant: This spread survives Adamant Choice Scarf Urshifu-R's Tera Water Surging Strikes rc while outspeeding the more problematic Adamant Punching Glove Urshifu-R. The Special Defense EVs give Ogerpon-H a high chance of surviving both Blood Moon and Vacuum Wave from Ursaluna-B that lack an offensive item.

  • 252 HP / 4 Atk / 156 Def / 36 SpD / 60 Spe with Adamant: This spread sacrifices some Speed to survive even Adamant Punching Glove Urshifu-R's Tera Water Surging Strikes while still usually surviving Blood Moon followed by Vacuum Wave from Assault Vest Ursaluna-B. The Speed investment outspeeds Modest Gholdengo, Jolly Breloom, and up to Timid Iron Bundle after Rock Tomb.

  • 236 HP / 212 Defense / 60 Spe with Impish: This extremely defensive spread sacrifices plenty of power and some reliability against Ursaluna-B, but makes Ogerpon-H so physically durable that even Jolly Focus Sash Chien-Pao will fail to 2HKO Ogerpon-H! The bulk also gives Ogerpon-H its 2nd-best ah shot at surviving Jolly Choice Band Tera Water Urshifu-R's Surging Strikes at around 69%, while the Speed EVs outspeed Timid Iron Bundle after being smacked by Rock Tomb's Speed debuff.

Swords Dance.description: Thanks to its great Attack stat, its strong STAB moves, and Swords Dance, Ogerpon-H is a powerful wallbreaker that's able to threaten common physical walls like Deoxys-D and non-Well-Baked Body Corviknight. Power Whip OHKOes defensive Great Tusk at +2 and has a good chance to OHKO offensive Great Tusk, while Horn Leech trades power for healing and a guaranteed chance to hit. Play Rough threatens Dragon-types like Dragonite and Roaring Moon looking to switch in, while Knock Off has a high chance of OHKOing Well-Baked Body Gholdengo at +2 and hinders switch-ins like Primordial Sea Zapdos and Well-Baked Body Mandibuzz and Corviknight. Fast cleaners like Choice Scarf Azelf and Chien-Pao appreciate Ogerpon-H's ability to threaten their switch-ins like RegenVest Swampert and Intimidate Corviknight, respectively, paving the way for them to clean late-game. Ogerpon-H's middling bulk and only decent Speed stat leave it threatened by many faster offensive foes like Roaring Moon and Iron Boulder, so teammates that can deal with them offensively like the aforementioned Choice Scarf Azelf and Chien-Pao or defensively like Great Tusk and Corviknight, which can also remove the entry hazards that Ogerpon-H is prone to getting worn down by, are appreciated. Entry hazard support from the likes of Great Tusk and Heatran is also appreciated, as it helps Ogerpon-H KO foes like Gholdengo and Deoxys-D.

Swords Dance (Grass).description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Swords Dance (Fire).description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

monotype.comments:
Other Options

Rock

Play Rough is another good option over Superpower, as it hits Kommo-o and gets a guaranteed OHKO on Urshifu-S without a Swords Dance boost; however, it leaves Ogerpon-C without coverage for Steel-types. Knock Off can be used to hit Gholdengo, Jirachi, and create permanent progress by removing items. Low Kick can be used over Superpower as an alternative option that doesn't drop Ogerpon-C's stats while still threatening Steel types. Taunt allows Ogerpon-C to set up in front of Toxapex and prevents burns from Galarian Weezing.

Swords Dance (Rock).description:
Ogerpon-C is an excellent wallbreaker and setup sweeper for Rock teams, not only because of its neutrality to Ground- and Water-type moves, but also because it is able to outspeed and deal with threats like Great Tusk, Gastrodon, and Mamoswine. Sturdy allows Ogerpon-C to take a hit from and remove faster threats like Barraskewda, as well as Choice Scarf Great Tusk and Choice Scarf Galarian Zapdos after a Swords Dance. Ivy Cudgel deals with threats like Ogerpon-H, Baxcalibur, and Enamorus, while also OHKOing Dragonite and Heatran after a Swords Dance. Horn Leech is a good Grass STAB move, being able to hurt Ground- and Water-types like Quagsire and Ting-Lu and OHKO Walking Wake after a boost. Horn Leech's recovery is useful for extending Ogerpon-C's longevity and can let Sturdy be used again if it brings Ogerpon-C back to full HP. Superpower is a strong coverage move as it is able to deal with Steel- and Dark-types like Iron Treads, Hisuian Goodra, Urshifu-S, and Kingambit while being able to OHKO Snorlax at +2.

Choice Scarf Glimmora, with its colorful moveset, deals with faster threats that outspeed Ogerpon-C like non-Choice-Scarf Greninja, Kommo-o, and Iron Valiant. In return, Ogerpon-C deals with Azumarill and Ursaluna-B for Glimmora. Air Balloon Glimmora can switch into threatening Ground-type moves while taking on foes like Great Tusk, clear entry hazards with Mortal Spin to make sure Ogerpon-C's Sturdy isn't broken, and sets its own hazards to enable Ogerpon-C's sweep. Tyranitar sets up sand to allow Ogerpon-C to set up easier due to the Special Defense boost, allowing Ogerpon-C to survive a Draco Meteor from Choice Specs Walking Wake. Tyranitar also acts as a specially defensive tank for Ogerpon-C and deals with Flutter Mane, Dragapult, and Spectrier. Ogerpon-C aids Tyranitar by dealing with Landorus-T and non-Choice Scarf Hisuian Samurott. Choice Band Hisuian Arcanine is a strong wallbreaker, using Head Smash and Flare Blitz to break through walls like Gholdengo and Corviknight. Hisuian Arcanine appreciates Ogerpon-C being able to deal with pesky Water- and Ground-types like Belly Drum Azumarill, Landorus, and Sandy Shocks. Coalossal is a decent physical wall that can remove hazards, which prevents Ogerpon-C's Sturdy from breaking, and deals with Chien-Pao, Kingambit, Scizor, and Corviknight. Coalossal also sets up Spikes to enhance Ogerpon-C's wallbreaking. Ogerpon-C takes care of Ursaluna-B and Manaphy for Coalossal. Iron Defense + Body Press Garganacl can act as a defensive stallbreaker, using Salt Cure to weaken impediments to Ogerpon-C sweeping, like Skeledirge, Dondozo, and Hisuian Goodra. Ogerpon-C shuts down Choice Band Mamoswine, which would otherwise destroy Garganacl. Lead Kleavor is another option that can set Stealth Rock with Stone Axe, potentially breaking a Focus Sash on Ceruledge, Breloom, and Ribombee that can hinder Ogerpon-C's sweeps otherwise. Assault Vest Diancie eases the Fighting and Dragon matchups by being able to take on non-Choice Band Urshifu-S, Iron Valiant, Baxcalibur, and Dragapult. Alolan Golem can trap and eliminate Steel-types such as Corviknight and Scizor for Ogerpon-C. In return Ogerpon-C destroys Ground-types like Quagsire and Ursaluna-B.

vgc2024.overview:
• Ogerpon-C is a great offensive support Pokemon thanks to its high Attack, good offensive typing, access to Follow Me when paired with its solid defenses and ability, and great Speed, having great matchups into Pokemon like Tornadus and Entei.

  • Ogerpon-C can pair well with offensive Pokemon like Landorus, Choice Scarf Urshifu-R, and Iron Hands that help deal with the Fighting-, Ice-, and Steel-types that threaten it like the Urshifu formes, Chien-Pao, and Archaludon. Ogerpon-C can also support Trick Room setters like Farigiriaf, as they have a much easier time setting Trick Room with Ogerpon-C redirecting moves away from them.

  • Ogerpon-C can be overwhelmed by Pokemon like Gholdengo, Chien-Pao, and especially Urshifu-R, which bypasses its Sturdy ability by using Surging Strikes. Therefore it appreciates partners like Incineroar, Iron Hands, and Amoongus that check these Pokemon. In addition to this, they can also provide it with Fake Out support and redirection.

Redirection Support.description:
• Ivy Cudgel synergizes well with Ogerpon-C's Grass-type moves, hitting Fire- and Flying-types like Tornadus, Incineroar, and Chi-Yu.

  • Horn Leech provides Ogerpon-C with recovery, while Power Whip hits targets harder, threatening an OHKO on Urshifu-R.

  • Follow Me lets it redirect moves away from its teammates like Sucker Punch and Spore from Chien-Pao and Amoonguss, respectively.

  • Tera Rock bolsters Ivy Cudgel's damage, letting it guarantee an OHKO on Entei, and the Defense boost thanks to Embody Aspect can let it almost always survive Close Combat from Choice Scarf Urshifu-R.

battlestadiumsingles.overview:
Welcome to Battle Stadium Singles Regulation F! This Pokemon has been updated to reflect the new Pokemon that The Indigo Disk has brought!

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

Pseudo-Sash.description:
• Ogerpon-C is a great Sturdy Pokemon, being much faster and having access to set-up moves compared to Archaludon, though using both together is certainly possible.

  • Horn Leech: While it has stronger Grass-type STAB moves, Horn Leech's recovery can bring Ogerpon-C back to full health while taking advantage of Sturdy.

  • Knock Off: This is Ogerpon-C's best option against Gholdengo.

  • Swords Dance and Encore: Swords Dance gives Ogerpon-C more use in late-game situations, with Sturdy making Swords Dance easy to use provided hazards have not been set up.

  • Encore: Encore greatly punishes support moves, especially Stealth Rock users since Ogerpon-C in team preview may make setting up hazards a priority for your opponent.

  • Quick Attack: While weak, Quick Attack gives Ogerpon-C the edge against Focus Sash foes with priority such as Urshifu-R and speedy Focus Sash users like Iron Bundle.

  • Rock Tomb: Dropping a foe's Speed with Rock Tomb can be a useful and unexpected way to revenge kill them after Ogerpon-C is KOed and prevents Terastallized Dragon Dance foes like Dragonite and Baxcalibur from setting up easily.

Alternate EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 124 Atk / 68 Def / 4 SpD / 60 Spe with Adamant: This bulkier spread allows Ogerpon-C to survive Jolly Punching Glove Urshifu-R's Tera Water Surging Strikes and outspeeds Iron Bundle after Rock Tomb's Speed drop. It also naturally outspeeds Jolly Breloom, Modest Archaludon, and Modest Gholdengo, while also outspeeding Timid Iron Bundle after a Speed drop from Rock Tomb.

Other Options

  • Trailblaze: Ogerpon-C is not nearly as effective at sweeping with Trailblaze as Ogerpon-H, but it's still a potential win condition that can work well with Sturdy due to ease of setup.

  • Leech Seed: While Rock is not a good defensive typing, both Sturdy and Embody Aspect can make good use of Leech Seed's recovery.

  • Spikes: Sadly Ogerpon-C doesn't learn Stealth Rock, so this is the best alternative. While Spikes aren't bad, their failure to hit important floating Pokemon like Dragonite and Landorus-T means they aren't a perfect replacement for Stealth Rock.

Embody Aspect

Ogerpon-C is locked into a Rock Tera type, with the bonus of getting a Defense boost via Embody Aspect. While the Defense boost can be useful, note that Ogerpon-C loses Sturdy, which ironically can make it easier to OHKO! If needing the Defense boost, it's usually best to do this if Ogerpon-C is not at full health or needs a boosted Ivy Cudgel to KO a threat.

Swords Dance (Rock).description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Swords Dance.description: With a good Speed tier, access to Sturdy, and a good offensive profile, Ogerpon-C cements itself as a solid option for hyper offense teams; it also fits on any team that can reliably keep entry hazards off the field, as Sturdy allows it to act as an emergency button when faced with a setup sweeper such as Volcarona or Mega Gyarados. However, Ogerpon-C should be mindful about using its Tera, as this removes its Sturdy for an arguably worse +1 Defense. Power Whip is used for its higher Base Power, which reduces Ogerpon-C's reliance on Swords Dance for immediate power, while Horn Leech trades damage for healing and reliability. Superpower allows Ogerpon-C to hit Ferrothorn, although this breaks Sturdy, along with Tera Steel foes like Iron Valiant. Ogerpon-C's main weakness lies in its reliance on Sturdy to set up against more powerful foes and its lack of immediate power before setting up. Thus, it is better off being saved as a cleaner for the later stages of a game. Entry hazard support, in particular Spikes, is highly valued to allow Ogerpon-C to KO many more threats; it can capitalize on hazard chip, for instance KOing even bulky foes like defensive Great Tusk unboosted once they are chipped. Thus, allies that can set hazards early-game like Hisuian Samurott and Garchomp are good partners. Ogerpon-C is also held back by its middling Speed tier, which leaves it susceptible to being revenge killed by Mega Lopunny, as it is capable of bypassing Sturdy, along with many other foes like Iron Valiant if Ogerpon-C has already lost Sturdy. Thus, Pokemon like Choice Scarf Tapu Lele that can threaten these frailer foes make for good allies.

When boosted by the power of Rocky Payload and its Cornerstone Mask, Ogerpon-C is a devastating wallbreaker that's capable of threatening nearly the entire metagame due to the lack of capable Rock-resistant Pokemon. Power Whip is Ogerpon-C's strongest Grass-type attack, OHKOing specially defensive Manaphy and having a good chance to OHKO offensive Great Tusk, while Horn Leech can provide recovery if desired. For the last moveslot, Knock Off has a good chance of OHKOing Gholdengo at +2, Low Kick deals with Hisuian Goodra and Kingambit, and Trailblaze increases Ogerpon-C's effectiveness against faster teams. Other physical wallbreakers like Chien-Pao and Roaring Moon appreciate Ogerpon-C's presence, as together they can overwhelm physical walls such as Corviknight, Skarmory, and Great Tusk. Ogerpon-C's poor defensive typing and average Speed means it appreciates slow, bulky pivots such as Corviknight, RegenVest Swampert, and RegenVest Manaphy to provide it with safe entry onto the field. Its Speed also leaves it prone to getting picked off by faster offensive Pokemon such as Chien-Pao, so speedy teammates such as Barraskewda, Choice Scarf Azelf, and Choice Scarf Roaring Moon are appreciated.

Physically Defensive (Steel).description:
56 Speed EVs lets it outspeed Jolly Azumarill and Kingambit. The given Defensive investments allows Archaludon to live Earthquake from Choice Band Excadrill at full HP and OHKO back with Body Press.

This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

vgc2024.overview:
• Archaludon can utilize its above-average bulk, solid Special Attack stat, and great Ability in Stamina to check and OHKO threats such as Urshifu-R, Incineroar, and Raging Bolt.

  • Archaludon's access to Stamina and Body Press combined with its resistances and great physical bulk make it an amazing check to Pokemon such as Rillaboom and the Ogerpon formes and also allow it to act as a wincon.

  • Archaludon appreciates teammates like Amoonguss and Sinistcha that provide it with recovery through Pollen Puff and Hospitality, as well as Rage Powder for redirection. Rillaboom provides Fake Out support, as well as passive healing through Grassy Terrain and priority with Grassy Glide that discourages the opponent from leading with Urshifu-R. Dual screens from Grimmsnarl and damage reduction from Incineroar's Intimidate or Snarl are also useful for keeping Archaludon alive to stack Stamina or Electro Shot stat increases.

  • Archaludon fits well on rain teams thanks to its Grass and Electric resistances. It appreciates teammates such as Pelipper that can check opposing Ground- and Fighting-types like Landorus and both Urshifu formes; Pelipper's rain support also allows Electro Shot to charge in one turn, OHKOing Urshifu-R and Tornadus. Archaludon also functions well on Trick Room teams due to many of its checks being faster than it, such as both Urshifu formes, Landorus, and Chien-Pao running Sacred Sword. Farigiraf pairs notably well with Archaludon on Trick Room teams due to the protection from priority it provides and its access to Psychic Noise, which disables Iron Hands's Drain Punch.

Rain Sweeper.description:
• Archaludon's Defense EVs allow it to survive Adamant Choice Scarf Urshifu-R's and Urshifu-S's Close Combat, meaning it can take a hit, boost itself with Electro Shot, and OHKO Urshifu-R on the same turn, provided rain is currently active. The Special Defense investment prevents it from being 2HKOed by Special Attack Booster Energy Flutter Mane's Moonblast.

  • Archaludon does not particularly require Special Attack investment thanks to Electro Shot boosting this stat, but 36 Special Attack EVs with a Modest nature give Archaludon an extra point in Special Attack because of how stat calculation works.

  • 28 Speed EVs are to outspeed Choice Scarf Urshifu-R, Urshifu-S and Landorus-T when Archaludon is under Tailwind.

  • Draco Meteor and Electro Shot OHKO Pokemon such as Raging Bolt, Urshifu-R, and Tornadus. Flash Cannon OHKOes Flutter Mane after one Electro Shot boost, and Body Press is good to threaten an OHKO on Chien-Pao, and significant damage on Incineroar, especially after a Stamina boost.

  • Tera Grass gives Archaludon a resistance to Ground-type moves such as Landorus's Sandsear Storm and Earth Power, and immunity to Spore and Rage Powder. Meanwhile, Tera Fairy gives it a Fighting resistance and Dragon immunity to beat Urshifu and opposing Dragon-types respectively.

Rain Wallbreaker.description: Thanks to its great typing, good bulk, and signature move Electro Shot, Archaludon is born to be an excellent wallbreaker on rain teams. The dual STAB moves and Electro Shot are must-haves for Archaludon as a rain wallbreaker; the last slot, however, is a bit flexible. Body Press and Aura Sphere both complement Archaludon's coverage to break through Steel-type Pokemon such as Ferrothorn and Heatran. The former receives a boost from Stamina and deals with Heatran and Ting-Lu better, while the latter is more consistent with Electro Shot boosts in rain and avoids chip damage from Iron Barbs. Stealth Rock can be used as an alternative choice on non-Assault Vest sets to allow teammates like Mega Swampert to run coverage moves like Ice Punch and Ferrothorn to run Spikes. Archaludon can threaten premier entry hazard removers such as Tornadus-T and Landorus-T, ensuring Stealth Rock stays up. Depending on the pacing of the team, different items and EV spreads are available for Archaludon. Leftovers is used to increase its longevity, which helps long-term. Eject Pack can be favored to keep the momentum up by preventing Archaludon from being stuck on the field against pivots such as Galarian Slowking and Assault Vest Iron Crown after its Special Attack is lowered by Draco Meteor. Assault Vest makes up for Archaludon's weak Special Defense and often lets it trade with one or more offensive threats like Tapu Lele and Iron Moth. To pair with Assault Vest, a bulky spread of 204 HP EVs is used, while 52 Speed EVs still allow Archaludon to outspeed uninvested Landorus-T. Tera Flying provides an immunity to Ground-type moves from Landorus-T and Garchomp and a resistance to Fighting-type moves from the likes of Zamazenta. Tera Fairy also grants a resistance to Fighting-type moves and is a better defensive type overall due to only having a few weaknesses as well as not being weak to Stealth Rock. Pelipper is a necessary teammate, as its Drizzle enables Archaludon to take advantage of Electro Shot. Other Water-type wallbreakers such as Mega Swampert and Ogerpon-W are also appreciated for their ability to break through bulky Ground-type Pokemon like Ting-Lu and Gliscor. In return, those Water-type wallbreakers appreciate Archaludon's ability to beat opposing Ogerpon-W.

battlestadiumsingles.overview:
Welcome to Battle Stadium Singles Regulation F! This Pokemon is a new addition from the Indigo Disk that happens to be relevant!

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

Defensive Support.description: This set is currently undergoing proofreading, but is otherwise nearly content complete. If you would like to read the analysis in its current state, click on this link!

Pseudo-Sash.description: This set is currently undergoing proofreading, but is otherwise nearly content complete. If you would like to read the analysis in its current state, click on this link!

Choice Specs.description:
• With a Choice Specs in tow, Archaludon becomes a surprising and powerful wallbreaker that can ruin the days of its usual defensive checks like Ting-Lu!

  • Thunderbolt: Thunderbolt is not only good coverage against Steel-types like Corviknight, but it also 2HKOes Assault Vest Primarina, an otherwise troublsome foe for other offensive Archaludon.

  • Dark Pulse: Dark Pulse 2HKOes bulky Gholdengo, and it even has a shot at OHKOing offensive Gholdengo. It also deals decent damage to uncommon Steel-types that are immune to Thunderbolt like in Excadrill and Iron Treads.

  • Steel Beam: Steel Beam is absurdly powerful, with even bulky Steel-resistant Pokemon like Scizor needing Assault Vest to avoid a 2HKO! This does come at the cost of ruining Sturdy by losing half of Archaludon's health, though.

  • Aura Sphere: While risky to be locked into because of Ghost-types, Aura Sphere deals plenty of damage to Chi-Yu and opposing Archaludon without committing to a Special Attack drop from Draco Meteor.

  • Dragon Pulse: Dragon Pulse is a less risky back-up to Draco Meteor, making the revenge killing of Dragon-types like Dragonite less risky.

  • Sturdy: While Stamina is potentially workable with Archaludon's good bulk, Sturdy is highly recommended for ensuing very few Pokemon can OHKO it without Stealth Rock support, making it far more difficult to check offensively!

  • Modest versus Timid: Modest's extra power is preferred if using Dark Pulse for a potential OHKO on offensive Gholdengo, but Timid is a reasonable consideration for outspeeding Adamant Urshifu formes, Timid Gholdengo, and Jolly Dragonite.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Archaludon focuses so much on offense that Terastallization is best for either dealing more damage or giving it useful immunities.

  • Stellar: Tera Stellar's one-time boost per type makes Archaludon a fearsomely flexible wallbreaker, with even support Landorus-T sets being OHKOed by Draco Meteor and Steel Beam!

  • Flying: Floating with Tera Flying is a strong way to punish attempts to revenge kill Archaludon with Ground-type attacks, with Landorus-T and and Ursaluna-B in particular being ripe targets. The Fighting resistance also comes in handy if Sturdy is broken by a weak attack.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy ruins strong special attacking Dragon-types like Choice Specs Latios, and it makes Archaludon a solid Urshifu-S check even when Sturdy isn't in play.

  • Dragon: Tera Dragon's defensive benefits aren't strong beyond resisting Ogerpon-H's STAB attacks, but a consistently powerful Draco Meteor makes it a good offensive choice.

  • Steel: Tera Steel's Fairy resistance can save Archaludon from revenge kills if a weak attack has broken Sturdy, but its main use is for firing off an extremely powerful Steel Beam twice.

Assault Vest.description:
• This set's write-up has not started yet, but here's some basic info to get you started!

  • Heavy Slam: Despite the Natures, Heavy Slam is a good idea for OHKOing all Flutter Mane except for extremely defensive variants.

  • 252 HP / 180 SpA / 76 SpD with Modest: This spread avoids a OHKO from Modest Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Tera-boosted Moonblast.

  • 252 HP / 52 SpA / 204 SpD with Calm or Modest: This spread with Calm avoids a 2HKO from Timid Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Moonblast, while still letting Draco Meteor deal over 50% to most Ursaluna-B that lack Assault Vest. If surviving Ursaluna-B's Earth Power is the main concern, Archaludon can use a Modest nature instead with this spread.

  • 0 Speed IV: This is used in conjunction with Eject Pack and a Special Attack dropping move to pivot as late as possible, underspeeding Garganacl before it uses Curse in particular.

Dragon Dance.description:
Gouging Fire is a very powerful Dragon Dance sweeper with solid longevity thanks to its bulk and access to reliable recovery. Flare Blitz is a strong STAB move with reliable power; however, Heat Crash can be used instead to avoid recoil damage, though its variable Base Power can sometimes backfire against heavier targets like Great Tusk. Earthquake can be used to hit Fire-resistant targets like Raging Bolt and offer overall solid neutral coverage. For the last slot, Morning Sun grants Gouging Fire longevity, while Dragon Claw hits Dragapult and Roaring Moon hard. Outrage is also an option for more power against Fire-resistant targets such as Toxapex and Dondozo, but the fact that it locks the user into using it and leaves Gouging Fire vulnerable to Fairy- and Steel-types makes it less than ideal. Scale Shot, in conjunction with Loaded Dice, also has more power than Dragon Claw and lets Gouging Fire snowball further by boosting its Speed, but it leaves Gouging Fire vulnerable to entry hazards and doesn't boost its overall damage output unlike Booster Energy. An Adamant nature maximizes Gouging Fire's damage output, but a Jolly nature can be used to outrun the likes of Booster Energy Iron Boulder and Choice Scarf Meowscarada at +2 while avoiding the Speed tie with Dragapult and outrunning Choice Scarf Gholdengo at +1. Heavy-Duty Boots patches up Gouging Fire's crippling hazard weakness, while Booster Energy can also be used to further bolster Gouging Fire's damage output, letting it 2HKO non-defensive Great Tusk with Flare Blitz. Tera Fairy is an overall solid defensive typing that lets Gouging Fire resist Sucker Punch from Kingambit and Dragon-type moves from the likes of Raging Bolt and Kyurem. Tera Ground boosts Earthquake's damage output while giving Gouging Fire an immunity to Thunder Wave. Finally, Tera Flying is also an option, as it gives Gouging Fire an immunity to Ground-type moves, letting it dent Excadrill and Great Tusk more easily.

Gouging Fire's potential as a powerful Dragon Dance sweeper means that it makes its home on offensive teams. Booster Energy sets have a glaring weakness to entry hazards, so they appreciate removal from Great Tusk as well as hazard deterrents such as Magic Bounce Hatterene and Taunt Deoxys-S. Deoxys-S is also able to set up Spikes and/or dual screens, giving Gouging Fire an easier time sweeping. Additionally, Gouging Fire makes an excellent addition to sun teams. On such teams, it appreciates wallbreakers like Venusaur, Raging Bolt, and Walking Wake that can muscle through its checks and break through physical walls that Gouging Fire struggles with such as Dondozo and Skeledirge. On non-sun teams, Pokemon that can break through the aforementioned walls, such as Darkrai and Enamorus, are appreciated, as are Pokemon that can lure physical walls in before denting them, such as Grass Knot Landorus-T. Gouging Fire can chip away at bulkier Pokemon such as Gliscor and defensive Landorus-T early-game, so Pokemon that share checks with it, such as Kingambit and offensive Great Tusk, appreciate it as a partner.

Offensive Dragon Dance.description: Gouging Fire is a devastating wallbreaker and setup sweeper alike that can tear through teams easily. Earthquake allows Gouging Fire to break past Toxapex and Heatran, which would otherwise be able to wall it. Morning Sun gives Gouging Fire the ability to heal off any chip damage from priority or Rocky Helmet, making it even more difficult to take down for defensive teams. Outrage can be used as a nuke with Dragonium Z, letting Gouging Fire muscle past walls such as Dondozo through its sheer strength alone. Tera Ground can be used to power up Gouging Fire's Earthquake while allowing it to remove its weaknesses to revenge killers such as Booster Energy Iron Boulder and Great Tusk, allowing it to potentially win on the spot. Heavy-Duty Boots allows Gouging Fire to come in many times and attempt to set up, while Booster Energy gives Gouging Fire a one-time Attack boost that can be crucial in breaking past foes such as Great Tusk and Landorus-T while still allowing Gouging Fire to Terastallize. Teammates that struggle with Steel-types, like Tapu Lele and Pecharunt, appreciate Gouging Fire breaking through those Steel-types. In return, they dispatch the physical walls that trouble Gouging Fire, such as Dondozo. Gouging Fire is often prone to getting revenge killed by Pokemon such as Iron Boulder and Choice Scarf Tapu Lele, so teammates that can deal with the aforementioned threats, like Mega Scizor and Landorus-T, are appreciated.

Bulky Dragon Dance.description: Gouging Fire is a great setup sweeper that utilizes its good bulk, solid defensive typing, and Terastallization to exploit common Pokemon like Mega Charizard Y, Volcarona, Mega Scizor, and Alomomola and break through teams efficiently. Flare Blitz is reliable STAB into Pokemon like Zamazenta and Great Tusk; however, Heat Crash can be used for its lack of recoil, though its variable Base Power makes it harder to break through the aforementioned Pokemon. Earthquake lets Gouging Fire hit Heatran, Raging Bolt, and Toxapex. Morning Sun provides reliable recovery, letting Gouging Fire maintain a sweep, check Pokemon like Mega Charizard Y and Iron Valiant long term, and offset Flare Blitz recoil. The given EV spread lets Gouging Fire take Scorching Sands twice at full HP from Mega Charizard Y and outspeed Tornadus-T at +1. Tera Steel turns would-be checks to Gouging Fire like Alomomola and Raging Bolt into setup fodder while also providing a Toxic immunity. Teammates like Ogerpon-W and Tapu Lele that struggle against Steel-types like Kartana and Mega Scizor appreciate Gouging Fire checking and setting up on them. Gouging Fire also provides a good matchup into sun teams, which offensive teammates like Mega Lopunny and Kartana appreciate as well. In return, the latter threatens Water-types like Alomomola and other Pokemon that check Gouging Fire like Ting-Lu and Great Tusk.

Choice Band.description: Choice Band Gouging Fire is a potent wallbreaker and cleaner commonly found on sun teams. Under sun, Tera Fire makes Heat Crash a very powerful and spammable move. Flare Blitz allows Gouging Fire to hit heavier Pokemon that Gouging Fire can't hit as hard with Heat Crash, like Great Tusk and Ting-Lu. Raging Fury is an alternative option to this, as it is not a contact move and does not deal recoil damage. 168 Attack EVs and a Jolly Nature allow it to gain a Speed boost under sun with Protosynthesis. Even with this combination, Gouging Fire is still stopped by heavier foes that are also very physically bulky, such as Garganacl, Great Tusk and Dondozo. Choice Band Gouging Fire is also very prone to entry hazard chip, as it does not hold Heavy-Duty Boots. Because of these reasons, Gouging Fire largely appreciates hazard removal options like Great Tusk and Iron Treads that also synergize well with sun setters, which are Torkoal and Mega Charizard Y. Great Tusk is great under sun as it can be a good wallbreaking partner with an Attack Protosynthesis boost. Great Tusk is also able to help wallbreak against some other Fire-resistant foes, such as Garganacl, chipped Alomomola, and opposing Great Tusk. Iron Treads , on the other hand, has Volt Switch to bring Gouging Fire in safely. Gouging Fire also greatly appreciates Pokemon that can threaten Alomomola and Dondozo on their weaker Special Defense side, like Raging Bolt and Mega Charizard Y. Raging Bolt can threaten Gouging Fire's common switch-ins like Dondozo and Alomomola with powerful Special attacks and super effective STAB moves and also use Volt Switch to bring Gouging Fire in very easily. Gouging Fire also supports Raging Bolt by threatening the Ground-types and Electric-resistant foes that can switch into it, such as Gliscor, Ferrothorn, Landorus-T. Mega Charizard Y is one of Gouging Fire's best partners, as it sets up sun with Drought, allowing Gouging Fire to boost its Speed with Protosynthesis, and can also break holes into opposing teams with Solar Beam and powerful Fire-type moves.

monotype.comments:
Other Options

Dragon

Dragon Claw may be used instead of Earthquake to threaten Dragon-types like Roaring Moon, Garchomp, and Latias; however, Gouging Fire will be walled by the aforementioned targets of Earthquake—especially Heatran.

Dragon Dance (Fire).description: This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

Bulky Dragon Dance (Dragon).description:
Gouging Fire is a staple on Dragon teams due to its excellent bulk, neutrality to Fairy and Ice, and snowball potential, performing great in threatening matchups like Fairy, Ice, and Steel. Flare Blitz targets menacing Pokemon like Flutter Mane, Chien-Pao, and Skarmory. Earthquake hits Pokemon resistant to Flare Blitz such as Toxapex, Heatran, and Glimmora. Morning Sun increases Gouging Fire's longevity and improves its setup ability. The specially defensive EV spread ensures that Gouging Fire outpaces Chien-Pao and Flutter Mane after a Dragon Dance, as well as makes Ice Beam from Choice Specs Greninja a 2HKO. Alternatively, the physically defensive EV spread ensures Choice Band Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash doesn't 2HKO Gouging Fire, and it also outspeeds Choice Specs Latios after a Dragon Dance.

Baxcalibur is a great teammate due to its ability to threaten Ground-types, such as Landorus-T, Hippowdon, and Ursaluna-B, while also being crucial in the Dragon matchup—if Gouging Fire opts for Morning Sun. In exchange, Gouging Fire offers a Fairy neutrality and an answer to Skarmory and Air Balloon Gholdengo. Archaludon offers utility options like Stealth Rock and Thunder Wave to ease Gouging Fire's sweeping, as well as acting as a resistance to Dragon and Rock, taking on Roaring Moon and Iron Boulder. Choice Scarf Roaring Moon threatens fast Dragon-types such as Latias and Dragonite at +1 Speed, when Multiscale is broken, and appreciates Gouging Fire removing Steel-types. Dragapult can spread status ailments like Thunder Wave and Will-O-Wisp, breaks physical walls like Slowbro, Mandibuzz, and Rotom-W using Choice Specs, and removes Pokemon like Choice Scarf Latias and Roaring Moon with a Choice Scarf set. In return, Dragapult appreciates Gouging Fire's ability to remove Hisuian Goodra, Clodsire, and Alolan Muk, while Dragon Dance sets value the Will-O-Wisp immunity. Garchomp sets up entry hazards to wear down Pokemon like Primarina and Ting-Lu and heavily dents teams with its Swords Dance set to allow Gouging Fire to clean late-game. Choice Scarf Latias provides a Ground immunity and removes threats like Great Tusk and Kommo-o, as well as offers cleric support via Healing Wish to give Gouging Fire new life when weakened or inflicted by status. Raging Bolt breaks Water-types, such as Primarina and Toxapex, and heavily damages Ground-types like Hippowdon, Gastrodon, and Gliscor after a Calm Mind. Hisuian Goodra is an excellent teammate for physically defensive Gouging Fire, as it stomachs hits from Latias, Choice Specs Dragapult, and Flutter Mane. Wallbreakers like Hydreigon and Choice Specs Latios remove Archaludon, Toxapex, and Slowbro. In return, Gouging Fire can combat threats such as Iron Valiant, Mimikyu, and Enamorus. Dragalge provides Toxic Spikes to put switch-ins like Ting-Lu and Great Tusk on a timer, as well as offers a secondary check to Fairy-types.

vgc2024.overview:
• Gouging Fire is a solid offensive support Pokemon with a good defensive typing. Breaking Swipe and Burning Bulwark give it a great matchup against physical attackers such as Rillaboom and Chien-Pao.

  • Kingambit is one of the most prominent partners for Gouging Fire, because it prevents Incineroar from crippling Gouging Fire with Intimidate. Ogerpon-W fits well with Gouging Fire as well, as with Follow Me it can protect Gouging Fire from Ground- and Water-type moves, both of which Ogerpon-W resists.

  • The Urshifu formes counter Gouging Fire, since they ignore Burning Bulwark and Breaking Swipe. Incineroar is also a good counter to Gouging Fire, cycling Intimidate and Parting Shot repeatedly until Gouging Fire is a sitting duck. Gouging Fire also struggles against special attackers like Flutter Mane and Landorus, which can hit it for big damage, the latter threatening it for an OHKO.

Offensive Support.description:
• Heat Crash is a reliable way of dealing damage, and because Gouging Fire is so heavy, it will almost always do good damage against most of the metagame. Howl can be used to take advantage of passive playstyles and partially negate Intimidate, and with a Speed Booster Energy, it can support the Kingambit and Ogerpon-W in return.

  • 252 HP and 20 Defense EVs allow you to always live two Wicked Blows from Adamant Urshifu-S, and 164 Speed EVs with a Jolly Nature allow you to and outspeed Adamant Choice Scarf Landorus-T and Chien-Pao once the Booster Energy has been consumed.

  • Tera Grass is a good defensive Tera type for Gouging Fire, as it lets Gouging Fire resist Ground-type moves like Landorus's Earth Power and makes it immune to Spore, which is crucial since Burning Bulwark doesn't Protect Gouging Fire from status moves. Tera Fairy is also a good option as well, as it lets Gouging Fire resist both of Urshifu-S's STAB moves and take neutral damage from the majority of the metagame.

Calm Mind.description:
Raging Bolt is one of OU's fiercest offensive OU threats thanks to good bulk, a great Special Attack stat, and fantastic priority in Thunderclap allowing it to act both as a wallbreaker and sweeper while additionally threatening potent revenge killers. Raging Bolt threatens common metagame walls such as Skarmory, Dondozo, and Toxapex with its Electric-type STAB. Calm Mind allows Raging Bolt to gain a boost against walls like Heatran and Ting-Lu while also avoiding being OHKOed from threats like Kyurem, Iron Valiant, and Enamorus. Thunderclap lets Raging Bolt threaten Pokemon like Hisuian Samurott, Enamorus, and Iron Valiant. Dragon Pulse is preferred due to its higher PP and lack of a drawback, although Draco Meteor can be used for immediate breaking power and the ability to OHKO neutral threats such as Zamazenta and Rillaboom. Weather Ball can be used over Thunderbolt if Raging Bolt is used on a weather team, but it has to forgo reliable Electric-type STAB move. In rain, Weather Ball allows Raging Bolt to threaten Ground-types like Gliscor and Great Tusk, while under sun, Raging Bolt can hit Fire-types that resist its Dragon-type STAB move. The given EV spread is used to live Speed-boosting Great Tusk's Headlong Rush, as well as outspeeding Gliscor. Leftovers is preferred for longevity, but Booster Energy in conjunction with Protosynthesis can be used to threaten unboosted Gouging Fire and Dragonite. Tera Fairy is recommended to flip matchups on Dragon-type threats such as the aforementioned Gouging Fire and Dragonite, as well as Walking Wake and Dragapult, by evading their super effective Dragon-type attacks. Tera Flying is the final option, providing Raging Bolt an immunity to Ground-type attacks from Excadrill, Gliscor, and Ting-Lu.

Raging Bolt fits well on rain, sun, hyper and bulky offense teams due to hits good bulk and Special Attack, so weather setters such as Torkoal and Pelipper are ideal. Raging Bolt is also a good partner for physical wallbreakers like Iron Boulder and Gouging Fire, as they both enjoy Raging Bolt's ability to threaten Dondozo, while Rillaboom and Meowscarada appreciate Raging Bolt's ability to threaten Skarmory and Corviknight. Raging Bolt is threatened by faster Ground-types like Excadrill, Landorus-T, and Great Tusk due to being unable to hit them with Thunderclap. Therefore, Rillaboom is a great teammate, as it provides another form of speed control in Grassy Glide as well as Grassy Terrain recovery, which also halves the damage of Earthquake. On weather teams however, there are a multitude of ways to deal with the aforementioned Ground-types. On sun teams, Torkoal and Walking Wake are beneficial, while on rain teams, Barraskweda and Pelipper are good teammates. Walking Wake, Barraskewda, and Pelipper deal with Ground-types, while Torkoal helps Raging Bolt activate Protosynthesis. Raging Bolt also has a poor Speed tier, so speed control options such as Darkrai, Iron Valiant, and Weavile are good teammates, threatening Raging Bolt's common Dragon-type checks like Dragapult and Kyurem. Raging Bolt also fears entry hazards, as they can break down its defensive profile, especially if it forgoes Leftovers. Therefore, hazard control from Pokemon such as Great Tusk, Hatterene, and Corviknight is appreciated.

132 Speed EVs outspeeds Jolly Kingambit

This is the sample set before we work on new analyses. This will be updated as the metagame continues to develop. Stay tuned!

vgc2024.overview:
• Raging Bolt, with a higher Special Attack than Flutter Mane, massive HP, and good defenses, serves its role as a bulky damage dealer exceptionally well.

  • Don't let Raging Bolt's middling Speed fool you; it's signature move, Thunderclap, makes sure that isn't an issue in a lot of situations, making the Tornadus + Urshifu-R matchup virtually trivial.

  • Raging Bolt pairs insanely well with Rillaboom and Incineroar, providing Fake Out pressure for Raging Bolt to either setup with the Calm Mind set or deal massive damage with the 3 Attacks set. Rillaboom also provides more longevity in Grassy Terrain for Raging Bolt, which can make it immensely difficult to KO. Chien-Pao and Choice Scarf Urshifu-R are also excellent partners at dealing with Raging Bolt's worst matchup, Landorus.

  • That said, Raging Bolt does still have bad matchups despite its strengths, one of which is the aforementioned Landorus, due to it being able to threaten OHKOs against Raging Bolt with Earth Power. Chien-Pao can also be a tricky matchup, as it can deal massive damage with Ice Spinner or Icicle Crash and cause mindgames with Sucker Punch and Thunderclap. Flutter Mane is able to deal huge damage to Raging Bolt even when it Terastallizes, and can very comfortably take unboosted Thunderclaps.

3 Attacks.description:
• Thunderbolt is there for good consistent damage, especially with Tera Electric with Magnet, while Thunderclap helps make up for Raging Bolt's middling Speed. Draco Meteor is a more powerful option, being able to OHKO Pokémon like Landorus when used with Booster Energy. However, it can be forced to switch out and lose the boost when using Booster Energy.

  • Magnet is the most consistent item option, especially when paired with Tera Electric, drastically increasing Raging Bolt's damage. Booster Energy is another option, as it not only boosts its Electric-type moves, but it also boosts Draco Meteor. Safety Goggles prevents Amoonguss from redirecting Thunderclaps away from Urshifu-R.

  • The Speed investment allows Raging Bolt to outspeed Dragapult, Flutter Mane, and Chien-Pao while under Tailwind, allowing it to hit them with its stronger options like Thunderbolt and Draco Meteor. The HP is optimized for Life Orb chip if used.

  • Tera Electric will often be the strongest and most consistent option. Tera Grass is a good option to not only resist Ground-type moves from Landorus, but also if you want to ignore Amoonguss' Spore and redirection with Rage Powder without running Safety Goggles. Finally, Tera Fairy is just a strong neutral Tera type to pair with such amazing bulk.

Calm Mind.description:
• Thunderclap is a good main STAB move, as it allows Raging Bolt to focus less on Speed and go all out on bulk investment, as it will be able to boost up then hit most foes before they can retaliate.

  • While Dragon Pulse is usually an underwhelming move, it serves as a strong neutral STAB move into Pokemon that resist Electric-type attacks when paired with Calm Mind.

  • In some situations, Thunderbolt can be used over Protect, due to Raging Bolt being bulky enough to where Protect isn't mandatory on Calm Mind sets, and for consistency against support Pokémon such as Follow Me Ogerpon-W where Thunderclap would fail.

  • Leftovers is preferred over Booster Energy on the Calm Mind set, providing immense longevity with Grassy Terrain from Rillaboom. However, Booster Energy can be used if you need that extra damage, as the Special Attack boost changes many calculations, for example, being able to OHKO bulky Flutter Mane at +1 with Helping Hand and Protosynthesis where you'd be unable to without Booster Energy.

  • The Defense EVs with the HP EVs allow Raging Bolt to live Icicle Crash from Adamant Chien-Pao. The HP EVs make the HP optimized for Leftovers and Grassy Terrain recovery. The bulk investment ensures that Raging Bolt is able to tank 2 unboosted Moonblasts from Timid Flutter Mane at +1 Special Defense after Leftovers and Grassy Terrain recovery combined with Protect. The Special Defense EVs hit an even number to be optimal for the Calm Mind boost.

  • Tera Grass lets Raging Bolt resist Ground-type moves and provides an immunity to Spore and Rage Powder, so Thunderclap can't be redirected away from Urshifu-R.

With access to Calm Mind and a stellar base 137 Special Attack, Raging Bolt is able to act as an excellent bulky setup sweeper. Raging Bolt’s good typing allows it to break through defensive Pokemon like Corviknight and bulky Water-types like Alomomola, Toxapex, and Rotom-W while also checking threats like Rillaboom, Ogerpon-W, and Kartana. Thunderclap offsets Raging Bolt’s subpar Speed stat, allowing it to revenge kill offensive threats such as Urshifu-R, Ogerpon-W, and Mega Lopunny as well as weakened setup sweepers like Iron Boulder, Volcarona, and Swords Dance Kartana, while Thunderbolt gives Raging Bolt a consistent damaging attack that doesn’t rely on prediction like Thunderclap and has significantly higher PP, allowing Raging Bolt to use its Electric-type moves in longer games. Substitute is an alternative to nullify passive Pokémon that can’t touch Raging Bolt such as Rotom-W, Ferrothorn, and Zapdos and give it more opportunities to set up, while Taunt can be used to deny setup from Garganacl and Mega Scizor but at the cost of a worse matchup against Galarian Slowking. Draco Meteor in tandem with Dragonium Z lets it break through Electric-immune Pokemon such as Gliscor, Clodsire, and Ting-Lu as well as other specially bulky Pokémon that can take on Raging Bolt such as Mega Tyranitar and Galarian Slowking. Alternatively, Leftovers is also an option on Substitute sets to passively heal the chip taken from Substitute and give Raging Bolt some form of recovery. Tera Flying grants Raging Bolt a Ground immunity while giving a Fighting resistance that helps against Great Tusk and Zamazenta while also avoiding any Ground-type coverage from Serperior. Tera Fairy gives this same Fighting resistance while giving Raging Bolt an immunity to Dragon-type moves from the likes of Garchomp and Gouging Fire. The given EV spread allows Raging Bolt to live a +2 Superpower from Ogerpon-W after Stealth Rock, as well as outspeeding uninvested Landorus-T. Raging Bolt struggles against fast Ground- and Fairy-types like Garchomp, Choice Scarf Landorus-T, Great Tusk, Tapu Koko, Iron Valiant, and especially Tapu Lele; Tapu Lele in particular can give Raging Bolt some trouble as well, as its Psychic Surge renders Thunderclap useless. Teammates like Mega Scizor, Ferrothorn, Rillaboom, and Galarian Slowking help beat these checks. Since Raging Bolt has no reliable recovery, Alomomola is a good partner to pass huge HP wishes to it and pivot it in. Other pivots like Tornadus-T, Mega Scizor, and Landorus-T also help bring Raging Bolt in safely. Teammates like Great Tusk and Zamazenta appreciate Raging Bolt taking care of Flying-types like Tornadus-T and Zapdos as well as bulky Waters like Rotom-W and Alomomola. In return, they help check Ferrothorn and Weavile. Great Tusk is another good partner, because it helps remove entry hazards, which harm Raging Bolt greatly, particularly Spikes.

• This set's write-up has not started yet, but here's some basic info to get you started!

  • 140 HP / 180 Def / 44 SpA / 140 SpD / 4 Spe: This spread survives Annihilape's Final Gambit, Adamant Landorus-T's Earthquake, and Adamant Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash. It also OHKOes offensive Urshifu-R with Thunderclap and survives Timid Flutter Mane's Moonblast after Stealth Rock damage.

  • 4 HP / 36 Def / 252 SpA / 172 SpD / 44 Spe: This lets Sitrus Berry Raging Bolt avoid a 2HKO from Timid Flutter Mane's Moonblast after Raging Bolt boosts with Calm Mind. Terastallized Raging Bolt also avoids a 2HKO from Adamant Focus Sash Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash even when not resisting it. The Speed EVs outspeed minimum speed Dragonite.

  • Speed and Special Attack EVs can optionally be maxed out to outspeed Adamant Breloom and many Dragonite sets.

Offensive.description:
• This set's write-up has not started yet, but here's some basic info to get you started!

  • 140 HP / 236 SpA / 132 SpD: The given EVs allow Assault Vest Terastallized Raging Bolt to avoid a 2HKO from Timid Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Moonblast after Stealth Rock damage, as well as Annihilape's Final Gambit.

  • 148 HP / 156 Def / 204 SpA: This survives both Adamant Landorus-T's Earthquake and Adamant Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash on all but the highest roll of damage, and OHKOes offensive Flutter Mane with +2 Thunderbolt.

Other Options

  • Heavy Slam: Heavy Slam is a way to get offensive Flutter Mane into Thunderclap's KO range if not using Tera Electric.
• 68 Speed EVs can be used to outspeed Flutter Mane in Tailwind.

Calm Mind.description: • This EV Spread survives a Life Orb Ice Spinner from Chien-Pao.

Swords Dance.description:
Swords Dance Iron Boulder is one of the most potent setup sweepers in the current metagame as well as one of the most effective forms of speed control, outspeeding the likes of Booster Energy Iron Valiant and +1 Roaring Moon. Close Combat hits targets such as Archaludon, Kingambit, and Ting-Lu. Alternatively, Earthquake can be used over Close Combat, forgoing the Ting-Lu matchup for a better matchup into non-Air Balloon Gholdengo. These moves can be run in conjunction with each other, but in that case Iron Boulder has difficult matchups against Great Tusk and Zamazenta. Zen Headbutt can be used to improve these matchups as well as provide a reliable means of revenge killing Booster Energy Iron Valiant, again in exchange for the Gholdengo matchup. Substitute is also a viable option, and it can be used to ease Iron Boulder's matchup versus Sucker Punch from Kingambit, as well as allowing it to avoid Thunder Wave from Galarian Slowking as it sets up. Given a free turn to set it up, Substitute can also allow Iron Boulder to avoid being revenge killed by priority, such as Rillaboom's Grassy Glide and Kingambit's Sucker Punch. However, its main use case is with Tera, as Substitute + Tera Flying allows Iron Boulder to circumvent Gliscor (which otherwise would be a solid check) and turn it into setup fodder by avoiding both Toxic and Earthquake. Tera Fighting boosts the power of Close Combat, notably helping Iron Boulder brute force its way past Skarmory, while also allowing it to OHKO Ting-Lu after a Swords Dance. It also provides a Sucker Punch resistance, which helps versus Kingambit. Tera Ground can be used to boost the power of Earthquake, guaranteeing the OHKO on bulkier variants of Gholdengo at +2 as well as helping Iron Boulder avoid being picked off by Raging Bolt's Thunderclap. Tera Flying not only lets Iron Boulder wall Gliscor in combination with Substitute but also grants it a resistance to Rillaboom's Grassy Glide and facilitates setup opportunities versus other Ground-types like Great Tusk and Landorus-T.

Iron Boulder's power and its top-tier speed, alongside its good coverage and access to Swords Dance, make it very suitable for hyper offense teams. Teammates such as Kingambit appreciate the weakening of shared checks such as Landorus-T and Skarmory. The same goes for Iron Moth but with Ting-Lu and Gliscor. Iron Valiant also appreciates Gliscor being weakened and can whittle down shared checks such as Gholdengo to make it easier for Iron Boulder to sweep later. Iron Boulder struggles with entry hazard damage putting it in KO range of priority moves such as Kingambit’s Sucker Punch and Rillaboom’s Grassy Glide after Tera. Teammates that are effective at keeping hazards off your side such as Taunt Deoxys-S, Glimmora, Hatterene, or Great Tusk are good partners. The first two also provide their own hazards, facilitating the weakening of Iron Boulder's checks. Iron Boulder also has difficulty overcoming Dondozo. Partners that can weaken it or take advantage of it, such as Taunt Roaring Moon or Ogerpon-W, respectively, are good partners. Volcarona is also a good partner, as it takes advantage of Iron Boulder checks such as Skarmory, Gholdengo, and Rillaboom and turns them into setup fodder.

Iron Boulder is an excellent late-game cleaner, with Swords Dance allowing it to sweep and its good Speed stat and Booster Energy letting it outspeed the entire unboosted metagame including most Choice Scarf users. It has access to a strong STAB move in Mighty Cleave that bypasses Protect, which can be useful against a weakened Gliscor. Close Combat has great coverage alongside Mighty Cleave and hits Pokemon like Ferrothorn, Garganacl, Mega Lopunny, and Mega Tyranitar for massive damage, being able to OHKO all of them at +2 Attack with Tera Fighting. Zen Headbutt hits Zamazenta, Great Tusk, and Urshifu-R. Substitute allows Iron Boulder to scout for switches, as well as become immune to certain status moves like Thunder Wave and Will-O-Wisp. Iron Boulder can use Tera Flying to become immune to Earthquake that would otherwise OHKO it from Ground-types like Landorus-T, Gliscor, Garchomp, and Great Tusk. If your team has Tapu Koko to provide Electric Terrain, one option is to use Rockium Z over Booster Energy to power up Mighty Cleave to insane levels, OHKOing Gliscor and all but the bulkiest Landorus-T with Stealth Rock support after a Swords Dance. However, this option does make Iron Boulder dependent on Electric Terrain to retain its boosted Speed. Tapu Koko can also set up Reflect and Light Screen to help facilitate a sweep. Iron Boulder fits best on highly offensive teams, and functions as a late-game cleaner as well as a emergency check to speedy threats including Dragon Dance users like Gouging Fire and Booster Energy Iron Valiant. Fighting-types like Great Tusk, Mega Lopunny, and Urshifu-R benefit from having Iron Boulder on the team, as Iron Boulder can take advantage of and switch into Flying-types such as Zapdos and Tornadus-T that such allies are weak to. Teammates such as Hawlucha, Kartana and Iron Valiant can appreciate Rockium Z Iron Boulder's massive damage onto Landorus-T and Gliscor. Non-Rockium Z Iron Boulder can struggle with Ground-types like Landorus-T, Gliscor, Garchomp, and Great Tusk. Because of this, having a switch-in like your own Landorus-T or Gliscor is very helpful. Additionally, Iron Boulder can be revenge killed by Mega Scizor's Bullet Punch, so having answers to it like Volcarona and Gouging Fire is important. Iron Boulder appreciates hazard support from Pokemon like Great Tusk, Landorus-T, and Glimmora, as it can chip checks that would otherwise just fall short of a KO. Furthermore, physical wallbreakers such as Kartana and Mega Lopunny that can put Landorus-T and Gliscor in range of a +2 Mighty Cleave are also appreciated, especially since Gliscor can’t use Protect to heal with Poison Heal against Mighty Cleave, and Landorus-T doesn't have any reliable recovery. Finally, Pokemon such as Mega Medicham and Volcarona that can break through foes like Alomomola, Gliscor, Landorus-T, and Mega Scizor are also greatly appreciated.

monotype.comments:
Other Options

Psychic

Iron Head can be run in order to hit Fairy-types such as Choice Scarf Iron Valiant and Clefable as well as prevent Aurora Veil being set up for Ice teams by threatening Alolan Ninetales, but it doesn't do too much outside of that matchup. It also guarantees an OHKO on Flutter Mane, which Mighty Cleave does not do.

Choice Scarf (Psychic).description:
Iron Boulder is a good Choice Scarf user on Psychic teams thanks to its great Speed tier, allowing it to outspeed other threatening Choice Scarf users like Roaring Moon, Meowscarada, and Hisuian Samurott and threaten them with its respectable power and colorful coverage options. Mighty Cleave is Iron Boulder's main STAB move, allowing it to revenge kill common threats such as Chien-Pao, Choice Specs Flutter Mane after Stealth Rock damage, and Gouging Fire. Megahorn can be run on this set over Zen Headbutt in order to hit Hoopa-U, Slowbro, and Ogerpon-W. Earthquake provides valuable coverage against Steel-types immune to Close Combat such as non-Air Balloon Gholdengo and Heatran, as well as Poison-types immune to Zen Headbutt like Alolan Muk. Finally, Close Combat allows Iron Boulder to threaten Dark-types such as Greninja and Chien-Pao as well as hit most Steel-types for good damage. It also targets major annoyances for Psychic teams such as Blissey and Hisuian Goodra.

Latios is a great teammate for Iron Boulder, as it provides a Ground immunity with Levitate and breaks through threats such as Corviknight and Gliscor with Thunderbolt and Luster Purge. It can also pivot Iron Boulder into threats that it cannot break down on its own, such as Dark-types like Ting-Lu and Kingambit, with Flip Turn. Indeedee is another good pick alongside Iron Boulder, as it offers a Ghost immunity to take on Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Shadow Ball as well as Psychic Terrain support, preventing Iron Boulder from being revenge killed by priority moves such as Sucker Punch from Kingambit or Aqua Jet from Urshifu-R. Indeedee also provides Healing Wish support to let Iron Boulder clean up weakened teams late-game. Hoopa-U is a dangerous wallbreaker that appreciates Iron Boulder giving it speed control. In return, it can take on Ghost-type attacks such as Choice Scarf Flutter Mane's Shadow Ball pretty handily thanks to its decent Special Defense, while threatening those Ghost-types in return. It can also break through defensive cores Iron Boulder can struggle to beat, such as Corviknight and Landorus-T on Flying or Air Balloon Gholdengo and Corviknight on Steel. Deoxys-S can either soften up opposing teams with its entry hazard support or become a fearsome wallbreaker with Expanding Force while in Psychic Terrain, while threatening Corviknight and Gliscor with Thunderbolt and Ice Beam, respectively. Slowbro is a great physical wall, being able to swallow physical attacks aimed at Iron Boulder like Earthquake from Excadrill and Liquidation from Barraskewda. Slowbro can also serve as a pseudo-check to Ceruledge if it has used its Eject Button, which can give a safe switch-in opportunity for Iron Boulder to take advantage of. Finally, Slowbro can deal with some Dark-types like Ting-Lu one on one with Body Press. Both Metagross and Jirachi can set Stealth Rock to soften up answers to Iron Boulder like Corviknight and Gliscor, and both have other advantages: Metagross has Knock Off to further weaken defensive checks and Bullet Punch to threaten Flutter Mane, while Jirachi can pivot Iron Boulder onto the field with U-turn. Espathra is a good setup sweeper that appreciates Iron Boulder chipping its answers into range of Dazzling Gleam while being able to run away with games once its checks, such as Ting-Lu, are gone. Hatterene prevents Iron Boulder from having to take chip damage from hazards when it has to revenge kill a threat while doing fairly well into the majority of Dark-types thanks to its part-Fairy typing.

Choice Scarf (Rock).description:
Iron Boulder is an amazing Choice Scarf user on Rock teams due to its amazing Speed tier and part-Psychic typing, which gives it a key role in the Fighting matchup. Choice Scarf Iron Boulder outspeeds and OHKOes common Choice Scarf users like Sneasler, Meowscarada, and Enamorus; it also outspeeds Regieleki, which can be an issue for Rock teams. Mighty Cleave allows Iron Boulder to take out Choice Scarf Enamorus after Stealth Rock, Ogerpon-H, and non-Sucker Punch Chien-Pao. Zen Headbutt lets Iron Boulder deal with Fighting- and Poison-types like Iron Valiant and Sneasler. Earthquake deals with Heatran, Alolan Muk, and Gholdengo, while Close Combat OHKOes Greninja, Meowscarada, and Roaring Moon.

Choice Band Hisuian Arcanine can act as a wallbreaker for Iron Boulder, being able to take on physical walls such as Toxapex, Corviknight, and defensive Gholdengo with Head Smash and Flare Blitz. Hisuian Arcanine can also run a Heavy-Duty Boots set with Will-O-Wisp to annoy Kingambit. Swords Dance Ogerpon-C is an excellent partner, being able to handle Ground- and Water-types such as Mamoswine, Quagsire, and Keldeo. Glimmora is a nice special attacker that deals with walls Iron Boulder can't break through, like Quagsire and Sableye, with its colorful coverage. Glimmora's Toxic Debris comes in handy in the Fairy matchup as well, and it even removes entry hazards with Mortal Spin. Shell Smash Minior can act as a setup sweeper, being able to dent holes in Great Tusk, Zamazenta, and Iron Hands so that Iron Boulder can pick them off late-game; providing a Ground immunity for the team is also much appreciated. Kleavor can set up Stealth Rock with Stone Axe, breaking Focus Sashes on common users like Ceruledge and Cloyster. Terrakion can take out Ursaluna-B, Kingambit, Archaludon, and Hisuian Goodra for Iron Boulder. Ghost-types like Dragapult, Spectrier, and Choice Scarf Flutter Mane hurt Iron Boulder's chances of sweeping, so Tyranitar serves as a great partner by checking them and providing sand to boost the team's Special Defense. Coalossal is a good partner, being able to check threats like Scizor, Corviknight, and Kingambit, which would threaten Iron Boulder. Coalossal also removes hazards and can set up its own hazards to ease Iron Boulder's sweeping. In return, Iron Boulder takes out Sneasler, Greninja, and Meowscarada for Tyranitar and Coalossal. IronPress Garganacl can act as a stallbreaker for the team, wearing down defensive Water- and Steel-types such as Gastrodon and Corviknight.

Choice Band.description: Choice Band Iron Boulder is one of the best single-button clickers imaginable; honestly, the other moves are mostly decorative. Sharpness- and Choice Band-boosted Mighty Cleave has excellent power and coverage, notably 2HKOing Unaware Deoxys-D and OHKOing most slower offensive Pokemon like Galarian Zapdos and Roaring Moon. Psycho Cut covers important targets like Great Tusk, Iron Hands, and Swampert, while Throat Chop reliably beats Gholdengo, and Sacred Sword beats Iron Treads and Hisuian Goodra. Iron Boulder has an awful defensive typing and greatly appreciates being brought in by slow pivots like Manaphy and Corviknight; thanks to its great Speed tier, it can usually force out the wallbreakers that come in on them in return. Iron Boulder also pairs well with other physically offensive threats like Barraskewda and Garchomp that can wear down opposing walls like Intimidate Corviknight with it. Fluffy walls such as Corviknight and Deoxys-D are extremely difficult for Iron Boulder to break past, so a strong Fire-type like Iron Moth or Ceruledge makes an excellent teammate.

Swords Dance.description: With an amazing Speed stat and great STAB moves, Iron Boulder stands out as one of the tier's strongest wallbreakers. Swords Dance lets it tear through some of the tier's most common physical walls including Great Tusk, Deoxys-D, and non-Fluffy Corviknight. Iron Boulder has plenty of options as a last move: Sacred Sword helps deal with Steel-types like Hisuian Goodra, Kingambit, and Iron Treads; Throat Chop notably hits Gholdengo; and Earthquake acts as a midground option, hitting the aformentioned Sacred Sword targets and non-Earth Eater Gholdengo at the cost of not getting boosted by Sharpness. Iron Boulder appreciates offensive pivots like Barraskewda and Choice Scarf Roaring Moon, as they're able to clean up after it has weakened the physical walls. Iron Boulder also appreciates defensive pivots like Corviknight and Swampert, as they can bring it in safely. Despite its amazing Speed stat, it's still prone to getting revenge killed by faster targets like Chien-Pao, Hisuian Electrode, and Choice Scarf Roaring Moon, making defensive walls like Corviknight, Meloetta, and Great Tusk necessary. Iron Boulder lacks damage without a boost from Swords Dance, so entry hazard setters like Deoxys-D, Sandy Shocks, and Skarmory are greatly appreciated, as they help chip foes into its KO range.
